title: Eight rescued from drowning
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lanka Coastguard (SLCG) rescued eight locals from drowning over a three-day period ending on 4 March, SLCG said. Among them were five women, it said. All those rescued were between the ages of 26 and 33.  They were rescued due to the prompt action of lifesavers attached to SLCG’s life-saving posts operating on the beaches at Bentota and Gopalpuram, Trincomalee. Thus far for the year, SLCG has saved 41 from drowning including 12 foreigners, from 16 life-saving posts operating countrywide, the SLCG in said. (PA)

title: STF arrest drug dealer
author: Author not found
Content: Special Task Force officers, on a tip-off, raided a house in Magammana, Ragama and arrested a drug peddler, who had more than two kgs of Kerala Ganja, a digital scale, and Rs 68,000 cash in his possession. The suspect had been involved in drug dealing for a long time. The 29-year-old suspect, a resident on Ragama, was handed over to Mahabage Police for further investigation. The raid was carried out by a team led by Gonahena STF camp Special Operations Head, Chief Inspector S. D. P. N. Deshapriya. BY S. S. H. Lunuwila – Wadduwa

title: Two arrested over Panadura killing
author: Author not found
Content: Two suspects, including the gunman, wanted in connection with the murder of a businessman, who was found dead, with gunshot injuries, in his luxury vehicle at Pinwatta, Panadura recently, were arrested on Sunday (5), Police said. The victim was a 57-year-old resident of Bangalawatta, Kirillawala and he was found dead on 28 February inside his luxury vehicle. However, after conducting investigations, the Kalutara Crimes Division arrested the gunman and the motorcycle rider. Additionally, a pistol suspected to have been used in the shooting and eight bullets were seized based on information received during interrogation. The motorcycle used in the shooting was also found abandoned in Wadduwa. The arrested suspects were identified as 34-year-old and 40-year-old residents of Ginimallagaha. Police noted that they were detained for 48 hours after being produced before the Panadura Magistrate’s Court on Sunday (5). Investigations are underway to determine the motive behind the murder and how the suspects got access to the pistol and motorcycle. BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: Sri Lanka–India Environment Ministers meet in New Delhi
author: Author not found
Content: Environment Minister Naseer Ahamed met his Indian counterpart Bhupender Yadav, Union Minister of Environment, Forests and Climate Change, on the side-lines of the World Sustainable Development Summit held in New Delhi, India last week. Welcoming Minister Ahamed, the Indian Minister spoke of the cordial bilateral relationship the two countries are enjoying over centuries and reassured the continued support and assistance in future, too. Minister Ahamed conveyed his grateful appreciation for the recent economic and humanitarian support extended by India to Sri Lanka both during the period of the pandemic and in the economic crisis faced by Sri Lanka. Minister Ahamed also congratulated his counterpart on India’s G20 Presidency, which he referred to as an important achievement not only for India but to its close neighbours like Sri Lanka. In particular reference to India’s G20 Green Development Pact, Minister Ahamed said that India’s G20 Presidency is an opportunity to articulate an agenda for the Global South, to show the way ahead. Minister Ahamed hailed India’s External Affairs Minister’s recent remarks that India will closely consult developing States, within the framework of G20 Green Development Pact, to ensure food and energy security and equitable development. He assured Minister Yadav of Sri Lanka’s fullest support towards implementation of G20 Green Development Pact. Referring to President Ranil Wickremasinghe’s vision on Sri Lanka’s Green Development initiatives, Minister Ahamed said that Sri Lanka has earmarked an ambitious green transition programme covering green economy, blue economy and digital economy. However, he said Sri Lanka is facing challenges in the implementation of its National Environment Action Plan (NEAP) 2022-2030 and achievement of Nationally Determined Contributions (NDC) due to limitations in investments and expertise. He requested possible financial and technical support towards helping Sri Lanka in the implementation of NEAP and achievement of NDC targets. The Indian delegation responded that it will be possible for India to consider helping Sri Lanka if the two countries can enter into an MoU on Environmental and Climate Cooperation. Minister Ahamed responded positively and the two delegations agreed to work towards early signing of the MoU. The Deputy High Commissioner of Sri Lanka in India Niluka Kadurugamuwa and H.G.U. Pushpakumara, Minister of the Sri Lanka High Commission in New Delhi were amongst other members of Sri Lanka delegation. The Indian delegation also comprised high ranking officials of the Government of India including Richa Sharma, Additional Secretary of the Ministry of Environment, Forests & Climate Change.

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: MCB trained Mediation team makes history in Paris again
author: Author not found
Content: The team representing the Royal Institute of Colombo, comprising Binuri Weerasinghe, Santhush Pinto and Amana Imthiyas, coached and sponsored by The Moot Court Bench (MCB), secured the Special Award for Distinction in Mediation Advocacy at the 18th International Chamber of Commerce Commercial Mediation Competition Paris (ICC Paris) 2023. The team was introduced to Mediation through The MCB International Commercial Mediation Programme last year and trained by coaches Sadiyah Reyal (Partner at the MCB) and Alesia Ehrhardt. The prestigious Competition, organised annually by the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC), was held in Paris, France from 6 to 11 February, 2023. ICC Paris is a landmark mediation competition dedicated exclusively to training young advocates to resolve International Commercial Mediation disputes. Due to the pandemic, ICC Paris was held online for the 16th and 17th editions in 2021 and 2022 respectively. This year, it returned to Paris, bringing together 350+ students and coaches, 160+ professional mediators and academics, numerous volunteers, sponsors, and mediation enthusiasts from across the world. The team began their journey in June 2022, when they participated in the MCB’s annual International Commercial Mediation Programme consisting of a 24-Hour holistic training programme on Mediation and Mediation Advocacy skills, followed by the MCB National Commercial Mediation Competition, where Team RIC reigned as National Champions. Leading up to ICC Paris, the team was equipped by the MCB with robust training to sharpen their interest-based negotiation and mediation advocacy skills for several months, engaging in mock mediations and participating in numerous global competitions such as the Bucerius Law School Mediation Competition 2022 where the team ranked 10th amongst 24 international teams. During ICC Paris, the team competed alongside 47 student teams from across 29 countries, facilitated by world-renowned mediators to resolve international business disputes through mediation under the ICC Mediation Rules. Their performance was evaluated by some of the world’s leading dispute-resolution specialists who took part as judges and provided them with invaluable feedback to develop their skills further. This is the second consecutive year that an MCB ICC Team secured the Special Award for Mediation Advocacy at ICC Paris. Sri Lankan teams, supported by the MCB, have represented the country at this prestigious global platform for the past two years since 2022, thereby creating the foundation and momentum for continued growth and recognition of national talent at an international scale.

title: Over 400 sea turtle hatchlings released
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lanka Coastguard (SLCG) released a total of 419 sea turtle hatchlings into the sea in the week ended on 5 March. They were released from the SLCG Lifesaving units operating in the Balapitiya, Unawatuna and Panadura areas, in the review period, it said. The breakdown of the released sea turtle hatchlings were 205 from Balapitiya, 84 (Unawatuna) and 130 (Panadura). So far this year (2023), SLCG has 31,711 sea turtle eggs and released 3,151 hatchlings into the sea, the SLCG further said. Additionally in the week ended yesterday, SLCG lifesaving personnel attached to the SLCG units at Mirissa, Wellawatte, Panadura, Hikkaduwa and Mount Lavinia retrieved 3,961 sea turtles eggs from the territory close to their natural habitats. These eggs are being conserved and protected near those life-saving posts as well as from where those eggs have been found, SLCG said.  (PA)

title: DMC preparing plans to deal with quakes
author: Author not found
Content: Special plans will be put in place, in collaboration with the relevant institutions, to deal with any future earthquakes and to minimise the potential impacts and damages, Assistant Director of Media and Public Relation of the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) Janaka Handunpathiraja said yesterday (6). He said the National Building Research Organisation (NBRO), the Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB) and the DMC are conducting extensive studies in Moneragala and Buttala where minor tremors were recently felt, and that they are preparing to implement an effective plan. Accordingly, the people in those areas will be made aware of how to face a tremor situation and how to safeguard their lives. BY Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Fire breaks out in Kotagala furniture shop
author: Author not found
Content: A furniture shop and an adjoining house in Kotagala, Hatton were completely destroyed by a fire that broke out on 5 March around 9.30 p.m., Dimbula Pathana Police said. The buildings are located in the Wootan Bazar of Kotagala. Police estimated that fire has caused over Rs 30 million in damages. The shop owner and his wife were staying on the upper floor of the shop when the fire broke out. They were rescued unharmed. However, the Nuwara Eliya Municipal Council fire brigade had arrived at the scene after the fire was brought under control, resulting in a tense situation arising among the residents in the area over the delayed response. Dimbula Pathana Police suspect that the fire was due to electrical short circuit. BY Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Vote to elect interim Jaffna Mayor on 10 March
author: Author not found
Content: Voting to elect an interim Mayor to the Jaffna Municipal Council, for the second time, has been scheduled for 10 March. It will be chaired by Commissioner of Local Government of Northern Province, former Jaffna Mayor Viswalingam Manivannan said yesterday (5). The post fell vacant for the second time, following the resignation of interim Mayor Immanuel Arnold consequent to the defeat of his budget proposals for 2023, the former Mayor said. A Gazette Notification to hold the voting on 10 March has also been issued, Manivannan said. A special meeting of the Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) to select their interim Mayoral candidate was held at the party office at Martin Road Jaffna yesterday (5). Many party members were willing to nominate Solomon Syril to the post as the ITAK candidate. Political parties in the Jaffna MC were carrying out inter-party discussions as to whom they should field as Mayoral candidates from their party. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: World’s largest passenger plane refuels at BIA
author: Author not found
Content: The world’s largest passenger plane, the Airbus A380-800, arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) Katunayake for the third time in the early hours of 5 March 2023. EK 449 of Emirates Airline arrived at BIA at 3.10 a.m. on 5 March while flying from Auckland, New Zealand to Dubai. This passenger plane had also arrived at BIA in 2019, before the Covid-19 pandemic, This flight had 413 passengers and 29 crew members, and none of them got off the plane. If it is difficult for this plane to land at Dubai airport at the same time due to the foggy bad weather conditions in the area around Dubai airport these days, the pilots have decided that the fuel required for this plane to travel several laps in the skies of that airport will be obtained from BIA. The BIA Ceylon Petroleum Corporation station had taken steps to provide this aircraft with 62,800 litres of Jet A-1 fuel worth Rs 16.8 million. It took one hour and forty minutes, and after getting fuel, this plane took off from BIA at 4.50 a.m. on 5 March. BY T.K.G. Kapila – Katunayake

title: India will reimburse Katchchativu Feast expenses – Consul General
author: Author not found
Content: Rakesh Natraj, Consul General of India in Jaffna, said the Indian Government will take care of the funds that were spent for the annual feast of St. Anthony’s Church, Katchchativu. Responding to a query raised by a journalist regarding the support the Indian Government for the annual Katchchathivu feast, he said although preparations were undertaken by the Sri Lankan Government and the Sri Lankan Navy, the funding will be reimbursed by the Indian Government. “I cannot tell how much the funding will be because we don’t know the amount until the Sri Lankan authorities sends us the bills of the expenditure for the preparations and then our Government will reimburse it. Our Customs services and the Indian High Commission coordinated well with the Sri Lankan authorities,” he added. The Consul General expressed these views while attending the festive High Mass of the annual Katchchathivu St. Anthony’s feast on Saturday (4). Meanwhile, when inquired about Indian fishermen and their boats that were seized by local authorities, Natraj confirmed that there weren’t any Indian fisherman in Sri Lankan custody. He had ensured that following appropriate Court proceedings the Indian boats were returned to the owners. Story BY Nabiya Vaffoor from Katchchativu Island

title: SL’s electricity tariff second highest in Asia – Expert
author: Author not found
Content: Energy expert Dr. Tilak Siyambalapitiya said Sri Lanka has the second highest electricity tariff in Asia and the country’s rulers lack proper solutions to reduce the cost of electricity production. He also said no steps to get the country out of the crisis are being implemented. He said in the past, when the electricity tariff was raised, the political authority provided a clear explanation to the people, but this time there was no such explanation. He also highlighted that 500 megawatts would be obtained through fuel, with that amount coming from the Sampur Power Station. He raised these concerns during a programme co-hosted by the Sri Lanka Institute of Engineering, Northwest Branch, and the Ceylon Electricity Board, Engineers Union, over the Government’s claim that the increase in cost in such a context should be paid for by the people. BY Mithun Jayawardena

title: No Litro gas price hike
author: Author not found
Content: Litro Gas Lanka Ltd has decided not to raise domestic gas prices due to the strengthening of the Sri Lankan rupee against the US dollar. Litro Gas Lanka Ltd. Chairman Mudith Peiris said the domestic gas price should rise significantly in March 2023, based on the pricing formula and current global LPG prices. However, Litro Gas Lanka Ltd has decided not to raise domestic gas prices in light of the Sri Lankan rupee’s appreciation against the US dollar, thereby passing the benefit on to customers. The current prices are valid through March 2023. In Colombo, the current retail prices for 12.5 kg, 5 kg, and 2.3 kg are Rs 4749, Rs 1904, and Rs 883, respectively. (TR)

title: Three tiger cubs celebrate 1st birthday
author: Author not found
Content: The first birthday of the three male Bengal tiger cubs, Akira, Dio, and Duma, born on 5 March 2022 to  Robin and Kella was celebrated yesterday (5) at the Dehiwala Zoo premises. The celebration was organised by Zoo staff under the supervision of Dr. Thilak Premakantha, Director General of the National Zoological Gardens. Robin and Kella were transferred to the Dehiwala  Zoo in 2006 from the Xiangjin Shapari Park in China as part of an animal exchange programme. However, Kella, the 15-year-old Bengal Tiger passed away on 5 September 2022 after a long battle with cancer. She was diagnosed with a cancer that spreads through the neck, which had contributed to her health deteriorating and culminating in her death. BY Vidyan Pathirana

title: Ruwanpura Colony residents get electricity shocks
author: Author not found
Content: Consumers in the Ruwanpura Colony, Hatton received their electricity bill 40 days after it was supposed to arrive. The colony is administered by the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Ginigathhena Area Office. The electricity consumers complain that the metre reader issued the electricity bill for the month of February 2023 after 40 days, and the electricity bill has become extremely high for the colony’s electricity consumers. CEB should issue the monthly electricity bill to electricity consumers once every 30 days. The electricity bill for the month of January was issued to the colony’s electricity consumers on either 22 or 23 January 2023. The metre reader then issued the electricity bill for the month of February 2023 on 4 March, 40 days later. Hatton Ruwanpura Colony electricity consumers lamented that the electricity bill has increased excessively due to an increase in the number of electricity units and the bill has been calculated concurrently with the increased electricity tariff, which was supposed to go into effect on 15 February 2023. Those electricity customers said they cannot afford this electricity bill because agriculture is their way of life, and that they must pay a higher price than the electricity bill they received for their homes in the previous months through the new bill. When inquired about the issue of the electricity bill after 40 days from the Ruwanpura Colony metre reader, he did not say anything, and the metre reader told them that he would issue the electricity bill once every 30 days beginning with the March bill. BY Neeta PathmaKumari – Hatton

title: Title not found
author: Author not found
Content: Date:  Jathika Jana Balawegaya member, Attorney-at-Law Sunil Watagala urged the political authority and the relevant officials to make arrangements to hold the Local Government Election, respecting the verdict of the Supreme Court. Watagala addressing the media recently said the Elections Commission has been made a respondent in the case and that if the Elections Commission was on people’s side, they should fix an early date for the election. He said if the verdict of the Supreme Court was disregarded, all the responsible officials would have to pay the penalty for contempt of Court. Watagala said the State officials, including the Treasury Secretary, the Attorney General and IGP also have to abide by the interim order. “If you want a few more days, at least take this election to the first week of April. If not, great prejudice will be done to political movements and independent groups. Campaign had been conducted over thirty days after depositing money and handing over the nominations. If the Election Commission decides to grant a longer date, it cannot prevent wrath of the citizens of the country, political parties and independent groups,” he stressed. Meanwhile, Jathika Jana Balawegaya General Secretary Dr. Nihal Abeysinghe requested the Election Commission to make arrangements for the Local Government election as soon as possible in accordance with the Supreme Court order and also to fix a date as soon as possible for the holding of the local government election. In the letter written to the Election Commission Chairman on 4 March, Abeysinghe stated that according to the interim orders issued, it appears that the Supreme Court has acted on the importance of holding the local government election considering it as a basic human right.Therefore, he requested the Chairman to fix a date to hold the LG polls as soon as possible. BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi Popular

title: SLSI logo must for locally produced canned fish
author: Author not found
Content: The Sri Lanka Standards Institution (SLSI) has issued a statement stating that all canned fish produced in Sri Lanka must bear the SLS logo. The SLSI also stated that information from various media outlets has revealed that local canned fish products do not have the standard certificate. If there are any complaints or information regarding the absence of the SLS logo on locally produced canned fish they can be forwarded to the Consumer Affairs Authority and if there is a quality problem in the certified canned fish, complaints can be made directly to the SLSI, according to the announcement. Furthermore, it stated that imported canned fish is available in the local market and that the SLS logo is not required for them, and that this is because imported canned fish can be easily identified because the country of manufacture is mentioned on the label. According to reports, imported canned fish will be subjected to a laboratory test by the SLSI prior to port Customs clearance, after which they will be released from customs. The Sri Lanka Standard Certificate has been issued for 37 brands belonging to 14 local canned fish production firms, and the SLSI will notify the Consumer Affairs Authority about the canned fish brands and related manufacturers who have received the SLS certificate. BY Mithun Jayawardena

title: Gold prices dip
author: Author not found
Content: The price of 22 carat gold has dropped by Rs 17,000 per sovereign and 24 carat gold has dropped by Rs 14,500 per sovereign. The treasurer of the Ceylon Jewellery Association, R. Balasubramaniam said yesterday (5) the reason for the price drop was the market strengthening of the rupee against the dollar. BY Mithun Jayawardena

title: Title not found
author: Author not found
Content: Date:  Jathika Jana Balawegaya member, Attorney-at-Law Sunil Watagala urged the political authority and the relevant officials to make arrangements to hold the Local Government Election, respecting the verdict of the Supreme Court. Watagala addressing the media recently said the Elections Commission has been made a respondent in the case and that if the Elections Commission was on people’s side, they should fix an early date for the election. He said if the verdict of the Supreme Court was disregarded, all the responsible officials would have to pay the penalty for contempt of Court. Watagala said the State officials, including the Treasury Secretary, the Attorney General and IGP also have to abide by the interim order. “If you want a few more days, at least take this election to the first week of April. If not, great prejudice will be done to political movements and independent groups. Campaign had been conducted over thirty days after depositing money and handing over the nominations. If the Election Commission decides to grant a longer date, it cannot prevent wrath of the citizens of the country, political parties and independent groups,” he stressed. Meanwhile, Jathika Jana Balawegaya General Secretary Dr. Nihal Abeysinghe requested the Election Commission to make arrangements for the Local Government election as soon as possible in accordance with the Supreme Court order and also to fix a date as soon as possible for the holding of the local government election. In the letter written to the Election Commission Chairman on 4 March, Abeysinghe stated that according to the interim orders issued, it appears that the Supreme Court has acted on the importance of holding the local government election considering it as a basic human right.Therefore, he requested the Chairman to fix a date to hold the LG polls as soon as possible. BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi Popular

title: Mother pushes toddler into shrimp tank
author: Author not found
Content: A woman is reported to have pushed her 1 1/2 year old daughter into a shrimp tank following an argument with her husband. It was reported that the woman is the wife of a labourer working at a shrimp farm in the Kattakaduwa, Udappuwa and had done it to take revenge against her husband. According to hospital sources , the child is being treated at the Intensive care unit of the Kurunegala Hospital and  her condition is said to be getting better.  The mother was arrested by the Udappuwa police on 4 March.

title: TNA threatens massive protests in North, East
author: Author not found
Content: The Tamil National Alliance threatened to call for massive protests and non-violent struggles across the Northern and Eastern provinces if the Government fails to hold the scheduled Local Government (LG) elections. Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) Batticaloa District MP Shanakiyan Rasamanickam said they only have one thing to say to President Ranil Wickramesinghe, “hold the LG Election as soon as possible in order to meet the people’s demand for an election.” “We cannot be duped by making up excuses. If the LG Election is not held, the TNA is prepared to demonstrate its power in the Northern and Eastern Provinces,” he said.  MP Rasamanickam made these threats in relation to the postponement of elections and the harm done to the country’s democracy. Rasamanickam said a responsible minister had made an irresponsible statement that they did not want assistance from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) because they can earn enough US dollars from a large number of Chinese tourists. “Former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa took a similar stance. Finally, he was forced to leave office before completing his first term as President. President Wickremesinghe must remember that the samething will happen to him as well,” he said. BY Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Principal arrested over sexual abuse of minor
author: Author not found
Content: The Principal of a school located in Pinnawala, Balangoda was arrested for sexually abusing a school girl. Police said the victim was an 11-year-old girl residing near the suspect’s house. Preliminary investigations had revealed that the suspect had taken the girl to a store and bought her food. He had then taken the girl to a nearby abandoned building and abused her. According to the Police the incident had taken place in January 2023. However, the complaint had being lodged in this regard on 4 March. Accordingly, Balangoda Police arrested the suspect on Saturday (4). The victim was hospitalised and the suspect was remanded until 7 March by the Balangoda Magistrate’s Court yesterday (5). Balangoda Police are conducting further investigations. BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: INDIAN EGG CONSIGNMENT HITS SNAG
author: Author not found
Content: Senior Adviser of the All Ceylon Poultry Businessmen’s Association, Mathali Jayasekara said the Government has been unable to obtain assurances from the Central Government of India that there is no avian flu risk. He was referring to the import of eggs from India. He said the scheduled egg consignment which was supposed to arrive in Sri Lanka last week was yet to arrive due to the Government’s failure to obtain the assurance and approval of the Central Government of India. Addressing the media, Jayasekara said the Indian Government was not giving any assurances that there was no avian flu because India is a member of the World Poultry Science Association and if any problem or issue arises, India could be blacklisted. “Because of this, the Indian Government was not approving the scheduled egg shipment to leave its shores. Egg prices will certainly rise but if the Government can provide the required raw material, egg production was possible and meeting the local demand was no problem,” he said. Jayasekara said there has never been an egg scarcity ever before in this country and that small and medium-scale egg producers have now left the industry due to the shortage of raw material. He warned that if the situation persists, there may be an egg shortage during the holiday season. BY Thameenah Razeek

title: Cattle die from skin disease in K’nochchi
author: Author not found
Content: According to Kilinochchi cattle farmers more than 30 cattle have died as a result of a disease spreading among cattle in the district. Farmers claim that blisters can be seen all over their bodies and that some were dying when the blisters burst and caused injuries. Farmers reported that the disease has affected more than 250 cattle in the four Divisional Secretariat Divisions of the Kilinochchi District and the number affected may rise because the true figures have not yet been arrived at. Cowpox was also said to be gradually spreading in the district, according to district veterinary officers. Farmers said insufficient medicine in veterinary offices to treat the disease was one of the main causes. In the last season it is reported that nearly 3,000 cattle died in the Kilinochchi District due to extreme cold weather conditions. BY N. Priyadarshani – Vavuniya

title: Ten nabbed with heroin
author: Author not found
Content: Ten people were apprehended with over 39 grammes of heroin in their possession, during a special Police raid in Kandy. As a result, six men and four women were arrested on Saturday (4). They were identified as individuals aged 26 to 52 living in Kandy, Digana, Mahayiyawa, Suduhumpola, and Katugastota. Kandy Police will conduct additional investigations. BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: CEB restructuring plans being expedited
author: Author not found
Content: The audit required for human resource management, asset management, and financial management essential to restructure the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) were being expedited, a spokesman said. A meeting was held recently with members of the CEB Restructuring Committee and senior officials, including the Chairman, General Manager, Additional General Managers and Chief Financial Manager to discuss the restructuring process and solicit suggestions. The emphasis was on restructuring plans that could be implemented before the new draft Bill is presented to Parliament, he said and added the requirements to maintain separate accounts and activities, in the zones designated for electricity distribution, will be completed as the first part. It was also decided to speed up audits for human resource management, asset management, and financial management, all of which are required for restructuring, he further said. Proposals to increase the use of technology in this programme, increase efficiency, and reduce costs were discussed in detail and the higher control authority advised Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera that a general restructuring was required.

title: Motorbike tragedy kills two
author: Author not found
Content: Two persons succumbed to injuries following a fatal motorcycle accident on the Dekatana – Radawana Road on 4 March. A motorcycle travelling from Dekatana towards Radawana toppled when the rider lost control of the motorcycle. The rider had been dragged along with the motorcycle and crashed into a van travelling in the opposite direction. The rider and the pillion rider were admitted to the Dompe Hospital, but both were pronounced dead on admission. The deceased were identified as 42-year-old and 44-year-old residents of Radawana. The driver of the van was taken into Police custody and Dompe Police are conducting investigations. BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: SL has world’s eighth highest food inflation rate -WB
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lanka (SL) with a food inflation rate of 60 per cent, has the eighth highest food inflation rate in the world, a World Bank (WB) report, showed. The seven countries in descending order which have a higher food inflation rate than Sri Lanka are Zimbabwe (264 per cent), Venezuela (158 per cent), Lebanon (143 per cent), Argentina (98 per cent) and  Türkiye (70 per cent)and  Suriname  and Ghana (61 per cent each), respectively. Sri Lanka is among 24 countries globally and only one among three Asian countries, the other two being Afghanistan Pakistan, which have been identified as a ‘hunger hotspot countries’, in a recent World Food Programme (WFP)-Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO) report, the WB warned. ‘In Sri Lanka, total 2022 (last year’s) paddy production was 32 per cent below the average production of the previous three years and was at its lowest level since the 2017 drought-affected harvest. The World Food Programme (WFP) estimates that 37 per cent of Sri Lankan households were food insecure in November 2022, the WB report warned. (PA)

title: Cache of buried explosives found
author: Author not found
Content: Palai Police said a cache of explosives was discovered in a garden in Kilinochchi, Palai on 4 March. According to the Police, the explosives were discovered while a landowner was digging his garden. In relation to the incident, the Palai Police had conducted an investigation based on orders issued by the Kilinochchi Magistrate Court. The STF Bomb Disposal Team discovered two hand grenades, 104 T-56 ammunition in a decaying state and some parts of green clothing during an inspection of the location where the explosives were discovered. The security forces believe that the cache of explosives had been buried by the LTTE during the war, with the intention of using. On the orders of the Kilinochchi Magistrate’s Court, the explosives are to be defused. The Palai Police are conducting additional investigations into the incident. BY N. Priyadarshani – Vavuniya

title: More Lankans obese – Dr Gunawardana
author: Author not found
Content: Consultant Community Physician, of the Non-Communicable Diseases Unit, of the Health Ministry, Dr. Shanthi Gunawardana said there was a marked increase in obesity amongst the Sri Lankan population. Addressing the media, at the Health Promotion Bureau (HPB) yesterday (2), on ‘Changing Perspectives: Let’s talk about obesity’ for World Obesity Prevention Day, Dr. Gunawardana said that 22.5 per cent of men had been obese or overweight according to a survey carried out in 2015. It had risen to 30 per cent by 2021. The survey carried out by the NCD Unit every five years, to assess the NCD risk factors, had revealed that 34 per cent of women, were obese or over weight in 2015. It had increased to 48 per cent, by 2021, she said. Considering the figures, overweight and obesity among men and women had increased when compared to 2015. There was an increase of 6.3 per cent amongst men and a 15 per cent among women. The Consultant Community Physician explained that ‘overweight’ and ‘obesity’ were decided based on the Body Mass Index (BMI). According to the World Health Organisation (WHO), the BMI of a healthy person should be between 18.5 and 24.9. Those below 18.5 were malnourished. A BMI between 25 and 29.9 was considered as ‘overweight’, she noted. “It affects weight gain. This increases the risk of developing non-communicable diseases later on,” Dr. Gunawardana added. A BMI of 30 or more was considered obese, Dr, Gunawardana said. “As Asians we should try to maintain a BMI of 23 making sure that it did not exceed it,” she added. “If the amount consumed is higher than the amount exhausted, that excess amount deposits in the body as oil,” Dr. Gunawardana said adding that the food pattern led to obesity and overweight increasing the risk of heart diseases, diabetes, lung diseases and certain types of cancers. By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: UK says SL should address justice and accountability
author: Author not found
Content: At the ongoing 42nd Universal Periodic Review (UPR) of Sri Lanka’s human rights, the Permanent Representative of the United Kingdom, to the UN in Geneva, emphasised the importance of reconciliation, justice and accountability for all communities, independent domestic institutions and the preservation of civil society space. The importance of repealing the Prevention of Terrorism Act was underlined. The UK also made a few recommendations, like allowing all communities to freely commemorate and memorialise victims of the civil war. They welcomed Sri Lanka’s commitments to respect the rights of those from all religious and ethnic groups and the efforts to foster political inclusion and constitutional reform. In one of their recommendations, they urged to repeal sections 365 and 365A of the Penal Code, end the criminalisation of same-sex conduct and ensure equality and non-discrimination in relation to sexual orientation and gender identity. The UK also said to address concerns around land expropriation in the North and East by government departments, including the Archaeological department, and related restrictions on access to land. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: Student hospitalised after being assaulted
author: Author not found
Content: A student of Monty Gopallawa Maha Vidyalaya, Naula was admitted to the Ambana Divisional Hospital after he was allegedly assaulted by the Principal of the school, for not taking two gas cylinders in the school building to the Principal’s residence.  The student was later transferred to Dambulla Base Hospital. His parents complained about this stating that the Principal had told him to carry two gas cylinders from the school building to the Principal’s private residence.  However, he had responded to the principal, claiming that he was engaging in sports practice and that he would attend to principal’s request after practice. Nevertheless, the Principal had assaulted him with a club. Principal S.M. Nimal Bandara said he lost his temper when the student concerned refused to comply with his request and that the students should obey the teachers. However, he said he did not assault the student through hatred but he realised its seriousness later. Meanwhile, the parents alleged several individuals were interfering with investigations and attempting to brush their complaint under the carpet through senior Police officers and top officials.  BY K.K. Ariyadasa – Dambulla

title: UK updates travel advisory as SL faces nationwide strikes
author: Author not found
Content: The UK Government stated, in its most recent travel advisory on Sri Lanka, updated on 2 March that there may be roadblocks and major disruption to essential services such as healthcare due to a nationwide strike and reminded UK travellers that it is more important than ever to obtain appropriate travel insurance and ensure it provides adequate coverage. The travel advisory further said that Sri Lanka is experiencing a severe economic crisis, which has led to shortages of basic necessities, including medicines, cooking gas, fuel and food. The major shortage of fuel (diesel and petrol) is affecting transport, businesses, and emergency services. Hospitals and other medical services such as ambulances may be affected by shortages. There are daily power cuts due to electricity rationing.  Protests about the economic situation have led to violence against peaceful protesters in recent months, resulting in injuries and loss of life. Tear gas and water cannon have been used to disperse protesters. Protests, demonstrations, roadblocks and violent unrest could occur at short notice. Curfews and emergency regulations may also be imposed. You should be vigilant, avoid large gatherings and keep up to date with developments via this travel advice and local media. What remains still current on 2 March 2023 in the UK travel advisory is that terrorists are likely to try to carry out attacks in Sri Lanka. Attacks could be indiscriminate, including in places visited by foreigners. Also, they continue to warn that Dengue fever occurs throughout the country. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: JJB in pact with Govt to postpone LG polls – SJB
author: Author not found
Content: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) alleged that the Jathika Jana Balawegaya (JJB) had entered into an agreement with the Government to postpone the Local Government Elections by a year. Addressing the media yesterday (2) SJB MP Nalin Bandara alleged that the JJB held only one protest, against the postponement of the election, as a mere political gimmick. “We heard JJB Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake saying that his party would give a period of one year for the Government to hold the LG election. One wonders whether this would mean that JJB has entered into an agreement with the government to postpone the poll. It is only the SJB that has done its utmost to avoid the postponement of the election. Bandara expressed concern that the Election Commission would refrain from announcing the new date of the local polls today (3).  Bandara added that the EC Chairman assured that he will announce the new date for the election today (3), however, he fears that it would not be done. By Nabiya Vaffoor

title: Free diesel for paddy farmers
author: Author not found
Content: The Department of Agrarian Development commenced the distribution of 6.98 million litres of fuel, free-of-charge, to paddy farmers yesterday (2). According to Minister of Agriculture Mahinda Amaraweera, Chinese Government donated 6.98 million litres of diesel is to be distributed amongst paddy farmers. However, the process was delayed due to the several administrative issues, he said. Amaraweera thereby instructed relevant officials to arrange for the distribution of this stock of fuel free to farmers immediately. Accordingly, the Department of Agrarian Development on Wednesday (1), completed issuing tokens to make it more convenient for farmers to get fuel and they can now obtain their fuel quota from designated filling stations. Thus, farmers who have cultivated paddy on half an acre to two and a half acres are entitled to this fuel concession and measures have been taken to distribute 15 litres of diesel per hectare. (FT)

title: Police launch programme to reduce road mishaps
author: Author not found
Content: A programme to educate drivers and pedestrians, on how to reduce road accidents in the Western Province, is currently underway under the instructions and guidance of the Deputy Inspector General of Police in charge of the Western Province Traffic Division. This programme which commenced on 1 March is expected to continue till 31 March covering all Police Divisions in the Western Province. Priority will be given to raise awareness regarding basic traffic offences. Accordingly, driving without a licence, individuals under 18 years driving, driving without the revenue and insurance licence, violating traffic rules, common mistakes done at roundabouts will be discussed in these sessions. Additionally, mistakes frequently evident at pedestrian crossings, traffic lights and bus halts will also be discussed, the Police Media Unit said. BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: Plans made to hold 59 summits on STEAM education
author: Author not found
Content: Education Minister Susil Premajayantha said 59 summits will be held in the nine provinces, on 31 March 2023, to discuss the inclusion of STEAM Education. He said STEAM education, which is currently in use in the modern world, but not popular in Sri Lanka, is required in the country’s new educational transformation process. Premajayantha said plans have been made to hold 59 summits, with the main event taking place at the New Theatre, Colombo. He emphasised this at ‘Perceptions ‘23’ art exhibition held at Thurstan College, Colombo. The Minister also noted that children have the necessary knowledge and adults’ attitudes should be changed, not children’s. He pointed out that the direction of education should be changed and the educational transformation process in the future is expected to produce inventors with balanced knowledge, mental development and skills. “All related institutions work together to provide vocational education to all the children who drop out of traditional school education. It is the responsibility of parents to show the path to the children who drop out of school education for this. The Ministry of Education is working, in spite of many economic challenges, to bring much needed educational reforms,” he added. Furthermore, the Minister said it is possible to conduct the GCE Advanced Level examination without any problem and to maintain welfare services such as providing school textbooks and uniforms with good management.

title: Airman, another arrested over robbery of firearm
author: Author not found
Content: Two suspects, including a soldier of the Sigiriya Air Force Base, were arrested for stealing a T-56 firearm and two magazines, containing 60 rounds of ammunition, from the camp. The arrests were made by the Homicide and Organised Crime Investigation Division on 1 March. According to the Police, the Sigiriya Police had received a complaint that a T-56 duty firearm, two magazines and magazine holder, which were in the possession of a soldier had gone missing while he was resting on duty in a security booth at the Sigiriya Air Force base on 4 November 2022. Shortly after that the investigation was handed over to the Homicide and Organised Crime Investigation Division and the magazine holder was found near the air force base. It was revealed that the firearm was stolen by a soldier of the same base and based on that information the suspect was arrested at the Sigiriya Air Force Base. Another person, who aided the main suspect, was also arrested in Ridigama. The arrested suspects are identified as 32 and 37-year-old residents of Kurunegala and Rideegama, respectively. Investigtaions had revealed that after the theft the main suspect had erased the serial number of the firearm by using a grinder. The suspects are to be produced before the Dambulla Magistrate’s Court and investigations are continuing. BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: Kerosene sales up after price reduction
author: Author not found
Content: Employees at fuel dispensing stations claim that kerosene sales have increased as the price has dropped. The price of a litre of kerosene, which previously stood at Rs 355 has been reduced by Rs 50 to Rs 305. At the same time, the revised price of industrial kerosene, which previously stood at Rs 464 is now Rs 330 following a reduction of Rs 134. Price of petrol 92 Octane, 95 Octane EURO 4, Clear Diesel, and Super Diesel 4 Star Euro 4 will remain unchanged for the time being, according to a Ceylon Petroleum Corporation statement. The plantation community said it is not enough to reduce the price of kerosene by 50 rupees. They say it should be given at Rs 150. With the price increase, the plantation community stated that they had reduced their use of kerosene. BY Neeta Pathma Kumari – Norwood

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Police probe Pera Uni student’s death
author: Author not found
Content: A fourth-year student of the Engineering Faculty, of University of Peradeniya, had died while receiving treatment for an illness at the Peradeniya Hospital. The student was a 26-year-old resident of Ridigama, Kurunegala. Police said that the student was admitted to the hospital on 28 February due to an illness and she passed away on 1 March. Peradeniya Police are conducting investigations to determine whether the student had taken or had been given an overdose of the medicines which were prescribed for her. BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: Moratuwa Uni TU leads protest
author: Author not found
Content: The Moratuwa University Trade Union led a protest in front of University yesterday (2). During the lunch hour, trade unions joined forces to demand a reduction in bank interest, protection of free education and a reduction in the tax burden. Apart from the University of Moratuwa teaching staff, 11 professional associations participated in the protest. BY Iranga Fernando – Moratuwa

title: Putting off LG polls demonstrates Govt’s political bankruptcy – Rasamanickam
author: Author not found
Content: The postponement of the Local Government election demonstrates the incumbent Government’s political bankruptcy and reluctance to face an election, ITAK Batticaloa District MP Shanakiyan Rasamanickam said yesterday (2). He said anti-government protests and struggles have begun in various parts of the country. “Few days ago a Pradeshiya Sabha member of Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) had been killed. Holding the LG polls on the due date, as announced earlier, is the only solution to every issue,” Rasamanickam added. Meanwhile, he noted that Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) is becoming more popular and its influence among the Tamil people, especially those who are in the Northern and Eastern Provinces, is increasing day by day. Rasamanickam also claimed that seeing the influence and staggering growth of ITAK among the people President Ranil Wickremesinghe was worried. It can be understood from the Gazette notification issued by him, he added. Rasamanickam made these claims during a special meeting with ITAK active members and candidates in the Local Government (LG) Election and party supporters in Trincomalee. Rasamanickam said the ITAK will very soon transform itself to be a party which would be able to win the political rights and aspirations of Tamil community. “Postponing of the LG Election, which was to be held on 9 March clearly highlights the political bankruptcy of Government and its reluctance to face an election. The government was losing its hold in the political arena of the South too,” He said. BY Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Trio nabbed illegally mining for gems
author: Author not found
Content: Maskeliya Police arrested three people on 1 March, from the Brunswick Estate in Maskeliya, for allegedly engaging in illegal gem mining at a location within the estate. Following a tip-off the Maskeliya Police arrived at the location and arrested the suspects. Police also seized the tools and equipment used by them. The suspects, aged 29, 32, and 65 years old, were Maskeliya residents. They suspects were granted bail and ordered to appear in Hatton Magistrate Court on 8 March. BY Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Nabbed with Kerala cannabis
author: Author not found
Content: A person was apprehended in possession of Kerala cannabis in the Sangupiddi area of Jaffna. The street value of the 4kg, seized stock of Kerala cannabis, is believed to be over Rs 1 million. The suspect was apprehended while transporting two parcels stuffed with the cannabis by  bus, during a combined search conducted by the Navy and Police at the Sangupiddi roadblock in the evening of 1 March.  The search was carried out by SLNS Welusumana in the Northern Naval Command in coordination with the Punakari Police. The search led to the arrest of the suspect travelling in a Mannar bound bus from Jaffna.  The suspect has been identified as a resident of the Analathivu Island in Jaffna, aged 26. He was handed over along with the Kerala cannabis to the Punakari Police. (NV)

title: Sri Lanka Navy prepares for annual Kachchativu Feast
author: Author not found
Content: The annual Kachchativu Feast is set to take place today and tomorrow (3 and 4 March) on the Kachchativu Island. The main Mass of the annual feast will be celebrated by the Bishop of Jaffna Diocese, Rt. Rev. Justin Gnanapragasam. In the backdrop, where the District Secretary of Jaffna has made necessary arrangements for the event, the Sri Lanka Navy is working in full swing to establish infrastructure and facilities for the convenience of devotees. On the directives of Commander of the Navy, Vice Admiral Priyantha Perera and under the supervision of Commander Northern Naval Area, Rear Admiral Aruna Tennekoon, the Navy is currently engaged in providing infrastructure facilities, installation of sanitary and drinking water facilities, temporary tents, roads, jetties as well as electricity, in view of the annual feast. Apart from that, Sri Lanka Navy lifesaving teams and medical teams, with a temporary Sick Bay, have been deployed for the safety and security of the devotees attending the annual festival. Further, the Navy has undertaken colour washing and repairs of the shrine built by the Sri Lanka Navy and cleaning of the surrounding area and roads leading to the premises. Meanwhile, a large number of Indian and Sri Lankan devotees are expected to participate in this annual festival. As excitement is building, for what promises to be a memorable and meaningful event, the Navy has made all arrangements in place to ferry priests, government officials, dignitaries, devotees, local and foreign journalists as well as equipment needed for the celebration of the festive Mass, from Kurikadduwan Jetty to the Kachchativu islet. (NV)

title: Sri Lanka stagnates at 146th position
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lanka’s rankings in World Bank’s (WB’s) ‘Women, Business and the Law 2022 Index’ remained unchanged at 146th position out of 190 countries over its previous year’s (2021) rankings with an unchanged score of 65.6 points out of a possible 100, the WB’s latest ranking in this regard, released yesterday (1) showed. Higher scores indicate greater equality vis-à-vis employment and entrepreneurial opportunities for women versus men and lower scores, the obverse. ‘Gender equality is essential to end extreme poverty and boost shared prosperity,’ the report quoting WB’s Chief Economist and Senior Vice President Carmen M. Reinhart, said. The WB defined ‘Women, Business and the Law ‘as an index that measures laws and regulations that affect women’s economic opportunity in 190 economies.  ‘In this regard, this project presents eight indicators structured around women’s interactions with the law as they progress through their lives and careers: Mobility, Workplace, Pay, Marriage, Parenthood, Entrepreneurship Assets, and Pension,’ it said. The indicators build evidence of the critical relationship between ‘legal gender equality’ and ‘women’s employment and entrepreneurship,’ the report added. Meanwhile, 12 countries had the perfect score of 100 out of 100 in this latest index, meaning that both men and women have equal opportunities as employees and businesspersons. They were, in alphabetical order, Belgium, Canada, Denmark, France, Greece, Iceland, Ireland, Latvia, Luxembourg, Portugal, Spain and Sweden. In related developments in the SAARC region, three countries had higher ratings/points than Sri Lanka. They were Nepal (80.6 points), India (74.4) and Maldives (73.8). Nepal was 93rd and 94th equal out of 190 countries together with Kenya, India (124th) and Maldives (126th). In the previous year 2021 too these three countries scored the same number of points as at last year, namely 80.6, 74.4 and 73.8 points respectively. Last year, Sri Lanka shares the 146th and 147th positions with Marshall Islands, whereas in 2021 Sri Lanka occupied the 146th position and Marshall Islands (140th), respectively. Three other SAARC countries scored lower points than Sri Lanka last year. They were Pakistan (55.6 points), Bangladesh (49.4) and Afghanistan (38.1), respectively. These three countries scored the same number of points in 2021 as well. Bhutan, the only other SAARC country, has not been captured in either of these surveys. By Paneetha Ameresekere

title: Govt warns tax evaders
author: Author not found
Content: The Commissioner General of Inland Revenue has been directed to take immediate action to identify those working in specific professions who have failed to pay taxes and not provided proof of income. State Minister of Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya gave these instructions at a meeting held yesterday (1) with officials of the Inland Revenue Department at the Ministry of Finance. In light of the increased emphasis on State revenue, Siyambalapitiya informed the Commissioner General of Inland Revenue that attention should be paid to identifying tax evaders, in addition to collecting revenue through taxation. The State Minister has also advised the Department to prepare a system to deal with relevant personnel and take prompt action. Problems related to collection of tax revenue were also discussed. (TR)
