title: Court issues notice on Atamasthana Adhipathi
author: Author not found
Content: Anuradhapura District Judge and Additional Magistrate Nadeeka D. Piyarathna issued notice on Atamasthana Adhipathi Ven. Pallegama Hemarathana Nayaka Thera and the Atamasthana Karaka Sabhawa to appear before Court on 8 February, following a petition filed by a businessman in Anuradhapura that he has the right to own two luxury jeeps used by the late Atamasthanaadhipathi, Ven. Pallegama Sirinivasa Nayaka Thera. The petitioner, Pelimuhandiram Appuhamilage Chandananda, claimed that he had a close bond with the Late Atamasthana adhipathi Nayaka Thera for the last 19 years. When the Late Nayaka Thera was sick, he was the one who took care of him and took the latter to specialist doctors. As a result, the Late Nayaka Thera trusted him very much. Therefore, the two luxury jeeps in question which were bought by the Late Nayaka Thera from his personal money were given to him with legal documentations, the petitioner claimed. However, after the Nayaka Thera passed away, the current Atamasthana Adhipathi Nayaka Thera and the respondents have claimed the two vehicles are a property of Atamasthanaya and sent a letter to the Director General of Motor Traffic not to hand over the ownership of the vehicles to anyone, by providing ‘false information,’ the petitioner alleged. BY Upali Ananada Karunadasa – Anuradhapura

title: Rid yourselves of political slavery – Fr Cyril Gamini
author: Author not found
Content: Citizens of this country should rid themselves of ‘political slavery’ when voting at the Local Government Poll, Spokesman for the Colombo Archdiocese, Rev. Fr. Cyril Gamini Fernando said yesterday (09).  Fielding questions at a media briefing, he said that it was high time that Sri Lankans thought ‘out of the box’ and not vote for a one single party based on their ancestral affiliations to .that party and its colour. “Do not think of personal gain,” he urged noting that things were made even more  easy when making a decision as those who contest are those from one’s own area. People tend to know who the criminal is and who the corrupt person is, he said. Therefore it is up to the people not to vote for political parties that have been unable to cleanse themselves of those with records of criminal and corrupt actions, Fr. Fernando said urging the public to set aside party politics to ensure that the people do not continue to suffer as a result of the local government they appoint.      By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: CBK should be held responsible for LTTE attacks – Dayasiri
author: Author not found
Content: If former President and SLFP leader Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga’s allegation that the present SLFP leader and former President Maithripala Sirisena should be held responsible for the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks, in the same vein, Chandrika Bandaranaike should be held responsible for the several LTTE attacks that took place during her tenure of office, SLFP General Secretary MP Dayasiri Jayasekara said Jayasekara, in his statement condemned the charge made by Chandrika Bandaranaike, where she had allegedly faulted Sirisena for the 21 April 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks. Jayasekara in his statement alleged that Bandaranaike, speaking to the media on Sunday, had held Sirisena responsible for the Easter Sunday terror attacks which took place when Sirisena was President. The General Secretary said that Bandaranaike had made this accusation at the 124th Birth Anniversary Commemoration Ceremony of the founder leader of the SLFP S.W.R.D. Bandaranaike held at Galle Face, Colombo, near his statue. Jayasekara said that Kumaratunga was President from November 1994 to November 2005. During this 11-year period a number of LTTE terror attacks took place killing several civilians and maiming scores of others, whilst causing damage to public property. A few of those attacks was the destruction of the Kolonnawa oil tanks in 1995, attacks on the Central Bank of Sri Lanka in 1996, attacks on a train carrying civilians in Dehiwela, attacks on the World Trade Centre and the Dalada Maligawa and an attack on her, herself, where she lost an eye. If her argument, that Sirisena is responsible for the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks hold water, in the same vein, Chandrika Bandaranaike should be held responsible for the several LTTE attacks that took place during her tenure of office, Jayasekara said.  (PA)

title: No one has the right to insult sacred places – Fr Cyril Gamini
author: Author not found
Content: Editor of the Sinhala Catholic Publication, ‘Gnanaratha Pradeepaya,’ Fr. Cyril Gamini Fernando said that no one has the right to insult “sacred and religious places which were followed by others.” Addressing the media in Colombo, Fr. Fernando said “No one has the right to insult a religion or a sacred place belonging to another religion, followed by fellow citizens.” Referring to the allegedly blasphemy by Sepala Amarasinghe of the Temple of the Tooth Relic, he said, “We don’t underestimate a person’s right to express him or herself, but one should not insult a place of worship.” Media is the platform where people express their views and it is up to it to have reign over it. “We believe the media should be allowed to create and maintain their own ethics,” he said, noting that freedom of expression and speech were necessary. “But we must understand that there were limits to that freedom.”  “That means we do not have the right to accuse, hurt or harass others,” Fr. Fernando added. By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: Mervyn threatened to kill me – Nilantha
author: Author not found
Content: Nilantha Ranasinghe, a representative of the Surakimu Dalada Organisation, has lodged a complaint with the Police charging that former Minister Mervyn Silva had issued a death threat to him when visiting the fake ‘Dalada Maligawa’ in Pothuhera, Kurunegala. According to the complaint, Ranasinghe had mentioned that the former Minister while visiting the fake ‘Dala Maligawa’, constructed at Wadakada in Pothuhera, had hurled abuse at him. Hence he had stated that he had lodged a complaint with the Police against Silva for his own protection. BY Nandana Kelegama – Polpithigama

title: Devananda accused of ignoring protesters demand
author: Author not found
Content: President of the ‘Arumbu’ District Women’s Federation of Kilinochchi, the women’s union of the National Fisheries Solidarity Movement, Niranjan Parimala yesterday (9) claimed that their protest, which was held for more than 100 days, demanding the removal of sea cucumber farms from the Kiranchi village, have been unfairly ignored by Minister Douglas Devananda. Parimala said those sea cucumber farms have been built without proper environmental assessment and they have impacted the livelihood of the residents of Kiranchi. Parimala said that the women in the Kiranchi and Iĺavankudah villages, in the Kilinochchi District are engaged in harvesting crab, shrimp and sea cucumber for their survival.  Now sea cucumber farms have come up in those areas impacting the livelihood of large number of traditional fishermen in the region, according to Parimala. Parimala added that they handed over a letter to the office of Minister Devananda after staging a protest opposite the Northern Province Governor’s Office recently.  “Instead of taking action on our letter, the Minister asked us to re-consider this matter. We trusted that the Minster would resolve our problems but that did not happen. We are telling the truth. The poor families who had been engaged in the harvest of crab, shrimp and sea cucumber in the area, have been severely affected by the establishment of sea cucumber farms in those areas,” Parimala said. Those who have been impacted by the establishment of sea cucumber farms will continue to protest until justice is meted out to them, Parimala added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Cancel Sri Lanka’s debt, global scholars tell creditors
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lanka’s recovery from last year’s devastating economic crisis will need its creditors to ‘share the burden’ of debt restructuring, leading global economists have said, calling all lenders to cancel the debt of the cash-strapped island nation. In a statement issued on Sunday, eminent economists and scholars world over observed that amid Sri Lanka’s crucial debt negotiations, “all lenders — bilateral, multilateral, and private — must share the burden of restructuring, with assurance of additional financing in the near term.”  However, Sri Lanka cannot ensure this on its own, they noted. “It requires much greater international support. Instead of geopolitical manoeuvring, all of Sri Lanka’s creditors must ensure debt cancellation sufficient to provide a way out of the current crisis,” the statement said. The nearly 200 signatories to the statement included economists Jayati Ghosh, Thomas Piketty, Yanis Varoufakis, Prabhat Patnaik, Utsa Patnaik, Jean Drèze, Ha-Joon Chang, Jomo Kwame Sundaram, and writer Amitav Ghosh. Their call comes months after Sri Lanka embarked on debt restructuring talks with its diverse group of creditors, including China, Japan and India, its three major bilateral lenders. Their financing assurances are crucial to Sri Lanka obtaining a USD 2.9 billion package from the IMF. As the import-reliant island nation’s Balance of Payments crisis spiralled and led to a painful economic crash last year, the government opted for a pre-emptive default on its USD 51 billion foreign debt in April 2022. The senior academics held Sri Lanka’s private creditors responsible for the country’s first ever default, arguing: “Such lenders charged a premium to lend to Sri Lanka to cover their risks, which accrued them massive profits and contributed to the default.” Private creditors own nearly 40% of Sri Lanka’s external debt stock mostly in the form of International Sovereign Bonds (ISBs), but higher interest rates mean that they receive over 50% of external debt payments, they pointed out. The default move came while crippling shortages sparked mass street protests across the island. The agitations spanned months and ousted former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa in July 2022. President Ranil Wickremesinghe was elected in his place, through a Parliament vote. In September 2022, Sri Lanka reached a staff level agreement with the IMF for a provisional bailout package, that the Fund made contingent on adequate financing assurances from Sri Lanka’s creditors. His government has pinned its hopes on IMF support, mainly to qualify for more credit that it deems necessary for reviving its battered economy. However, Sri Lanka missed the December deadline to obtain the IMF Board’s approval, and is still in talks with creditors to obtain assurances. Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Nandalal Weerasinghe told The Hindu in December 2022, that Colombo had provided “all information possible to its bilateral creditors” and was awaiting assurances from India and China. (The Hindu)

title: Kalmunai North sub DS promotes itself to DS
author: Author not found
Content: Kalmunai North Sub Divisional Secretariat (DS) is currently called the Kalmunai North Divisional Secretariat in violation of the decision made by the Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government, Right to Information (RTI) request revealed.  According to the State Ministry of Home Affairs, the Amapra District has 19 Divisional Secretariats and one Sub Divisional Secretariat. But, Kalmunai North Sub Divisional Secretariat has been called the Divisional Secretariat for the last several years without any legal authority.  Also, the Assistant Divisional Secretary is the head of this Sub Divisional Secretariat. But this Assistant Divisional Secretary is called Divisional Secretary by government institutions in the Eastern Province. The Assistant Divisional Secretary of this sub division uses the rubber stamp of Divisional Secretary.  Meanwhile, the State Ministry said that the ministry does not have any information on the Kalmunai North Sub Divisional Secretariat. Specifically, the establishment date of Kalmunai North Sub Divisional Secretariat, who gave the approval to establish and the reasons to establish this sub division.  Kalmunai North Sub Divisional Secretariat said in the RTI reply that they have 29 Grama Niladhari (GN) divisions. But the Ministry said that they do not issue any Gazette Notification to transfer GN divisions to Sub Divisional Secretariats and it continues under Kalmunai Divisional Secretariat according to the Gazette Notification No. 1172/8 issued on 20th of February 2001.  Earlier, the ministry refused to reply to this RTI request due to an on-going case in the Court of Appeal on Kalmunai North Sub Divisional Secretariat. But, the RTI Commission ordered the ministry to issue these details when this appeal was taken before the commission. By Rifthi Ali

title: UNP to contest all LG authorities
author: Author not found
Content: wUNP General Secretary Palitha Range Bandara said yesterday (9) that the party has decided to contest all the Local Government Authorities including those in the Northern and the Eastern Provinces at the upcoming LG Polls. He said the party is considering contesting certain LG Authorities through an alliance with Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) and the others as a single party. As the Election Commission has called for nominations, the lists are being prepared in consultation with President Ranil Wickremesinghe and top members of party, according to Range Bandara. Capable and energetic youth will be given more opportunities to contest the election from UNP, Range Bandara added.  By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Devananda accused of ignoring protesters demand
author: Author not found
Content: President of the ‘Arumbu’ District Women’s Federation of Kilinochchi, the women’s union of the National Fisheries Solidarity Movement, Niranjan Parimala yesterday (9) claimed that their protest, which was held for more than 100 days, demanding the removal of sea cucumber farms from the Kiranchi village, have been unfairly ignored by Minister Douglas Devananda. Parimala said those sea cucumber farms have been built without proper environmental assessment and they have impacted the livelihood of the residents of Kiranchi. Parimala said that the women in the Kiranchi and Iĺavankudah villages, in the Kilinochchi District are engaged in harvesting crab, shrimp and sea cucumber for their survival.  Now sea cucumber farms have come up in those areas impacting the livelihood of large number of traditional fishermen in the region, according to Parimala. Parimala added that they handed over a letter to the office of Minister Devananda after staging a protest opposite the Northern Province Governor’s Office recently.  “Instead of taking action on our letter, the Minister asked us to re-consider this matter. We trusted that the Minster would resolve our problems but that did not happen. We are telling the truth. The poor families who had been engaged in the harvest of crab, shrimp and sea cucumber in the area, have been severely affected by the establishment of sea cucumber farms in those areas,” Parimala said. Those who have been impacted by the establishment of sea cucumber farms will continue to protest until justice is meted out to them, Parimala added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Cancel Sri Lanka’s debt, global scholars tell creditors
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lanka’s recovery from last year’s devastating economic crisis will need its creditors to ‘share the burden’ of debt restructuring, leading global economists have said, calling all lenders to cancel the debt of the cash-strapped island nation. In a statement issued on Sunday, eminent economists and scholars world over observed that amid Sri Lanka’s crucial debt negotiations, “all lenders — bilateral, multilateral, and private — must share the burden of restructuring, with assurance of additional financing in the near term.”  However, Sri Lanka cannot ensure this on its own, they noted. “It requires much greater international support. Instead of geopolitical manoeuvring, all of Sri Lanka’s creditors must ensure debt cancellation sufficient to provide a way out of the current crisis,” the statement said. The nearly 200 signatories to the statement included economists Jayati Ghosh, Thomas Piketty, Yanis Varoufakis, Prabhat Patnaik, Utsa Patnaik, Jean Drèze, Ha-Joon Chang, Jomo Kwame Sundaram, and writer Amitav Ghosh. Their call comes months after Sri Lanka embarked on debt restructuring talks with its diverse group of creditors, including China, Japan and India, its three major bilateral lenders. Their financing assurances are crucial to Sri Lanka obtaining a USD 2.9 billion package from the IMF. As the import-reliant island nation’s Balance of Payments crisis spiralled and led to a painful economic crash last year, the government opted for a pre-emptive default on its USD 51 billion foreign debt in April 2022. The senior academics held Sri Lanka’s private creditors responsible for the country’s first ever default, arguing: “Such lenders charged a premium to lend to Sri Lanka to cover their risks, which accrued them massive profits and contributed to the default.” Private creditors own nearly 40% of Sri Lanka’s external debt stock mostly in the form of International Sovereign Bonds (ISBs), but higher interest rates mean that they receive over 50% of external debt payments, they pointed out. The default move came while crippling shortages sparked mass street protests across the island. The agitations spanned months and ousted former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa in July 2022. President Ranil Wickremesinghe was elected in his place, through a Parliament vote. In September 2022, Sri Lanka reached a staff level agreement with the IMF for a provisional bailout package, that the Fund made contingent on adequate financing assurances from Sri Lanka’s creditors. His government has pinned its hopes on IMF support, mainly to qualify for more credit that it deems necessary for reviving its battered economy. However, Sri Lanka missed the December deadline to obtain the IMF Board’s approval, and is still in talks with creditors to obtain assurances. Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Nandalal Weerasinghe told The Hindu in December 2022, that Colombo had provided “all information possible to its bilateral creditors” and was awaiting assurances from India and China. (The Hindu)

title: IMF upgrades SL’s economic outlook
author: Author not found
Content: IMF on their website on Friday (6) upgraded their Sri Lanka forecast for 2023, by saying that the economy is expected to grow by three per cent as opposed to their earlier forecast that the economy will contract (shrink) by 8.7 per cent, only two days earlier, on Wednesday (4). IMF in their new forecast also expected consumer prices to rise by 29.5 per cent this year, as opposed to its previous forecast, where it said that consumer prices are expected to increase by 48 per cent, Year-on-Year, this year. Meanwhile, Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) on Wednesday, without giving any forecasts for this year, has however said it is expected to record a gradual recovery from the second half of this year (2023) and sustain the growth momentum beyond. CBSL estimated that the economy would have shrunk by around eight per cent last year (2022). The economy grew by 3.7 per cent in 2021, according to the CBSL. CBSL further said on Wednesday that measures are underway to secure financing assurances from official creditors for the debt restructuring process aimed at ensuring medium-term public debt sustainability. With significant progress being made at present in relation to the interaction with the Sri Lankan creditors, the envisaged IMF facility is expected to materialise in early 2023, it added. CBSL has presently reached a staff-level agreement with the IMF for the disbursement of a total of USD 2.9 billion, to be given out to the country in tranches, spread over a four-year period. But a precondition for this disbursement is that Sri Lanka’s creditors should unanimously agree to restructure its debt. At present, China is pussyfooting in restructuring the debt owed to it by Sri Lanka, thereby delaying the disbursement of IMF money. By Paneetha Ameresekere

title: I was ‘Pad Man’ then and ‘Bus Man’ now
author: Author not found
Content: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said that previously he was ridiculed and named ‘Pad man’, now he is known as ‘Bus man’. Premadasa also revealed the reason as to why he spoke in ‘difficult English’ as claimed by some. “I have won the confidence of foreign donors because I have genuine intentions. Some say that they cannot understand my English. I use certain words to convince foreign donors as to why their assistance was needed for Sri Lanka at this hour. I have been able to conduct the Sakwala programme because of my ability to convince donors. I am confident that I will be able to launch Sri Lanka’s First Foster Parent scheme for school children through these foreign donors. I will implement this scheme in all schools. I will also see that every school going child will own a computer in the future,” Premadasa said.  Speaking during a ceremony at Mahamaya Balika Vidayalaya, Nugegoda, yesterday (8) where he donated the 66th bus to the school under the Sakwala programme. Premadasa said during the last presidential election, when he spoke about women’s health, he was called ‘Pad man’, and now because he donates buses to needy schools, he is called ‘Bus man’ on social media. He said foreign donors trust him more than others and that is why they assist the SJB to donate these buses and other equipment to schools. By Nabiya Vaffoor

title: Title not found
author: Author not found
Content: Date: Exports of rubber-related products increased by 39 per cent last year while imports of rubber as a raw material decreased by approximately 93 per cent, State Minister of Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said. The State Minister was speaking during a media briefing held yesterday (8) in Ruwanwella. He highlighted that by mid-2022, the price of rubber had rapidly decreased, the local rubber farmer had no rubber market, and importing rubber as a raw material had a negative impact. A plan has been developed according to this analysis, and the amount of rubber imported as a raw material in December 2021 could be reduced to 1,548 metric tonnes by December 2022.  According to the minister, the export of rubber-related products earned USD 1.050 billion in 2021 and was increased to USD 1.463 billion in 2022. Popular

title: CAA to prosecute eight shopkeepers
author: Author not found
Content: The Consumer Affairs Authority’s District Investigation Unit in Gampaha will prosecute eight shopkeepers who were found to be selling substandard Sivuru and Atapirikara during raids coinciding with Duruthu Poya at Kelaniya Raja Maha Viharaya. Head of Gampaha District Investigation Unit, Consumer Affairs Authority Ranjith Weerawardena said these shop owners have been released on bail and that a case will be filed against them in Mahara Court on 23 January. On the instructions of CAA Chairman Shantha Niriella and Gampaha District Secretary Saman Darshana Pandikorala, and under the guidance of Gampaha District Head of the CAA Ranjith Weerawardena, a group of officers including investigating officers Kosala Ranganath, C.I.P. Kandage, Chatura Herath, Dilshan Perera, Sanjeeva Dayanand, and Sameera Lakmal joined the raid. By Thilak Priyadarshana Liyanage – Yakkala

title: Liyanwala Rathana Thera lambasts monks, politicians
author: Author not found
Content: President of Jathika Sangha Sabawa, Ven. Liyanwala Sasana Rathana Thera said a group of Buddhist monks who supported politicians should also be held accountable for Sri Lanka’s current unfortunate state, along with politicians and State sector employees. Noting that no one can escape that responsibility, he said these politicians beg for the Maha Sangha’s and public support but once they get the opportunity to enter Parliament what they only do is get at least ten liquor licences. “Becoming an MP comes with a plethora of other benefits and privileges. That is why these people beg for votes to get elected to Parliament.  And then the people have to beg these corrupt politicians to deliver the service they are supposed to do. These politicians who ruled the country are directly responsible for the country’s current unfortunate situation,” he said. The Ven. Thera made these remarks as the keynote speaker at a recent programme to provide school supplies to students at Kosgama High School in Pahathadumbara. He said not only politicians who ruled the country for the past 60 years, but also State Sector employees, should be held accountable. “These public-sector employees never considered serving the public. They were always taking their pay and engaging in fraud and corruption. Some State employees believed that even if the country went into crisis, if they could survive, that was all that mattered,” he said. BY K.L. Suraweera – Kandy

title: Allocate Rs 10B election money to purchase paddy – Amaraweera
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Agriculture Mahinda Amaraweera urged the Government to spend Rs 10 billion to purchase paddy from farmers during the Maha season. He said, he had no objection to holding elections but purchasing paddy from farmers could not be delayed. Amaraweera said, otherwise the money would be spent on the LG Election. He said a maximum of Rs 10 billion was needed to purchase paddy, and that the Government should take steps to provide at least Rs 5 billion. He said during the last Yala season, 512,000 hectares of paddy was cultivated and was reported to be the most amount cultivated in the country in 10 years. “We asked for Rs 2 billion from the two State Banks to buy paddy in the Yala season, but we did not get it. The Government did not have any money, neither did the Banks. However, there is a bumper paddy harvest this season. The Government should provide at least Rs 10 billion to the Paddy Marketing Board (PMB) to purchase paddy. What matters more is whether Elections are held or not, paddy should be bought from farmers,” he said. Amaraweera also said approximately Rs 73,000 million has been spent on rice imports to Sri Lanka in 2022. The Minister also said if the Government has the funds to import rice, why couldn’t it spend Rs 2 billion to purchase the rice harvest? “I urge the Government to give the PMB at least Rs 5 billion to purchase paddy,” he said.

title: Farmers to receive China’s 7M litres of diesel donation today
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Agriculture Mahinda Amaraweera said the Chinese Government’s donation of nearly 7 million litres of diesel for agricultural activities in Sri Lanka will be distributed free to farmers beginning today (9). Diesel will be distributed among farmers online with a voucher being given to each farmer. The official release of the voucher will take place at 11 a.m. at the Ministry of Agriculture under the chairmanship of the Minister. The Chinese Government donated 10.06 million litres of diesel free to people in the agriculture and fishing industries on arequest  made by President Ranil Wickremesinghe. Nearly 6.98 million litres of diesel were allocated for agricultural purposes, with the remainder used for fishing. Amaraweera directed ministry officials to provide the fuel stock free once it arrived, as farmers had completed their harvest. Steps have been taken under this arrangement to provide free fuel to farmers who cultivate paddy on half an acre to two hectares. Fifteen litres of diesel will be allocated for a hectare and 30 litres of diesel for two hectares have been set aside. According to Amaraweera, under the Government’s programme to provide relief to farmers during this season, a farmer who cultivates one hectare will receive a subsidy of Rs 150,000 including state and international subsidies.

title: Third round of negotiations today, tomorrow
author: Author not found
Content: The third round of negotiations between Sri Lanka and Thailand on the proposed Free Trade Agreement (FTA) will be held today (9) and tomorrow (10) in Colombo, with the participation of 26 delegates from Thailand headed by Auramon Supthaweethum, Director General of the Department of Trade Negotiations, advancing the Government’s agenda of expanding the market access for Sri Lankan exports. Seven areas – trade in goods, trade in services, investment, rules of origin, customs cooperation, trade facilitation, and economic cooperation will be the focus of the negotiations. The start of the negotiations will take place against the backdrop of a significant trade imbalance in Thailand’s favour. In 2021, Sri Lanka imported goods from Thailand worth USD 355 million, but only sent USD 59 million to Thailand. Thus, from Sri Lanka’s perspective, the negotiations will be aimed at enhancing access to our exports not only in the Thai market, but also in markets in other ASEAN countries through Thailand’s gateway and lowering present non-tariff trade obstacles. According to market potential assessments, Sri Lankan exports of precious stones, black tea, and other goods are promising. Sri Lanka is hopeful that through discussions, doors will open to offer opportunities in both new industries and for the two nations’ present trade frameworks. The National Trade Negotiating Committee (NTNC), whose members primarily represent the Ministries of Foreign Affairs, Trade, Commerce, and Food Security, the Department of Trade and Investment Policies of the Treasury, and the Department of Commerce, will participate in the negotiations on behalf of Sri Lanka under the leadership of K.J. Weerasinghe, Chief Negotiator, and the Presidential Secretariat. The Government plans to effect this agreement in the first quarter of 2024. The NTNC will give the specific requests made by the regional business associations/chambers considerable consideration during the negotiations. The Government’s objective of entering the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership, which represents 30 per cent of the global population and economy, will be advanced by this agreement. As trade is a growth tool that is relevant to both countries, the Government of Sri Lanka is eager to strengthen bilateral relations with Thailand. Thailand and Sri Lanka have formal diplomatic relations that date back 68 years, and Thailand’s economy was boosted by the rapid growth of manufactured exports.

title: Tourism rakes in USD 1.1B in 2022
author: Author not found
Content: Tourism earnings last year (2022) increased by 124.2 per cent (USD 629.4 million) Year-on-Year (YoY) to USD 1,136.3 million, Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) data from Friday (6) showed. In 2021, Sri Lanka earned USD 506.9 million from tourism. However, when considering Sri Lanka’s highest ever tourism earnings witnessed to date, a figure of USD 4,380.6 million four years ago in 2018, last year’s tourism earnings were less by 285.51 per cent (USD 3,244.3 million). Meanwhile, tourist arrivals last year grew by 270.2 per cent (194,495) YoY to 719,978, data further showed. In 2021, tourism arrivals numbered 194,495. However, the highest number of tourist arrivals the country has witnessed to date was in 2018 where tourist arrivals numbered 2,333,796. Therefore, tourist arrivals last year over 2018 fell by 224.15 per cent (1,613,818). Tourism was Sri Lanka’s third highest foreign exchange earner for seven consecutive years from 2013 to 2019, before the Covid-19 pandemic hit the industry in 2020, relegating it to the seventh place that year and to the eighth place in the following year 2021, according to latest CBSL data. At present, tourism is hit by political instability and record power cuts which had its beginnings in 2021 and still continues because of Sri Lanka’s lack of US dollars to import coal and thereby ensure that the country has uninterrupted power 24 hours of the day. By Paneetha Ameresekere

title: Brig Chandrasiri takes over as GOC 24 Infantry
author: Author not found
Content: Brigadier Wipula Chandrasiri took over as the 14th General Officer Commanding (GOC) 24 Infantry Division, located at Malwatte in the Ampara District, on 1 January 2023 and assumed duties on 2 January. Commander of the Sri Lanka Army Lt. General Vikum Liyanage appointed Brigadier Wipula Chandrasiri who was serving as the Deputy Vice Chancellor (Defence and Administration) of General Sir John Kotalawala Defence University, Ratmalana for more than two years As a Colonel, he was Brigade Commander of the 241 Brigade in Akkaraipattu from August 2071 to May 2019 and rendered many humanitarian services to all three communities during the period and earned the goodwill of the public. BY M.A.P. Deen –  Ampara

title: Rs 817M Canadian Grant for SL
author: Author not found
Content: In response to the humanitarian appeals launched by the United Nations (UN) and the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC), Canada is providing Canadian dollars three million (approx.  Rs 817 million) to help address the needs of vulnerable communities in Sri Lanka, the Canadian High Commission said in a statement dated 6 January. This contribution will be delivered through the UN and the IFRC, in collaboration with their local partners, to support the provision of emergency food assistance, health and nutrition services, access to safe water and other essential services to those who need it the most, it said. In addition, Canada is involved in other ongoing international assistance projects to address immediate needs and help respond to the economic crisis in Sri Lanka, including the procurement of essential medical equipment and supplies. Canada continues to stand with all Sri Lankans in these difficult times and remains committed to supporting an inclusive and prosperous Sri Lanka, the statement in conclusion said. (PA)

title: Kalutara North free of drug menace – OIC Police
author: Author not found
Content: Kalutara North Police Division has been transformed into a drug-free zone, according to Kalutara North  OIC, Chief Inspector Damith Jayathilaka. He said  within four months, 60 drug traffickers and addicts were apprehended, charged and imprisoned. He said the Kalutara-North Police Division covers 32 rural service areas, and residents have been able to arrest drug traffickers thanks to successful information obtained by civil organisations and the Intelligence Service. As a result, house burgling and property theft in the area have been reduced by 99%, according to the OIC. BY BimalJayasinghe (Colombo) and Sumith Ranawaka (Pothupitiya)

title: Coordinated Navy, Police search lugs in two
author: Author not found
Content: The Navy and Police, in a coordinated search operation in Negombo on 4 January 2023, apprehended two suspects. The duo is suspected to have collected money, promising jobs in a foreign country and also promising to facilitate illegal migration.  The search operation was carried out in Negombo on 4 January evening with the assistance of Negombo Police. The operation was based on information received by naval intelligence. The raiding party had intercepted a suspicious car in which the suspects were travelling. They are said to have collected Rs five million from 20 people promising overseas jobs after facilitating illegal migration.  The suspects, aged 30 and 41 are residents of Chilaw and Kilinochchi areas. The duo along with the vehicle was handed over to the Negombo Police for legal action.  Meanwhile, the Navy urges the public not to engage in unlawful activities such as attempting to leave the country illegally. If found guilty they would have to face criminal charges, the Navy said.

title: ECA holds mass signature-gathering campaign
author: Author not found
Content: The signing of a petition against the proposed electricity tariff hike is presently underway islandwide, led by the Electricity Consumers’ Association (ECA). A mass signature-gathering campaign was held on 7 January at the Divulapitiya Weekly Fair, led by ECA General Secretary Sanjeewa Dhammika. By Thilak Priyadarshan Liyanage (Yakkala) and I.M.A. Rathna (Divulapitiya)

title: Jaffna youth receive Lifesaving Certificates
author: Author not found
Content: After completing the third life-saving programme held under the patronage of the Navy, Sri Lanka Life-saving Association and North Wind Project in Karainagar, eight youth from Jaffna were given Certificates in recognition of their ability on 6 January 2023. The certificate awarding ceremony was held under the auspices of Deputy Area Commander Northern Naval Area, Commodore Priyal Vithanage at the Fort Hammenheil Resort.  The idea was initially mooted by the Commander of the Navy Vice Admiral Priyantha Perera during his tenure as Commander Northern Naval Area. The lifesaving training course was to encourage youth in the Jaffna area in lifesaving skills. The first two programmes, for three weeks were held in October and November 2021 at SLNS Elara in Karainagar with the support of Navy’s Rapid Response Rescue & Relief Unit (4RU).  On successful completion of the three -week course starting 14 December 2022 which was the third training programme, eight youth who sharpened their knowledge, attitude and skills to deal with lifesaving activities were awarded Certificates. Rear Admiral Aruna Tennakoon, Commander of the Northern Naval Area supported the programme.  Commanding Officer SLNS Elara, Captain Nalinda Kumara, officers from the Northern Naval Command, Sameera Jewantha the Secretary of Sri Lanka Life Saving Association and Jekhan Aruliah representative of the North Wind Project were also present.

title: ITAK could wield power in LG bodies in North, East – Rasamanickam
author: Author not found
Content: The Central Committee meeting of Ilankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi  (ITAK) chaired by ITAK Leader Mavai Senathirajah was held at the ITAK Batticaloa District MP Sanakiyan Rasamanickam’s office on 7 January. The meeting was attended by ITAK members from the Northern and Eastern Provinces including MPs M. A. Sumanthiran, Rasamanickam, Thavarasa Kalaiarasan, former parliamentarians, Provincial Council and members of LG bodies as well as party supporters and activists. Various matters including the preparation for the Local Government (LG) polls, subjects and the responsibilities of constituent parties with regard to the forthcoming LG polls were discussed in length during the central committee meeting. MP Rasamanickam added that they were confident that ITAK could wield power in many LG bodies in the Northern and Eastern provinces, when the polls are held.  MP Rasamanickam added that during the meeting, it was unanimously decided not to register the TNA as a political party. This decision was made when the letter been sent to TNA leader, R. Sampanthan to take expeditious action to register the TNA as a political party by the Tamil Eelam Liberation Organisation  (TELO) and People’s Liberation Organisation of Tamil Eelam (PLOTE) was discussed, MP. Rasamnickam said. BY Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Drug prevention programme in Bogawanthalawa
author: Author not found
Content: A programme to educate children and prevent them from getting addicted to drugs, in schools in the Bogawanthalawa area, under the Hatton Zonal Education Office, was held at the Bogawanthalawa Sri Thendayudhapani Hindu Temple Hall. Meanwhile, the Board of Trustees of Bogawanthala Jumma Mosque educated schoolchildren about the consequences of drug use to prevent them from becoming addicted to drugs. The decision to hold this awareness programme in the Bogwanthalawa was a follow-up to principals in schools in the area informed the relevant departments that a large number of children in estate schools had become addicted to drugs. BY Neeta PathmaKumari – Norwood

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Baglay, Bandula observe religious rites
author: Author not found
Content: Before the commencement of the modernisation of the railway line from Mahawa to Omanthai, Minister of Transport Bandula Gunawardena and Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Gopal Baglay, along with other officials engaged in religious rituals at Jaya Sri Maha Bodhi in Anuradhapura.

title: SL AMONG 120 COUNTRIES INVITED BY INDIA
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lanka is among more than 120 countries which have been invited by India to participate in a virtual summit to be held over two days from 12-13 January, the Indian High Commission in Sri Lanka said on Saturday (7). The focus of the Voice of Global South Summit, under the theme ‘Unity of Voice, Unity of Purpose’ envisages bringing together countries of the Global South to share their perspectives and priorities on a common platform, it said. The initiative is spearheaded by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s vision to ensure that inputs generated from partner countries in the Voice of Global South Summit deliberations receive due cognisance globally, the High Commission said. Further, India’s ongoing Presidency of the G20 provides an opportunity for those countries that are not part of the G20 process to share their ideas and expectations from the G20, it said. This is in line with PM Modi’s statement that India’s G20 Presidency will be shaped in consultation with not just “our G20 partners, but also our fellow-travellers in the Global South, whose voice often goes unheard.” The Summit envisages ten sessions. Four sessions will be held on 12 January, and six sessions on 13 January. Each session is expected to witness the participation of leaders/ministers from 10-20 countries. The inaugural and concluding sessions will be at Head of State/ Government level, and hosted by PM Modi. The theme of the Inaugural Leaders’ session is ‘Voice of Global South – for Human-Centric Development’ and that of the Concluding Leaders’ session is ‘Unity of Voice-Unity of Purpose.’ In addition, there will be eight ministerial sessions, with the following themes: Finance Ministers’ Session on ‘Financing People-Centric Development,’ Environment Ministers’ Session on ‘Balancing Growth with Environment Friendly Lifestyles’ (LiFE), Foreign Ministers’ Session on ‘Priorities of the Global South – Ensuring a Conducive Environment,’ Energy Ministers’ Session on ‘Energy Security and Development- Roadmap to Prosperity,’ Health Ministers’ Session on ‘Cooperation to Build Resilient Healthcare Systems,’ Education Ministers’ Session on ‘Human Resource Development and Capacity Building,’ Commerce and Trade Ministers’ Session on ‘Developing Synergies in the Global South – Trade, Technology, Tourism and Resources’ and Foreign Ministers’ Session on ‘G20: Suggestions for India’s Presidency,’ it said. (PA)

title: Sergeant narrowly escapes cop’s wrath
author: Author not found
Content: A Police sergeant narrowly escaped being killed by a constable when he prevented the latter from going to sleep. The incident occurred at Joswell Junction, Mirihana, where they were on night duty. According to Mirihana Police, three Police officers, an IP, the Sergeant and the suspect were on night duty at Joswell junction, when the suspect went to sleep while on duty. However, the sergeant had told the suspect several times not to sleep, This annoyed the constable who then aimed the T-56 firearm in his hand towards the sergeant and attempted to pull the trigger. The Inspector at the scene yelled and grabbed the firearm preventing a calamity. The suspect was handed over to Mirihana Police, following a complaint lodged by the Sergeant, The suspect is a 25-year-old resident of Polpithigama who started his career at the Police Department four years ago. BY Bimal Jayasinghe (Colombo) and Niduwara Abeysinghe (Boralasgamuwa)

title: IRCON to renovate rail stretch from Mahawa to Omanthai
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Transport Bandula Gunawardena said the Indian IRCON company will renovate the railway line from Mahawa to Omanthai under the Indian Credit Line.The investment is valued at USD 91.27 million. A 48-kilometre stretch from Anuradhapura to Vavuniya will be renovated and in the following phase, a 13-kilometre stretch from Vavuniya to Omanthai will be renovated. The Minister was speaking at the inauguration ceremony to commence renovation work on the Northern Railway stretch from Mahawa to Omanthai, which was held at the Medawachchiya railway station. He said once the project is completed, the train will be able to travel at a speed of 100 kilometres per hour, reducing travel time from Colombo to Kankesanthurai by an hour. “In addition, there are many benefits such as reduced and minimised maintenance, a luxury ride, comfortable and safe destination for passengers and the addition of a new station called Boo Oyato the railway system. Despite the fact that our country is facing its worst crisis since Independence, the Indian government’s assistance in improving the country’s public transport system is highly commendable. As the first major development project to begin in Sri Lanka in 2023, this is aonce-in-a-lifetime opportunity to begin the renovation of the rail line from Mahawa to Omanthai,” he said. He said, despite the fact that there is no possibility of starting new projects in the country; he hopes that this project will go a long way in solving many problems of the Northern Railway under the Indian loan scheme. “This railway section from Mahawa to Omanthai has been in disrepair for a long time. The massive development project is being launched in this manner to fill that void. As a result, the railway line has been closed since 5 January 2023, but the construction company expects to complete work in five months,” he said. BY Thameenah Razeek

title: TPA, NWF to join SJB for forthcoming Election
author: Author not found
Content: The Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA) led by MP Mano Ganesan and the National Workers’ Front (NWF) led by Palani Digambaram will join the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) to compete in the upcoming Local Government Election. Ganesan told the media following a ceremony in Hatton, yesterday (8) that their alliance is bound to bring victory to the SJB. “Although the Election Commission is ready to hold an Election, the Government is of the opposite stance,” he added. By Neeta Pathma Kumari – Norwood

title: Govt postpones debate on Rehab Bill
author: Author not found
Content: The Government postponed taking up the controversial Bureau of Rehabilitation Bill for debate in Parliament until 19 January. The Bill was scheduled to be debated yesterday (5). Justice Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe told the House that the Government will not withdraw the Bill and this is only a postponement. The Bureau of Rehabilitation Bill sparked controversy over several provisions such as Section 28 (2) where persons employed at the Centres for Rehabilitation “to preserve order and discipline” may use all means “including minimum force as may reasonably be necessary to compel obedience to any lawful directions.” Opposition MPs, human rights activists and civil society organisations raised concerns the Bill which is “to provide for the establishment of a bureau to be called and known as the bureau of rehabilitation; to regulate its powers, duties and functions and to provide for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto” can be used to suppressanti-government protesters. The Supreme Court has determined that a controversial rehabilitation bureau bill is, as a whole, inconsistent with Article 12 (1) of the Constitution and may therefore be enacted only by special majority. On 20 October 2022, Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena informed Parliament that the bill, titled ‘Bureau of Rehabilitation Act’ may be enacted by special majority as required by Article 84 (2) of the Constitution. Article 12 (1) of the Constitution reads: “All persons are equal before the law and are entitled to the equal protection of the law.” The Supreme Court determined that the inconsistency with Article 12 (1) will cease if all references to ‘ex-combatants,’ ‘violent extremist groups,’ and ‘any other group of persons’ are deleted from the bill, and if the bill is limited to rehabilitation of drug dependent persons and such other persons as may be identified by law. Also, former Commissioner of the Human Rights Commission of Sri Lanka (HRCSL) Ambika Satkunanathan filed a Fundamental Rights Petition against the Bill in October last year as well. By Methmalie Dissanayake

title: PUCSL WILL VETO TARIFF HIKE – – RATNAYAKE
author: Author not found
Content: Requesting the public not to panic over electricity bills, Chairman of the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) Janaka Ratnayake said the PUCSL will use its veto power if the Cabinet approves the proposal to raise electricity tariffs, and reject the tariff hike. He said the proposed electricity tariff revision was based on inaccurate information gathered from a presentation given by the new CEB General Manager, another senior engineer, and the Ministry Secretary. Ratnayake told the media that the decision on the electricity tariff revision was supposed to be made last week, but it was not taken up at the Cabinet meeting and was postponed until next Monday. He said the PUCSL urged Cabinet not to make any decisions regarding the revision of electricity tariffs based on false information. “Even if Cabinet makes the decision, the PUCSL will not approve it because we have the authority vested under the provisions,” he said. Therefore, the PUCSL Chairman urged the public not to panic over the tariff increase, and stated that the PUCSL will not approve any tariff increase at this time. “The data provided to Cabinet was not based on accurate information, data, or proper procedures,” he said. He said if it had been discussed at the Cabinet meeting, a decision would have been made based on these facts and figures. “After seeing that the CEB is making operational profits and taking into account the raw materials used to generate electricity, the PUCSL approved a tariff increase four months ago,” he said. “There is no need for a revision at this moment as the CEB is making reasonable profits,” he added. By Thameenah Razeek

title: Easter Sunday attacks accused refused bail
author: Author not found
Content: The Colombo Permanent High Court Trial-at-Bar, yesterday (5) dismissed the bail request made on behalf of 25 accused, including Naufer Maulavi, who were in remand custody in connection with the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks. The 25 accused, were further remanded till 1 February. The Trial-at-Bar comprising Judges Damith Thotawatta, Amal Ranaraja and Nawaratne Marasinghe refused to grant bail to the accused, who have been indicted by the Attorney General on 23,270 counts, including plotting the terror attacks and murder. Presiding Judge Thotawatta, delivering the decision, explained that it is inappropriate to enlarge the 25 accused on bail, under the present circumstances. By Hansi Nanayakkara

title: Mudalige further remanded
author: Author not found
Content: Colombo Fort Magistrate Thilina Gamage yesterday (5) further remanded, till 13 January, IUSF Convener Wasantha Mudalige. Mudalige was produced in Court and charged with unlawfully entering the premises of the President’s House in Fort and causing damage to its property. Magistrate Gamage mentioned that when the case is convened next, his decision on the bail plea will be delivered. The IUSF Convener, who was taken into custody, under the provisions of the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), was produced before Court, by Prisons Department officers. BY Hansi Nanayakkara

title: Ronald Perera back as BoC Chairman
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe appointed Ronald Perera, PC, as Chairman of the Bank of Ceylon yesterday (5), in his capacity as Finance Minister. Perera was appointed Chairman of the Sri Lanka Insurance Corporation in August 2022. Perera served as BoC Chairman from January 2015 to November 2019, during Wickremesinghe’s tenure as Prime Minister. (SRM)

title: Randimal Gamage granted bail
author: Author not found
Content: Colombo Chief Magistrate Prasanna Alwis, yesterday enlarged on bail Randimal Gamage, who is charged with unlawful entry to the Sri Lanka Rupavahini Corporation (SLRC) premises and intimidating its workers. Gamage was released on bail in two sureties of Rs 200,000 each. Cinnamon Gardens Police informed the Magistrate, that the suspect had been apprehended by the BIA Police, upon his return to Colombo from Dubai, after which he had been handed over to the Police. Taking the submissions into consideration, the Court ordered the suspect to be released on bail. A travel ban had been imposed on the suspect last year. However, he had gone Dubai from BIA before the Court order was received by Emigration and Immigration at the airport. The Emigration and Immigration officers had released him from the BIA, although a ban had been imposed on restricting him leaving the country, there was no restriction on him entering into. He is a 32-year-old resident of Hapugala, Galle. BY Hansi Nanayakkara and T.K.G. Kapila (Katunayake)

title: Litro drops LP gas prices
author: Author not found
Content: Litro Lanka Chairman Muditha Peiris announced that the price of a 12.5 kg domestic Litro gas cylinder was reduced by Rs 201 as of midnight on 5 January. Thus, the 12.5 kg gas cylinder’s new retail price is Rs 4,409. The 5 kg gas cylinder was reduced by Rs 80, and the new retail price is Rs 1,770. The price of a 2.3 kg cylinder was reduced by Rs 38, making the new retail price Rs 822. All price revisions came into effect from last night. Following new features added to the existing gas price formula, the Finance Ministry, Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA), Presidential Secretariat, and Litro Gas Lanka Limited collaborated to revise the prices.

title: CID ordered to obtain report from British HC
author: Author not found
Content: Colombo Chief Magistrate Prasanna Alwis, yesterday (5) instructed the CID to obtain a report from the British High Commission in Colombo, on State Minister of Tourism Diana Gamage’s citizenship and produce a report to him. Explaining matters further, the Chief Magistrate opined that when perusing the lawsuit, it was obvious to him, that there is no necessity to seek instructions from the Attorney General. He added that once a report is submitted, in this connection by the CID, obtained from the British High Commission, it would suffice for the Court, to issue an order, pertaining to the controversial citizenship issue of the State Minister. Accordingly, the CID was ordered to obtain an immediate report, on the citizenship status of the State Minister concerned and conduct further investigations into the matter. Later, further proceedings of the trial were deferred to 10 February. The CID had produced submissions to Court, at the previous hearing, stating that they have noticed violation of Provisions contained in Section 175 of the Penal Code, as well as flouting of Provisions contained in Section 45 (1) of the Immigrants and Emigrants Act No. 20 of 1948, related to the case. By Hansi Nanayakkara

title: Gold imports above 22 carats restricted – Siyambalapitiya
author: Author not found
Content: A Gazette Notification has been issued restricting gold imports above 22 carats as jewellery, State Minister of Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said. He said in a tweet that the decision was taken to prevent gold smuggling. Meanwhile, Siyambalapitiya said bank interest income less than Rs 100,000 per month of senior citizens based on their fixed deposits will not be subjected to withholding tax going forward. “If the interest income is over Rs 100,000, it would be subjected to tax. However, a 5 per cent withholding tax had been imposed on interest income less than Rs 100,000. Considering the inconveniences faced by senior citizens, we decided to remove that tax,” he said. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: CID arrests Sepal Amarasinghe
author: Author not found
Content: Sepal Amarasinghe, who took flak for allegedly making defamatory statements on the Sri Dalada Maligawa recently, was arrested by the CID yesterday (5) at his residence in Boralesgamuwa.  The Mahanayake Theras of the Malwathu and Asgiriya Chapters in a joint letter to the President said according to video footage circulating on social media, Sepal Amarasinghe made offensive statements about Buddhism and the Sri Dalada Maligawa. Following the letter, the President instructed IGP C.D. Wickramaratne to launch an immediate and comprehensive investigation regarding the construction of a fake Dalada Maligawa in Pothuhera, Kurunegala as well. They informed the President that several people are reported to have been caught in the scam and have donated money and jewellery for the construction of the said building. Claiming these incidents harm Buddhism and the historic Sri Dalada Maligawa, the Mahanayake Theras requested the President to immediately take action in this regard.

title: Elephants terrorise Galhitiya villagers
author: Author not found
Content: Chandika Wijerama, a resident of Galahitiya village, said that due to wild elephants from the Lunugamvehera Forest Reserve roaming in nearby villages, villagers living in Galahitiya, in the Kataragama Divisional Secretariat, were harassed as they could not venture out to carry on their lives. He said, the roaming elephants in the afternoon have prevented villagers from stepping out of their homes to carry out their day-to-day activities. Wijerama added that despite constant reminders, made to the authorities, to end the menace it has yet not yielded desired results. He warned that if measures are not taken to address the issue the lives and properties of villagers will be at the mercy of these pachyderms. BY Ariyapala Ratnayake – Kataragama

title: Sepal Amarasinghe to be severely dealt with
author: Author not found
Content: Maximum legal action under the Penal Code will be taken against Sepal Amarasinghe, who insulted the Sacred Tooth Relic at Sri Dalada Maligawa on social media platforms recently, Justice Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe said.  The Justice Minister also said that acting in a way that harms religious beliefs is an offence punishable by imprisonment of up to ten years and alleged that he is a part of a group that works towards the downfall of Buddhism.  Sepal Amarasinghe’s recent remarks on Sri Dalada Maligawa sparked controversy in the country. Speaking in Parliament yesterday (5), Rajapakshe emphasised that under Section 290 of the Penal Code, if a person insults a religious belief and acts in such a way as to break the hearts of those who believe in that religion, it is a punishable offence. “Amarasinghe is identified as someone who does not follow any religion. It is his right to follow a religion or not. However, he does not have the right to insult a belief of those who follow a religion. Therefore, we will take legal action against this person,” he said. Meanwhile, State Minister Diana Gamage alleged the major objective of hate speech published on social media on sensitive topics is a tactic to claim asylum abroad and warned that action should be taken against Sepal Amarasinghe in a way where he won’t be able to flee the country. Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said this person is identified as a member of the ‘Aragalaya,’ while claiming allegations that Amarasinghe was a head of a state institution during the tenure of former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is totally false. By Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: PM receives blessings at Navagamuwa Rajamaha Vihara
author: Author not found
Content: Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena participated in religious ceremonies at the historical Navagamuwa Rajamaha Vihara and Paththini Devalaya (Shrine of the Goddess Paththini) on 4 January and received blessings from Malwane Pannasara Thera, Mahanayake of Sri Kalyani Samagri Dharma Maha Sangha Sabha. The Chief Incumbent of the historical Navagamuwa Rajamaha Vihara, Malwane Pannasara Thera explained that “Navagamuwa Sacred Land and Paththini Devalaya are not strange places for the Prime Minister. The Prime Minister’s grandfather, Boralugoda Ralahami took charge of the site and worked to develop this place.” “The Prime Minister visited the Paththini Devalaya even when he was a child and participated in various events and did various activities for the development of this place,” added the Mahanayake Thera. “Because of your patience and dedication to the country and the people, you became the Prime Minister of this country. As a person who works for the country with commitment, your present position is important for the future of the country,” he said, and added that the Prime Minister has a great responsibility to fulfil the needs of this temple and he expressed confidence that those duties will be continued in the future as well. Parliamentarian Yadamini Gunawardena also joined the Prime Minister on the occasion and received blessings on his birthday. Jayantha Rohana, Chairman of Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha and members of Kaduwela Municipal Council also participated in this event.
