title: PM signs Condolence Book
author: Author not found
Content: Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena signed the Condolence Book on the passing of Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI at the Apostolic Nunciature in Colombo yesterday (5). He engaged in a brief conversation with Apostolic Nuncio, Archbishop Brian Udaigwe after signing the Book.

title: Police nab 149 drug carriers going to Sri Pada
author: Author not found
Content: An officer attached to the Hatton Crimes Division stated that 149 people, who had various types of illicit drugs and were attempting to go to the Sri Pada Site were apprehended. He said, the suspects were apprehended following a 21-day operation from 7 to 31 December last year. The Officer said, Hatton Police had launched another operation to inspect all vehicles arriving at the Sacred Site during the Sri Pada Season. Police sniffer dogs were being used and were located at checkpoints at entry points to the site. According to the Police, some pilgrims were being checked out at the Hatton Railway Station as well and it was during one of these operations that the suspects had been rounded up. All those arrested were aged from 20 to 30. BY C. D. H. Hewage – Watawala

title: Australia and Sri Lanka to enhance cooperation
author: Author not found
Content: Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena thanked Australia for the assistance provide to Sri Lanka to strengthen maritime security in the Indian Ocean region and requested for further assistance to provide GPS technology for fishing vessels to strengthen communication networks. He was speaking to Australian High Commissioner Paul Stephens, who called on him at the Prime Minister’s Office. The Prime Minister said more Australian universities could establish affiliated campuses in Sri Lanka to attract not only local students but also from other countries in Asia, Middle East and Africa. He added that investors should also enter into new areas such as fisheries, agriculture, information technology, renewable energy, electronics and tourism. He thanked Australia for the support extended to Sri Lanka to overcome the current economic crisis, especially for the supply of medicine and essential items worth Australian Dollars 75 million. High Commissioner Stephens assured support to Sri Lanka at the discussions with the International Monetary Fund and at the meetings of the Paris Club. First Secretary Shannon Murney and Secretary to the Prime Minister, Anura Dissanayake also participated in the discussion.

title: Tea prices 2nd highest ever in dollar terms in 2022
author: Author not found
Content: National tea sales average (NTSA) of USD 3.83 a kilo established last year is the second highest NTSA seen thus far by Ceylon Teas, Forbes and Walker Tea Brokers Managing Director Yshan Fernando told this newspaper on Wednesday (4 January). However, the record high NTSA of USD 4.11 per kg established five years ago in 2017 is, ipso facto, the highest ever price Ceylon Tea has fetched up to date, Forbes in a statement said yesterday. Recently, Ceylon Chamber of Commerce Chairman and Sunshine Holdings PLC Managing Director Vish Govindasamy told this newspaper recently that international tea prices move in tandem with crude oil prices.“When international crude oil prices rise, tea prices rise and when they fall, tea prices also fall,” he said. Sunshine is one of the country’s major tea exporters. With the invasion of Russia by Ukraine last February, crude oil prices received an upward thrust after the international community led by the West imposed bans and price controls on Russian crude oil, sending crude oil prices almost sky high as a result. Russia, after Saudi Arabia, is the world’s second largest crude oil producer. Meanwhile, with the sharp depreciation of the rupee witnessed last year, NTSA in rupee terms achieved a record high price of Rs 1,234.21 per kg last year, a Year-on-Year increase of 100.55 per cent (Rs 618.80), compared to an NTSA price of Rs 615.44 per kg fetched in 2021, said Forbes. (PA)

title: Protest held in Trincomalee town
author: Author not found
Content: A protest was held yesterday (5) morning opposite the McHeyzer Stadium in Trincomalee town, urging Tamil political parties to collaborate and demand for the devolution of power in the North and East within a united Sri Lanka. A large number of youth, social activists, and community organisations took part in the protest, organised by the North and East Coordinating Committee. One of the organisers, V. Navaneethan said they have planned to stage similar protests in Vavuniya, Mullaitivu, Kilinochchi, Mannar, Jaffna, Ampara, Batticaloa, and Trincomalee until 10 January.   A series of protests titled ‘Let’s unite and let’s tell it loudly’ is presently underway in the Eastern Province and one such protest was held at Navatkuli Junction in Jaffna with the participation of war-affected persons and community organisations, Navaneethan added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Critics are politically incompetent – Sajith
author: Author not found
Content: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said, those who criticise his bus donations to schools are politically incompetent. Premadasa was speaking at an occasion to hand over the 57th bus under the ‘Sakwala’ programme to Prof. Ediriweera Sarachchandra Vidyalaya in Kolonnawa on Tuesday (3). “Those who criticise me are envious of me. Only incapable people criticise my endeavour to donate busses to schools. This is not merely donating busses to schools, but an extension of free education introduced by the late C.W.W. Kannangara,” Premadasa said. Premadasa added: “I call upon those who criticise me to come and join me in carrying out this work going forward.” Further, he asked schoolchildren to be prepared to study subjects like Artificial Intelligence, Augmented Reality, and Virtual Reality in the future. “The future SJB Government will promote digital exports. English-centred education and English language centres should be set up in all schools and I will lead these efforts,” he said. By Nabiya Vaffoor

title: Graveside memorial service to mark 14th anniversary of Lasantha’s assassination
author: Author not found
Content: The 14th anniversary of the assassination of The Sunday Leader founder Editor-in-Chief Lasantha Wickrematunge, which falls on 8 January, will be marked with a service at his graveside. Family, friends, former colleagues and others will gather at the Kanatte Cemetery, Borella at 9 a.m. to mark the anniversary and remember Lasantha. Assassinated on 8 January 2009, Lasantha was one of Sri Lanka’s leading journalists and an outspoken critic of the then Rajapaksa Government. He was attacked as he drove to work and later died of his injuries. The brazen attack was carried out by two gunmen on motorcycles in the middle of morning-rush-hour traffic. The investigation into Lasantha’s murder has yielded no tangible results thus far and his killers still roam free, 14 years later.

title: Pelwatte Sugar Industries hits 2022 production target
author: Author not found
Content: The management of Pelwatte Sugar Industries said, they had been able to fulfil their production targets set for 2022. Its sources said, during the past year, over 100,000 sugarcane crops had been crushed and they were able to produce 24,000 metric tonnes of sugar along with 7.8 million litres of ethanol. Pelwatte Sugar Industries had also been able to increase its profits due to the spike in the price of 1 kg of sugar from Rs 86 to Rs 300 and the increase in the price of 1 litre of ethanol from Rs 350 to Rs 1,025. By Nadun Gunathileke – Bibila

title: Title not found
author: Author not found
Content: Date:  A tense situation erupted in the Parliament Chamber yesterday (5) after Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena presented a ministerial report on MP Premnath C. Dolawatte’s Private Member’s Bill on amending the Local Government Election Act. The Opposition slammed Gunawardena’s report as a sinister attempt to postpone the LG Poll which is scheduled for March this year. However, the PM said he simply presented the report as per the Standing Orders of Parliament and the report will be taken up for debate today (6). Meanwhile, Jathika Jana Balawegaya (JJB) Leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake questioned the Government whether correct procedure is being followed with regard to Dolawatte’s Bill. Dissanayake: “Dolawatte presented this Bill on 2 November 2022. Since it is a Private Member’s Bill, a ministerial report with amendments and recommendations should be presented to Parliament. Thereafter, the Bill should be referred to Cabinet. After Cabinet approval is granted, the Bill is presented to Parliament to be included in the Order Book. This is the standard procedure with regard to a Private Member’s Bill. I would like to ask if the Government is following this procedure.” Dissanayake said, if six months has elapsed since presenting the Bill to Parliament, there is no need to present it to Cabinet. “However, in this case six months hasn’t elapsed. So a ministerial report has been presented. Therefore, this has to go to Cabinet along with the report,” he pointed out. The JJB Leader said the Election Commission has already announced the nomination dates and the political parties are preparing to submit their nominations. “This Bill has been presented to introduce a youth quota in nominations. If the Bill is passed before the nominations are called, there might be issues in submitting and accepting nominations and it could lead to a delay of holding the election,” he said. Dissanayake said they are in favour of introducing a youth quota, but not for the upcoming LG Elections. By Aloka Kasturiarachchi Popular

title: Manusha lauds SLBFE workers
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment Manusha Nanayakkara appreciated his ministry employees for being willing to work even though some of their allowances have been scrapped. Addressing employees of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), recently, Nanayakkara said, the staff worked hard and dedicated themselves in labour-related matters to send 311,269 people abroad for work in 2022. He further said, the SLBFE utilises the funds carefully and spends the money on behalf of Sri Lankan migrant workers. “Last year, we were able to conduct many new programmes for migration workers. We have introduced the pension scheme they have been waiting for many years. A special gate was opened for them at the airport, when going abroad,” he added. The Minister also said, he intends to provide services to more Sri Lankan migrant workers this year without any discrimination. By Nabiya Vaffoor

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Forest density shrinks to 16%
author: Author not found
Content: Due to massive environmental destruction in Sri Lanka, the forest density, which was 83 per cent in 1882, has shrunk to 16 per cent by now, and 395 elephants have been killed between 1 January and 5 December 2022, the Centre for Environment and Nature Studies (CENS) said. In a media briefing, the CENS said despite the fact that the President and Cabinet changed in 2022, there was no reduction in environmental destruction, and that losing forest density caused by large-scale environmental destruction can be considered the most severe environmental damage. According to Ven. Karimaditte Gnanarama Thera, the forest percentage has dropped from 83 per cent in 1882 to 16 per cent today. Environmentalist Dimuthu Sandaruwan said the death of one or more elephants per day in Sri Lanka is a serious problem, and over 395 elephant deaths have occurred in 2022, with the Government taking no steps to alleviate the human-elephant conflict. Speaking at the media briefing, actor Chaminda Jayasuriya said a political solution to the environmental problem is required, and that Sri Lanka has not paid significant attention to the environmental problem for the past 74 years. (TR)

title: Police lament lack of facilities to nab inebriated drivers
author: Author not found
Content: Police officers said, the lack of equipment and facilities has prevented them from apprehending drivers under the influence of liquor. They said whenever inebriated drivers are apprehended they need to be produced before a JMO and a report has to be obtained. They said, when JMOs are not found in some hospitals and a normal medical report is submitted such reports are rejected by Courts. They also said, transporting drivers under the influence of liquor to either hospital or Court has become an issue for want of fuel for vehicles. Hence, they urge the Police Department to look into these shortcomings and address it to perform their duty expeditiously. BY A. Siwanetti – Ahungalla

title: Wimal urges Govt not to tax ‘war heroes’
author: Author not found
Content: MP Wimal Weerawansa yesterday (5) urged the Government not to tax the salaries of disabled soldiers, as their whole family is dependent on them. Speaking in Parliament, Weerawansa said it is inhumane to tax the salaries of people who defended the country and have become disabled as a result. “These are our war heroes. The country is indebted to them and we have to take care of them. It is the responsibility of the country. But now, their salaries are being taxed because of new tax policies,” he stressed. In response, Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena emphasised that decisions are taken in general in setting up tax systems and the relevant matter will be considered in the future. By Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: Elephants terrorise Galhitiya villagers
author: Author not found
Content: Chandika Wijerama, a resident of Galahitiya village, said that due to wild elephants from the Lunugamvehera Forest Reserve roaming in nearby villages, villagers living in Galahitiya, in the Kataragama Divisional Secretariat, were harassed as they could not venture out to carry on their lives. He said, the roaming elephants in the afternoon have prevented villagers from stepping out of their homes to carry out their day-to-day activities. Wijerama added that despite constant reminders, made to the authorities, to end the menace it has yet not yielded desired results. He warned that if measures are not taken to address the issue the lives and properties of villagers will be at the mercy of these pachyderms. BY Ariyapala Ratnayake – Kataragama

title: Sepal Amarasinghe to be severely dealt with
author: Author not found
Content: Maximum legal action under the Penal Code will be taken against Sepal Amarasinghe, who insulted the Sacred Tooth Relic at Sri Dalada Maligawa on social media platforms recently, Justice Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe said.  The Justice Minister also said that acting in a way that harms religious beliefs is an offence punishable by imprisonment of up to ten years and alleged that he is a part of a group that works towards the downfall of Buddhism.  Sepal Amarasinghe’s recent remarks on Sri Dalada Maligawa sparked controversy in the country. Speaking in Parliament yesterday (5), Rajapakshe emphasised that under Section 290 of the Penal Code, if a person insults a religious belief and acts in such a way as to break the hearts of those who believe in that religion, it is a punishable offence. “Amarasinghe is identified as someone who does not follow any religion. It is his right to follow a religion or not. However, he does not have the right to insult a belief of those who follow a religion. Therefore, we will take legal action against this person,” he said. Meanwhile, State Minister Diana Gamage alleged the major objective of hate speech published on social media on sensitive topics is a tactic to claim asylum abroad and warned that action should be taken against Sepal Amarasinghe in a way where he won’t be able to flee the country. Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said this person is identified as a member of the ‘Aragalaya,’ while claiming allegations that Amarasinghe was a head of a state institution during the tenure of former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is totally false. By Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: PM receives blessings at Navagamuwa Rajamaha Vihara
author: Author not found
Content: Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena participated in religious ceremonies at the historical Navagamuwa Rajamaha Vihara and Paththini Devalaya (Shrine of the Goddess Paththini) on 4 January and received blessings from Malwane Pannasara Thera, Mahanayake of Sri Kalyani Samagri Dharma Maha Sangha Sabha. The Chief Incumbent of the historical Navagamuwa Rajamaha Vihara, Malwane Pannasara Thera explained that “Navagamuwa Sacred Land and Paththini Devalaya are not strange places for the Prime Minister. The Prime Minister’s grandfather, Boralugoda Ralahami took charge of the site and worked to develop this place.” “The Prime Minister visited the Paththini Devalaya even when he was a child and participated in various events and did various activities for the development of this place,” added the Mahanayake Thera. “Because of your patience and dedication to the country and the people, you became the Prime Minister of this country. As a person who works for the country with commitment, your present position is important for the future of the country,” he said, and added that the Prime Minister has a great responsibility to fulfil the needs of this temple and he expressed confidence that those duties will be continued in the future as well. Parliamentarian Yadamini Gunawardena also joined the Prime Minister on the occasion and received blessings on his birthday. Jayantha Rohana, Chairman of Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha and members of Kaduwela Municipal Council also participated in this event.

title: Amending Election Law, latest ploy to delay Election – Gammanpila
author: Author not found
Content: The Government is trying to change election laws, on the proposed 25 per cent youth representation quota, as a last attempt to postpone the Local Government Election, Pivithuru Hela Urumaya (PHU) Leader Udaya Gammanpila said. He said, right now the Government is trying to postpone the election through a judicial process. Speaking to the media yesterday (4), he said according to the Government’s plan, the Secretary of the Ministry of Finance will go to Court and declare that there is insufficient money to hold an Election. The Election Commission (EC) will announce the dates of the Election soon, and in the meantime, a State official has petitioned Court to prevent the LG Election from taking place.  “If there is no such plan to postpone the Election, why would the Secretary of the Ministry of Finance become a respondent in the case? This drama is irrational because the Government’s lack of funds cannot be presented to Court. Furthermore, the Government has printed money at the rate of Rs 3 billion per day throughout  2022. That is, if the EC receives three days’ worth of funds, the Election can be held. That is why we ask the Government to hold the Election rather than act like there isn’t enough money,” he said. He said, the Government now has another trump card: postponing the Election by changing the Election Law before Nomination Day. He said, that if such a Bill is presented to Parliament, it will undoubtedly be challenged in Court. “The Court has already decided that in order to postpone an Election, the consent of the people must be taken through a referendum. To escape from this, the Government can avoid going to Court by amending Election Laws. A Bill amending the Election Law to give youth 25% of nomination opportunities is in the Order Book. The deadline to challenge the Bill in Court has expired now. This Bill can be debated in Parliamentary Committees, and a provision can be inserted in the draft to postpone the Election,” he said. BY Thameenah Razeek

title: PRESIDENT TELLS EC TO RESOLVE INTERNAL CONFLICTS
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe has informed the Election Commission (EC) to resolve its internal conflicts over holding Local Government Elections expeditiously and inform him of the collective agreement of the EC on the matter, Ceylon Today reliably learns. The President met four members of the EC including its Chairman Nimal Punchihewa yesterday (5) to discuss about the LG Polls. One EC member did not participate in the meeting. Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and Attorney General Sanjay Rajaratnam too participated in the meeting. Ceylon Today learns that the four EC members held different opinions on holding the election and it led the President to tell them to resolve their internal conflicts. The President informed them to consult the Attorney General over legal barriers if any and let him know about the EC’s collective decision on the matter. The Attorney General said if there are legal matters, the AG’s Department will help the EC to resolve them. By J.T. de Silva

title: Applications called for ‘National Youth Platform’
author: Author not found
Content: The National Youth Platform will be formed concurrently with the 75th National Independence Day celebrations on the instructions of President Ranil Wickremesinghe, the President’s Media Division announced yesterday (5). The National Youth Platform’s objective is to give Sri Lankan youth the opportunity to be a part of the nation-building process in making Sri Lanka a prosperous and well-developed nation by the year 2048. The whole programme is oriented to kick-start a 25-year development agenda and makes youth responsible partners in the process. By the year 2048, the present youth of the nation will be adults and will be playing key roles in the Government and private sectors of the country. Thus, it is in their hands to work from now onwards to make this country a better place and not complain about the system or politicians in the future. The President has a firm belief that if the youth want to make a change they have to come forward and take leadership and the National Youth Platform is the opportunity for them to emerge. Applications are open to become a part of the National Youth Platform under three different categories; Member, Youth Organisation, and Adviser. Individuals can apply as a member by submitting their CVs and Proposals for a selected focus area from the list below. Organisations will have to send a report with details of the membership base and the projects and programmes they have done over the years, to gain membership. People with expert knowledge in the focussed areas can apply or be nominated as an advisor to the programme and will be chosen after an interview process. Age Limit for Member Category is 16-35 and all members below the age of 40 for Youth Organisation Category. All ages can apply for Adviser Category. The National Youth Platform will have the following focus areas: Law and Economy, Education, Vocational Training, Talent for the Future, Sustainable Development and Climate Action, Health, Safe Food and Water standards, National Security, Diplomacy and International Relations, Agriculture, Fisheries & Animal Husbandry, Sports, Aesthetics – Art, Music, Drama, Film, Architecture, etc., Industry, Innovation, and Entrepreneurship, Sustainable Cities and Communities, Protection of Water, Air, Land, and Animals, Governance, Technology for Governance, Transparency and Anti-Corruption, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for National Development and Just Society All applicants must choose only one focus area they would like to work on. A self-written application can be sent through email or registered post to the following addresses on or before 31 January: Email: [email protected] Postal: Director Youth and Sustainable Development, Presidential Secretariat, Colombo 1. Those who are willing to volunteer for the core team of the National Youth Platform as a volunteer in administration, content creation, IT, marketing, logistics, and finances, such persons can  directly contact the Director of Youth and Sustainable Development at the Presidential Secretariat through the above email address.

title: CBSL expects IMF facility in early 2023
author: Author not found
Content: IMF on their Sri Lanka website on Wednesday (4) forecast that the economy will contract by 8.7 per cent this year, while the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) on the same day without giving any forecasts has however said it is expected to record a gradual recovery from the second half of this year (2023) and sustain the growth momentum beyond. IMF further projected that consumer prices this year are expected to increase by 48 per cent Year-on-Year. Meanwhile, the CBSL estimated that the economy would have shrunk by around eight per cent last year (2022). The economy grew by 3.7 per cent in 2021, according to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka. Meanwhile, CBSL further said on Wednesday that measures are underway to secure financing assurances from official creditors for the debt restructuring process aimed at ensuring medium-term public debt sustainability. With significant progress being made at present in relation to the interaction with the Sri Lankan creditors, the envisaged IMF facility is expected to materialise in early 2023. CBSL has presently reached a staff-level agreement with the IMF for the disbursement of a total of USD 2.9 billion, to be given out to the country in tranches, spread over a four-year period. But a precondition for this disbursement is that Sri Lanka’s creditors should unanimously agree to restructure its debt. At present, China is pussyfooting in restructuring the debt owed to it by Sri Lanka, thereby delaying the disbursement of IMF money. By Paneetha Ameresekere

title: IATA Director General calls to restrict Chinese travellers
author: Author not found
Content: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) Director General urged all Governments to restrict Chinese travellers as ineffective testing methods in the past had destroyed global economies. IATA Director General Willie Walsh yesterday (4) said Governments must base their decisions on ‘science facts’ rather than ‘science politics’.” China announced it will reopen its border to international travellers on 8 January 2023, after the country made an abrupt U-turn on its Covid-19 containment policies. Countries including the US, Japan, India and Italy has already announced mandatory Covid testing on visitors from China as the coronavirus spread after China eased Covid-19 rules. His warning comes as Chinese tourists travelling in the backdrop of Covid-19 spread in China. He said several countries are introducing Covid-19 testing and other measures for travellers from China, even though the virus is already circulating widely within their borders. It is extremely disappointing to see this knee-jerk reinstatement of measures that have proven ineffective over the last three years. Research undertaken around the arrival of the Omicron variant concluded that putting barriers in the way of travel made no difference to the peak spread of infections. At most, restrictions delayed that peak by a few days. If a new variant emerges in any part of the world, the same situation would be expected.  That’s why governments should listen to the advice of experts, including the WHO, that advice against travel restrictions. We have the tools to manage Covid-19 without resorting to ineffective measures that cut off international connectivity, damage economies and destroy jobs. Governments must base their decisions on ‘science facts’ rather than ‘science politics’.” By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: Bail decision on 25 accused today
author: Author not found
Content: The three-Judge Bench of the Colombo High Court (CHC), yesterday announced that its decision on whether to grant bail or not to 25 accused including Naufer Moulavi on the Easter Sunday terror attacks in 2019, will be delivered today (5). The case was heard before the HC Bench, consisting of Judges Damith Thotawatta, Amal Ranaraja and Navaratne Marasinghe. After being noticed at the previous hearing, the second witness to the trial, head of the SIS Suresh Salley was present in Court. The Bench however ordered Salley to be released instructing him to be present in Court only when noticed. Prisons Department Officials informed Court, that the 14th accused in the trial, was presently being treated at the Kandy General Hospital. Accordingly the Bench ordered the Director of the Prisons Department, to submit a detailed medical report concerning the accused, when Court meets today. The Attorney General has indicted 25 accused before the High Court, of conspiracy and aiding and abetting the setting off of bombs, targeting Catholic Churches and tourist hotels in Colombo and its suburbs on Easter Sunday in 2019. By Hansi Nanayakkara

title: India to support Sri Lanka uplift dairy sector
author: Author not found
Content: Indian High Commissioner Gopal Baglay and President Ranil Wickremesinghe held discussions at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday (4). Discussions focussed on raising milk production and providing necessary technical support to produce liquid milk in Sri Lanka together with the National Dairy Development Board (NDDB) of India and Amul Milk Company. The objective is to make Sri Lanka self-sufficient in milk and milk products in the long term with short and medium-term goals to double local milk production. The President appointed a committee consisting of representatives of the public and private sectors to work with the multidisciplinary team of the National Dairy Development Board of India to prepare a short, medium and long-term plan for the development of the dairy sector in the country. This endeavour is aimed at preventing the decline in milk production and dependence on imported milk in Sri Lanka. The discussion was held between the members of the committee and representatives of the National Dairy Board of India (NDDB). The discussion was attended by Indian High Commissioner Gopal Baglay, Dr. Rakesh Pandey; First Secretary, Economic and Commercial Affairs, representatives of the National Dairy Development Board of India and Amul Milk Company, Sagala Ratnayake; Senior Adviser to the President on National Security and Chief of Presidential Staff, Saman Ekanayake; President’s Secretary and a group of public and private sector representatives appointed by the President.

title: Pension Dept staff will have to work overtime
author: Author not found
Content: Director General of the Department of Pensions A. Jagath D. Dias said that due to the policy decision taken by the Government to limit the retirement age of public servants to 60 years, staff on duty will have to work overtime in the coming months. He said, this situation has arisen due to 12, 000 employees who were scheduled to retire at the end of last year who would now be included in the annual retirement figure of 27, 000 comprising sectors such as the civil service, the three armed services, etc. Dias was addressing staffers at the Department’s New Year ceremony. By Amith Maduranga Gamage

title: Obtaining booster doses only way – Dr. Ginige
author: Author not found
Content: Enhancing immunity against the coronavirus by obtaining the booster doses and observing personal hygiene is the only way the new sub-variant of Covid – Omicron could be kept in check, Acting Epidemiologist, Dr. Samitha Ginige said. Speaking to the media at the Health Promotion Bureau (HPB) yesterday (4), Dr. Ginige said, “no country can stop the virus from entering a 100 per cent owing to globalisation, the only way to prevent another surge would be obtaining the Covid-19 vaccine.” The new Omicron sub-variant – BF.7 has mostly affected the Western Pacific region. “It would be almost impossible to prevent a new or more lethal variant or sub-variant from entering the country. But it would be easier to prevent the pandemic from reaching epidemic proportions should timely action be taken,” he observed. Fielding questions, he said there is no risk to the country at present from the new sub-variant, therefore it is important to take the necessary vaccine doses to prevent another surge of the viral infection. However, any decision with regard to an increase in testing or any other related decision would have to be taken in consultation with relevant stakeholders, he said.   Dr. Ginige said primary Covid vaccination had been completed by October 2021. However, from the 14.2 million over 20s population, only 8.1 million obtained the first booster dose. There are over 6 million more persons to obtain the primary booster dose. He said while conducting research on the new BF.7 sub-variant, even the World Health Organization (WHO) had issued instructions for the booster dose to be administered to those who had not received even a single of the booster doses. Although the Pfizer vaccine expired, the Expert Committee has recommended that the Sinopharm vaccine be administered as the booster, he said. With the above 60 age group being identified as high risk, the Chief Epidemiologist stressed on the need for them to obtain the booster doses as soon as possible. They comprised at least 78 per cent of the Covid deaths in the country. The response was very poor for the Health Ministry’s call for this age group to obtain the second booster as well. Although there were 2.7 million over 60s population, only 200,000 obtained the second booster. He urged those over 60 who also suffered from chronic illnesses to obtain the second booster as soon as possible. Those above 18 years who have not taken a single dose of the Covid vaccine as well as those who have only taken one dose of it should obtain the relevant dose as soon as possible. Dr. Ginige said there were 1.8 million Sinopharm vaccines available to those who have not taken their relevant anti-Covid vaccine dose. Meanwhile, Director General of Health Services (DGHS), Dr. Asela Gunawardena, issuing a circular, said the remaining Covid-19 Sinopharm vaccines could be used to strengthen the Covid vaccination campaign. The Health Ministry will use the remaining Sinopharm vaccines to strengthen the vaccination campaign by administering it to those above 18 years including pregnant women to complete primary vaccination against the disease. The DGHS, in a circular issued to the Director National Hospitals, Provincial and Regional Directors of Health and the Directors of Teaching Hospitals, Provincial General Hospitals and Base Hospitals said the Sinopharm doses would be offered to those above 18 years including pregnant women who had taken one dose of any Covid-19 vaccine type to complete the primary vaccination. The DGHS said the first booster dose could be given to anyone above 20 who had completed two doses with any Covid-19 vaccine type and “three months had lapsed after the second dose, irrespective of the comorbidity status, pregnancy, or lactation.” Also, the second booster dose for anyone above 20 who has completed three doses with any Covid-19 vaccine type and three months had lapsed from the third dose, he added.  By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: TNA ready to face LG Elections
author: Author not found
Content: Following the Election Commission’s announcement that Local Government Elections will be held and that nomination dates had been set, the Tamil National Alliance (TNA) welcomed the decision and said that they will find suitable candidates to contest, giving preference to youth and women. TNA previously stated that it will contest the Election on an individual basis and will be able to reclaim its seats. However, some Tamil political parties have expressed their willingness to form an alliance led by Mawai Senathiraja. This suggestion has been expressed by MP Wigneswaran, Leader of Tamil Makkal Kootani (TMK) On this matter, Sumanthiran stated that the ITAK’s Central Committee will meet on 7 January in Batticaloa to discuss the matter. “We will make a decision at that meeting. Our political group has also made a recommendation on this, which will be discussed at the meeting”, he said. The three parties namely, the Eelam People’s Revolutionary Liberation Front led by Suresh Premachandran, the TMK and the political party led by lawyer N. Srikantha has suggested to form an alliance led by Mawai Senathirajah a TNA senior. TNA spokesman MP M.A. Sumanthiran said yesterday (4) “We welcome this move. We are aware that the government tried everything to postpone or avoid this election, and the TNA position has always been that timely elections are the bedrock of democracy and should never be postponed or avoided. So, we are pleased that the Elections Commission has gone ahead and announced that the local council elections will be held.” He added that Provincial Councils in the country have not been functioning for some time due to a legal snag, which should be corrected immediately and PC Elections should also be held. “As for the Ilankai Tamil Arasu Katchi (ITAK) the main constituent of the TNA, we have invited our branch organisations to apply for nominations to contest this election, and we will pick the most suitable candidates, giving priority to the youth and women. We have also asked suitable candidates to come forward through their branches at the village and ward levels to our constituency branch, and we will be able to select the right people to contest on our behalf and seek public support he added. Mawai Senathirajah speaking to Ceylon Today said MP Wigneswaran had expressed that he could lead these three parties. “We are holding discussions on this,” Senathirajah said. President Ranil Wickremesinghe stated that he would like to find a solution to the Tamil issue before 4 February 2023, and he held an All Party Conference. He then met TNA Leader R. Sampanthan and Sumanthiran. “Discussions are ongoing, and all Tamil political parties in the North and East want to work together by forming a stronger alliance,” Leader of People’s Liberation Organization of Tamil Eelam (PLOTE) MP Dharmalingam Sithadthan said. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Election Commission divided: Govt to consult AG on Polls
author: Author not found
Content: The Government has decided to consult the Attorney General on the reported indecision of Election Commission (EC) members on holding the Local Government Election this year. The majority of EC members are reportedly against Chairman Nimal Punchihewa’s opinion that the LG Polls should be held. Meanwhile, election monitoring organisations were of the view that many issues would arise due to the differing views of EC members if nominations are called. At least Rs 12 billion is required to hold the LG Election whereas only Rs 10 billion is allocated in the Budget 2023, sources said. In such a backdrop, the majority of EC members reportedly believe that announcing an Election date should be delayed even if nominations are called. However, according to EC sources, the EC Chairman believes the Finance Ministry would provide additional funds. Meanwhile, Speaking to Ceylon Today, EC Chairman, Punchihewa said the announcement to call for nominations for LG Poll was issued following the collective agreement of EC members. According to the notice, future activities pertaining to holding the Poll will take place through District Returning Officers.

title: Magisterial inquest held in camera
author: Author not found
Content: The magisterial inquest into the death of Director of Janashakthi Insurance PLC Dinesh Schaffter was held in camera before Colombo Additional Magistrate Rajindra Jayasuriya following a request made by the family. When the case pertaining to the death of Schaffter was taken up, the Additional Magistrate having perused a request made by the family of the victim, announced that the magisterial inquest will be held in camera. Accordingly, the evidence was heard in the private Chamber of the Chief Magistrate. The inquest commenced at around 12.30 p.m. yesterday (4) and reportedly lasted for over two hours. The spouse of the deceased, Taniya Schaffter, along with a Director of a company owned by the deceased, H.H. Patrick Chris Perera, testified at the inquest. Meanwhile, Additional Magistrate Jayasuriya ordered to defer further proceedings of the trial to 10 January, when testimony will be recorded from two labourers at the General Cemetery, Borella. By Hansi Nanayakkara

title: IATA Director General calls to restrict Chinese travellers
author: Author not found
Content: The International Air Transport Association (IATA) Director General urged all Governments to restrict Chinese travellers as ineffective testing methods in the past had destroyed global economies. IATA Director General Willie Walsh yesterday (4) said Governments must base their decisions on ‘science facts’ rather than ‘science politics’.” China announced it will reopen its border to international travellers on 8 January 2023, after the country made an abrupt U-turn on its Covid-19 containment policies. Countries including the US, Japan, India and Italy has already announced mandatory Covid testing on visitors from China as the coronavirus spread after China eased Covid-19 rules. His warning comes as Chinese tourists travelling in the backdrop of Covid-19 spread in China. He said several countries are introducing Covid-19 testing and other measures for travellers from China, even though the virus is already circulating widely within their borders. It is extremely disappointing to see this knee-jerk reinstatement of measures that have proven ineffective over the last three years. Research undertaken around the arrival of the Omicron variant concluded that putting barriers in the way of travel made no difference to the peak spread of infections. At most, restrictions delayed that peak by a few days. If a new variant emerges in any part of the world, the same situation would be expected.  That’s why governments should listen to the advice of experts, including the WHO, that advice against travel restrictions. We have the tools to manage Covid-19 without resorting to ineffective measures that cut off international connectivity, damage economies and destroy jobs. Governments must base their decisions on ‘science facts’ rather than ‘science politics’.” By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: Bail decision on 25 accused today
author: Author not found
Content: The three-Judge Bench of the Colombo High Court (CHC), yesterday announced that its decision on whether to grant bail or not to 25 accused including Naufer Moulavi on the Easter Sunday terror attacks in 2019, will be delivered today (5). The case was heard before the HC Bench, consisting of Judges Damith Thotawatta, Amal Ranaraja and Navaratne Marasinghe. After being noticed at the previous hearing, the second witness to the trial, head of the SIS Suresh Salley was present in Court. The Bench however ordered Salley to be released instructing him to be present in Court only when noticed. Prisons Department Officials informed Court, that the 14th accused in the trial, was presently being treated at the Kandy General Hospital. Accordingly the Bench ordered the Director of the Prisons Department, to submit a detailed medical report concerning the accused, when Court meets today. The Attorney General has indicted 25 accused before the High Court, of conspiracy and aiding and abetting the setting off of bombs, targeting Catholic Churches and tourist hotels in Colombo and its suburbs on Easter Sunday in 2019. By Hansi Nanayakkara

title: India to support Sri Lanka uplift dairy sector
author: Author not found
Content: Indian High Commissioner Gopal Baglay and President Ranil Wickremesinghe held discussions at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday (4). Discussions focussed on raising milk production and providing necessary technical support to produce liquid milk in Sri Lanka together with the National Dairy Development Board (NDDB) of India and Amul Milk Company. The objective is to make Sri Lanka self-sufficient in milk and milk products in the long term with short and medium-term goals to double local milk production. The President appointed a committee consisting of representatives of the public and private sectors to work with the multidisciplinary team of the National Dairy Development Board of India to prepare a short, medium and long-term plan for the development of the dairy sector in the country. This endeavour is aimed at preventing the decline in milk production and dependence on imported milk in Sri Lanka. The discussion was held between the members of the committee and representatives of the National Dairy Board of India (NDDB). The discussion was attended by Indian High Commissioner Gopal Baglay, Dr. Rakesh Pandey; First Secretary, Economic and Commercial Affairs, representatives of the National Dairy Development Board of India and Amul Milk Company, Sagala Ratnayake; Senior Adviser to the President on National Security and Chief of Presidential Staff, Saman Ekanayake; President’s Secretary and a group of public and private sector representatives appointed by the President.

title: David Cameron visits Port City
author: Author not found
Content: Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, David Cameron, visited Port City Colombo development project during a private trip to the island. Cameron engaged in a discussion with Reyaz Mihular – Commission Member and Vindhya Weerasekera – Director Legal and Corporate Affairs of the Colombo Port City Economic Commission, Yang Lu – Managing Director of CHEC Port City Colombo (Pvt) Ltd to understand aspects of the public-private partnership and catalytic role of the project in transforming the economy. Renuka Weerakoon – Director General, BOI was also present at the meeting. Briefing the former British PM, Deputy Managing Director of CHEC Port City Colombo (Pvt) Ltd – Thulci Aluwihare explained that the ambition is to create a destination appeal for businesses to leverage Port City Colombo as a platform to access the region. Further, coupled with an attractive regulatory regime, Port City Colombo will be positioned as an alternate location to Singapore and Dubai with its cost competitiveness and attractive quality of living. In response to Cameron’s inquiry on the unique selling point of the project against similar destinations in South Asia, Aluwihare explained that Port City Colombo offers beyond a geographical advantage, with a comprehensive package of fiscal and non-fiscal incentives to enhance ease of doing business. The Commission is a single window investment facilitator with the ability to implement dynamic regulations, liberal foreign exchange regime, an open labour market and attractive investment incentives. In addition, as Sri Lanka’s first master planned city, Port City Colombo will create an attractive living environment focused on green and smart living. Cameron’s visit to the project site was in view of fostering greater cooperation on promoting Port City Colombo to potential investors. He was also the first high-level delegate to visit the Port City Colombo development project in 2023.

title: Kumar Nadesan, only Lankan selected globally
author: Author not found
Content: Kumar Nadesan, Managing Director of the 92-year-old Virakesari published by Express Newspapers, is the only Sri Lankan among 27 others selected globally to receive the coveted Pravasi Bharatiya Samman Award. The Award is given by the President of India to honour exceptional and meritorious contributions in their chosen field/profession both in India and abroad. Kumar Nadesan serves as Chairman of the Sri Lanka Press Institute and represents the Newspaper Society of Sri Lanka. In addition, he serves as a Chairman of the Press Complaints Commission of Sri Lanka. He is also President of the Global Organization of People of Indian Origin (Sri Lanka) and has been a recipient of the ‘Service Above Self’ from Rotary International for community work. The 17th edition of the Pravasi Bharatiya Divas is scheduled to be held from 8-10 January 2023 at Indore, Madhya Pradesh, where Droupadi Murmu, President of India will confer the awards A Jury-cum-Awards Committee, with Jagdeep Dhankhar, Vice President of India as the Chairman and Subrahmanyam Jaishankar, External Affairs Minister as the Vice Chair and other distinguished members from various walks of life considered the nominations for the Pravasi Bharatiya Samman Awards, 2023 and unanimously selected the awardees for conferment of the Pravasi Bharatiya Samman Awards 2023. The awardees, who represent excellence achieved in different fields, include Jagadish Chennupati of Australia in the field of science and technology and education, Sanjeev Mehta of Bhutan in education, Dilip Loundo of Brazil in art and culture and education, Alexander Maliakel John of Brunei in medicine, VaikuntamIyer Lakshmanan of Canada in community welfare, Joginder Singh Nijjar of Croatia in art and culture, Ramjee Prasad of Denmark in IT and Kannan Ambalam of Ethiopia in community welfare, Reena Vinod Pushkarna of Israel in business and community welfare, Piyush Gupta of Singapore in business, and Mohanlal Hira and Sanjaykumar Shivabhai Patel of South Sudan in community welfare.

title: Dengue raising its ugly head
author: Author not found
Content: Galle District Epidemiologist, Dr. Eranga Hettiarachchi said during the past year, 3,200 people had been detected with the dengue virus while of them three had succumbed. He said the highest number of patients had been reported from Galle, Akmeemana, Balapitiya, Habaraduwa, Bope and Poddala Divisional Secretariats. Dr. Hettiarachchi added that the three who had succumbed were from Galle, Hikkaduwa and Ambalangoda areas. BY Kamal Wijehewa – Galle

title: Veterinarian remanded for bribery
author: Author not found
Content: Colombo Chief Magistrate Prasanna Alwis remanded, till 17 January, a veterinarian, who charged with soliciting a bribe. The suspect veterinarian had been charged with seeking a bribe of Rs 26,000, to facilitate the registration of 30 head of cattle owned by a complainant. The suspect veterinarian was identified as Balasingham Mayura, attached to the Veterinary Office situated at Karadiyakaru. The Bribery Commission told Magistrate Alwis that the suspect had been nabbed by their sleuths on 22 December last year, when he had sought the aforementioned bribe from a complainant. By Hansi Nanayakkara
