title: Rotract Uni Alumni gives a hand to USJ cleaning staff
author: Author not found
Content: Rotaract Club of University Alumni was chartered, on the 25 August 2014, by a group of 20 motivated and passionate past Rotaracters, from the Universities of Colombo, Peradeniya, Kelaniya and Sri Jayewardenepura (USJ), who wished to further practise their leadership skills and plan projects as young leaders that would make a difference locally and globally, holding hands with another 10 new members who were not previously involved with the RI Movement. The Club is sponsored by the Rotary Club of Colombo Metropolitan and currently has a 100 plus member base and keeps growing in numbers. The project, ‘Tribute’, is a community service project with the aim of paying the tribute to non-academic staff members in local universities, who provide the best care and safety not only to University students, but, also to the entire staff and community. The project is mainly focused on helping and supporting them, especially during this difficult situation in the country. The project was conducted by the Rotaract Club of University Alumni for the fourth consecutive time this year, with the intention of providing the necessary care and support for the cleaning staff members of University of Sri Jayewardenepura. The cleaning staff comprises 60 members. The project was carried out on Saturday (31 December) from 10.00 a.m. – 2.00 p.m, at Hadawila Open Air Theatre, University of Sri Jayewardenepura Dry ration packs were distributed to each of the cleaning staff during the event. The project objectives are to pay tribute to the cleaning staff of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura and to aid them in this difficult situation. Also, helping them in this post Covid pandemic situation and during this economic crisis are other objectives. Also, the organiser of this project was the Community Service Avenue of Rotaract Club of University Alumni. It  is one of the significant avenues of the Rotaract Club of University Alumni which carry out Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) under this avenue under the three joint directors Rotarians Dinushi Alwis, Krishani Chamodika and Romesh de Silva Rotarians Krishani Chamodika, Kasumi Gunasekara, Maheeka Ranawaka, Yeshika Fonseka, Jeyarami Gnanaranjan and Madusha Kannan are the project committee members. Donations to this project can be deposited to the Club Bank Account: Rotaract Club of University Alumni 86514893 Bank Of Ceylon – Maharagama. After making the donation the donors are requested to send the receipts to number, Rtr. Krishani Chamodika via Whatsapp 0771805480 The sponsorship partners are Link Natural, Unilever, CBL, Cream Soda, Norfolk and Ceylon Today.

title: Dubai scraps alcohol tax and licence fee
author: Author not found
Content: Dubai has scrapped its 30 per cent alcohol tax in an apparent bid to boost tourism. It will also stop charging for personal alcohol licences – something residents who want to drink at home must have. Dubai has been relaxing laws for some time, allowing the sale of alcohol in daylight during Ramadan and approving home delivery during the pandemic. This latest move is thought to be an attempt to make the city more attractive to foreigners, in the face of competition from neighbours. The two companies which distribute alcohol in Dubai, Maritime and Mercantile International (MMI), and African & Eastern, said they would reflect the cut in tax for consumers. “Since we began our operations in Dubai over 100 years ago, the emirate’s approach has remained dynamic, sensitive and inclusive for all,” MMI spokesman Tyrone Reid told AP. “These recently updated regulations are instrumental to continue ensuring the safe and responsible purchase and consumption of alcoholic beverages in Dubai and the UAE.” It is not clear if the move, which took effect on Sunday, will be permanent. The Financial Times described the move as a one-year trial, citing “industry executives informed of the decision”. (BBC)

title: Sri Lanka Troops in Mali Commended
author: Author not found
Content: The United Nations (UN) Multidimensional Integrated Stabilisation Mission in Mali (MINUSMA) Force Commander Lieutenant General C.J. Kees Matthijssen awarded ‘Force Commander’s Commendation’ certificates to the Sri Lankan Combat Convoy Company (CCC-4) members, including CCC-4 Commanding Officer Colonel Chandana Jayamaha, the Sri Lanka Army said. Quoting Matthijssen, the SL Army further said, “You have been providing security for logistic convoys under trying circumstances, having carried out operations covering more than 5,346 km while providing security to 154 fuel bowsers and 115 cargo trucks despite life-threatening risks and adverse weather and inhospitable terrains.” The Army, further quoting Matthijssen, said that he commended “CCC-4” for services rendered in the last five months and said that CCC-4 has performed its duties with outstanding dedication and professionalism as the only contingent conducting convoy operations to MINUSMA bases located in Kidal, Aguelhoc and Tessalit regions. The above function took place at the CCC-4 Camp at Gao, Mali.

title: Norwegian Embassy to Close in July
author: Author not found
Content: The Norwegian Embassy in Sri Lanka will cease operations in July, the Embassy said yesterday. As such, all passport work will come to an end during spring 2023, it added. Norwegians living in Sri Lanka, who wish to renew their passport, can contact the Embassy to make an appointment, it said. Following deadlines will apply for passport applications: 28 February 2023 – Last day for first-time applications for passport and requests for personal identification number, 28 April 2023 – Last day of applications for passport renewal and 31 May 2023 – Last day of applications for emergency passport, the Embassy said. “If one is in need of a passport or emergency passport after the above-mentioned dates, contact the Norwegian embassy in New Delhi, the Embassy added. (PA)

title: SLCG releases 9,574 sea turtle hatchlings
author: Author not found
Content: Last year, the Sri Lanka Coastguard (SLCG) conserved 18,945 turtle eggs and released 9,574 sea turtle hatchlings into the sea, a posting on the SLCG website on Sunday, but dated Saturday (31 December 2022), said. It further said that due to the collective efforts of SLCG personnel attached to theirlife-saving posts at Mirissa, Hikkaduwa, Unawatuna, Wellawatte, and Mount Lavinia, the SLCG recovered 1,084 sea turtle eggs from places close to their natural habitat during the seven-day period of 25 to 31 December 2022. Under the Coastguard Turtle Conservation Project (CGTCP), every effort has been made to conserve turtle eggs in or around their natural habitat to ensure protection since sea turtles are becoming a vulnerable species to extinction, SLCG further said. (PA)

title: AOA to Petition SC Over Samurdhi Bank’s Future
author: Author not found
Content: President of the All Ceylon Bank Unions (ACBU) and Administrative Officers Association (AOA) N. A. M. I. V. Abeysinghe said, his Association will petition the Supreme Court, within the next fortnight or so, over the failure of the Department of Management Services (DMS), attached to the Finance Ministry, to ratify the framework of the Samurdhi Bank Employees. He charged that the DMS has dragged its feet over the said matter for a period of 24 months and expressed fear that the modus operandi of the DMS is to allow the Samurdhi Banking sector to die a natural death. According to Abeysinghe, the President’s attention has to pay to the issue or else it will signal the death knell for the Samurdhi workers sooner than later. He made these remarks during a media conference held in Kandy yesterday.  BY K. L. Suraweera – Kandy

title: SL’s Ambassador to Türkiye participates wreath laying
author: Author not found
Content: Following the presentation of his Letters of Credence, to the President of the Republic of Türkiye, Sri Lanka’s Ambassador S. Hasanthi Urugodawatte Dissanayake participated in a Wreath Laying Ceremony at Anitkabir Mausoleum, in Ankara recently. Family members of the Ambassador, staff of the Embassy and Sri Lankan nationals residing in Türkiye also joined the Ambassador at the Ceremony.  The Ambassador was welcomed by the Chief of Protocol of the Anitkabir and the Ceremony consisted of wreath laying at the Mausoleum, observance of one minute’s silence, signing the ‘Book of Honour’ by the Ambassador and visiting the Atatürk Museum and the Independence War Museum.  Mustafa Kemal Atatürk is father of the Republic of Türkiye, who modernised the nation with secular, pluralist democratic features, which is a part of the ‘Kemalist’ ideology, which led to the empowerment of women as imperative for progress.  Ataturk’s reforms included a series of political, legal, religious, cultural, social and economic policy changes, designed to convert the new Republic of Türkiye into secular, modern nation-state, implemented under the leadership of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, in accordance with the Kemal ideology. Ataturk’s aspirations are continued by the current President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan bringing industrialisation and rapid development. In signing of the ‘Book of Honour’, the Ambassador wrote, “The founding father of the Turkish Republic, Veteran Mustafa Kemal Atatürk’s legacy is indeed phenomenal globally. He led Türkiye’s modernisation process, while advocating pluralism, democracy and secularism. Above all, as a female citizen of the planet earth, I see him as a visionary in understanding the role of women in society, which is a prerequisite for development of any human society.” Further, she wrote, “Veteran Mustafa Kemal Atatürk is a shining example for developing States, like my country, on how determination and resilience can achieve rapid development, while retaining cultural characteristics in a contemporary manner”.

title: Malaysian HC shifts
author: Author not found
Content: The new premises of Malaysian High Commission in Colombo, situated at No 122, Barnes Place, Colombo 7, was opened by Tun Seri Setia (Dr) Mohd Ali bin Mohd Rustam, the Governor of Melaka, Malaysia. Malaysian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka, Dato’ Tan Yang Thai also attended the event.

title: Steps being taken to relieve people of tax burden
author: Author not found
Content: State Minister of Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said steps would be taken to remove certain clauses from the Social Security Contribution Levy (SSCL), which cannot be borne by ordinary people, taking their poor economic situation into consideration due to the prevailing economic crisis in the country. “Many factions criticised the negative impacts of SSCL and its burden on ordinary people. I also agree with their claims,” he said. Siyambalapitiya revealed this during his inspection tour of the Embilipitiya Excise Station in the Ratnapura District. He added that they are looking to provide concessions to people who have been impacted by the imposing of burdensome taxes from the beginning of the year. “Nearly 90 per cent of the people are low income earners and we are talking of 10 per cent who are receiving the highest income. This 10 per cent has to make sacrifices for the survival of major portion of 90 per cent people in this country,” Siyambalapitiya said. “We are aware that the 10 per cent tax payers are also facing difficulties, while settling their taxes. Such taxes will not last for long and will come to end after getting the economy on correct track. We are also looking to provide concessions to tax payers from the beginning,” Siyambalapitiya added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Buhary appointed SJB Organiser for Digamadulla
author: Author not found
Content: Social worker M.I.A.R. Buhary, of Akkaraipattu, has been appointed as the Samagi Jana Balavegeya (SJB) Organiser for the Digamadulla District. The appointment was given recently, at the SJB head office in Colombo, by the Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa.  General Secretary of SJB Ranjith Maddumabandara was present. Buhary was serving as the Adviser to former Minister of Trade and Shipping A.R. Munsoor and he was also a Samurdi Commissioner. He is an old boy of Akkaraipattu Central College and Jaffna Hindu College (Pic by  M.A.P. Deen – Ampara Correspondent)

Content: Date: Addressing the Parliament staff, for the year 2023, Deputy Speaker Ajith Rajapakse said yesterday (2), “During a time when we have to face more challenges than ever, as employees of one of the highest institutions of the country, you should begin this new year with an undertaking to responsibly fulfil the expectations of the people.” The Deputy Speaker made this remark at the public service event of Parliament for the year 2023.  Rajapakse pointed out that after overcoming the challenge of Covid-19, the nation had to face the economic crisis and accordingly, the public servants have a huge responsibility in order to overcome the existing difficulties. He also pointed out that Government employees have a great responsibility towards the people in a more challenging environment given the situation where a large number of public servants are retiring at once. The Deputy Speaker hoisted the National Flag, at the main steps in front of the Parliament Building. A two-minute silence was observed afterwards to commemorate all those who sacrificed their lives for the country, including war heroes. Thereafter, the Parliament Staff proceeded to take the Oath of public service for the year. Addressing the staff, Kushani Rohanadeera, Chief of Staff and Deputy Secretary General of Parliament, stated that to save the country from the existing difficulties, “we must work with maximum efficiency even in a challenging environment.” She emphasised that many new committees are to be established in Parliament and accordingly, “in a background where recruitments and financial allocations are limited, we should work as one family with more commitment.” She also expressed her gratitude for the contribution of the Parliament staff towards the smooth running of Parliamentary Affairs during the Covid-19 challenge. Tikiri K. Jayathilake, Assistant Secretary General of Parliament, department heads, Parliament staff and affiliated staff were present at the event. Popular

title: Construction of houses to resume this year – Prasanna
author: Author not found
Content: Urban Development and Housing Minister Prasanna Ranatunga said, the construction of 1,996 housing units, under five housing projects, for artists and low-income earners will begin early this year. These houses are being built on the loan assistance programme of the Chinese Government. The Chinese government will grant Yuan 552 million of loan assistance and the agreement to that effect was signed on 9 January 2022. The Ministry stated that under this project, 1,888 housing units for low-income earners and 108 housing units for artists will be constructed. He also instructed the Urban Development Authority to continue the construction of the housing projects started last year. These houses will be built in Peliyagoda, Maharagama, Moratuwa and Dematagoda, and the housing project for artistes is to be constructed in Kottawa. As the country is facing an economic crisis, the minister has also advised officials to focus on finding the necessary funds to implement the housing projects without burdening the treasury. The representatives of the Chinese Government and the Urban Development Authority have jointly conducted the population studies for this purpose. House construction plans have been made by the Urban Development Authority. A rough copy of the agreement, related to the implementation of this project, has been given to the Urban Development Authority. Accordingly, the proposals of the Urban Development Authority and the Ministry of Finance were forwarded to the company appointed for this programme, by the Chinese Government last November. (AK)

title: Colombo Port dredgers resume operations
author: Author not found
Content: With the intervention of Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation, Nimal Siripala de Silva, the two dredgers at the Port of Colombo, ‘Diyakowulla’ and ‘Hansakawa’ have resumed operations. It was reported to the Minister that the two dredgers, which belonged to the Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA) and were deployed for dredging operations at the Port of Colombo, had ceased dredging and sludge removal operations at the port due to shortage of trained operators. The Minister personally visited the two dredgers anchored at the Bandaranaike Quay and also made a special tour on board ‘Hansakawa’ to inspect ongoing development work in the port. The officials and the employees pointed out that ceasing of dredging and sludge removal operations inside the port of Colombo, at a time that a massive development of the port was being carried out, also hindered the calling of lager vessels at the port. After discussions on the matter, the Minister instructed to cover work through temporary training of eight existing port employees as an immediate measure to resume operations of the two vessels. The Secretary to the Ministry of Port, Shipping and Aviation, K.D.S. Ruwanchandra and several high officials of SLPA were present.

title: Fertiliser producers playing foul – State Minister
author: Author not found
Content: State Minister of Agriculture Mohan Priyadarshana de Silva said he had received information that some organic fertiliser producers submit fertiliser samples to the National Fertiliser Secretariat that are of standard quality, but then sell substandard and inferior fertiliser to the farmers. He said efforts have been made to blacklist fertiliser companies that fraudulently sell inferior fertilisers and to discontinue purchasing fertiliser from them. He made these remarks while responding to questions from journalists following an inspection visit to the Walahanduwa Agricultural Service Centre. “The National Fertiliser Secretariat inspects fertiliser quality. The District Secretary and agricultural organisations now have full authority to purchase organic fertilisers for the district. It is their responsibility to purchase high-quality fertiliser. A company in the Galle district was distributing organic fertilisers when it was discovered that it was of poor quality. The purchase of fertiliser from that company has been halted and it has been blacklisted,” he explained. In addition, he said fertiliser will not be purchased from that company, and that information has been received that officials are being persuaded to sell substandard fertilisers. He said some fertiliser was brought down and given under Indian loan assistance and World Bank assistance and that in the future, fertiliser prices should be controlled. “The price of fertiliser has not been raised to the point where the farmer can no longer afford it. You can see how many farmers protest for fertiliser if there is no fertiliser. At the moment, there is enough fertiliser to meet the country’s needs,” he said. By Kamal Wijehewa – Galle

title: Printing of calendars, diaries hits new low
author: Author not found
Content: Calendar and diary printers claim that only a small number of calendars and diaries had been printed for 2023. They claimed that in previous years, diaries and calendars were designed and printed in various styles and sizes and that large orders were received by them. However, due to a shortage of paper in the country and an increase in the price of inks used for printing, the cost of printing calendars and a day books had increased fivefold, when compared to last year. As a result, printers claim that the business community did not place orders for calendars and day books for 2023. Furthermore, because of the increase in electricity bills, printing calendars and diaries digitally was expensive and as a result, only a small number of businessmen, who placed orders for printing calendars and diaries for the year 2023, had ordered a small number of calendars and diaries. According to the printers, while in previous years, various major companies and businessmen in the island printed the annual calendar in 12 pages and distributed it to customers, this year some businesses have limited the annual calendar to six pages. The public and private banks provide free calendars to their customers every year, and some of those banks have prepared a calendar for the year 2023 and forwarded the calendar to customers through social media networks. BY Neeta PathmaKumari – Norwood

title: Jaffna Mayor quits after budget defeat
author: Author not found
Content: Jaffna Mayor Viswalingam Manivannan resigned on 31 December 2022, following the defeat of Jaffna Municipal Council (JMC) budget. The budget for 2023 was defeated by a majority of seven votes on 21 December 2022. Manivannan had informed the Jaffna Municipal Commissioner and the Commissioner of the Northern Province Local Government Department in writing about his resignation. He resigned nine days after the budget was defeated. Even though there were prospects to present the budget for the second time, as he didn’t receive the support in the house, including the ruling party members, Manivannan took the decision to resign as Mayor, sources close to him said. Meanwhile, Commissioner of the Northern Province Local Government Department S. Pranavanathan said, however, election of new Mayor will not take place immediately. The election of a new Mayor is not possible according to the Municipal Council ordinance of this country and decision cannot be taken to dissolve the municipal council. The Attorney General needs to consulted in this connection. Such a situation prevails even in the Eastern Province too. The Eastern Province Commissioner of Local Government Department of has sought the advice of Attorney General with regard to such a matter and a response is still pending, he added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Plans to lower interest rates, inflation afoot
author: Author not found
Content: Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), Dr. P. Nandalal Weerasinghe stated that in order to improve the country’s economy, programmes aimed at lowering interest rates and lowering inflation are being implemented in the first quarter of this year. He said inflation has already begun to decelerate, and that it will continue to slow by the first quarter of this year. The Governor of the Central Bank, who arrived in Kandy yesterday (1), was blessed at the Sri Dalada Maligawa. He then visited Thibbatuwawe Sri Siddhartha Sumangala Mahanayaka Thera of the Malwathu Chapter and later the Chief Prelate of the of Asgiriya Chapter Most Ven. Warakagoda Gnanarathana Maha NayakeThera. After his visit, the Governor told the media that he will be in charge of stabilising the Sri Lankan economy again this year. He said he hopes to overcome the country’s economic difficulties from the previous year and restore the country’s economy to a more stable level. He noted that progress is being made towards the goal of controlling inflation, which is the responsibility of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka. Dr. Weerasinghe went on to say that the interest rate would fall and that the people of the country would be able to live a normal life, free of hardships. BY K. L. Suraweera – Kandy

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Wijeyadasa urges parents to raise children better
author: Author not found
Content: Justice Minister Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe urged parents to focus on their children’swell-being and raise them in a better manner rather than blaming the Government for not doing enough to combat narcotics. He claimed that society is corrupt because people have education and intelligence but lack religious education. In addition, he stated that there are 262,000 people in prison, over drugs, heroin, and ice, accounting for 75 per cent of those imprisoned. “Otherwise, there are less than 50 people in our prison. Today, society has collapsed. They are addicted to bad habits. The public society of Sri Lanka is being attacked in an organised manner. Today is the moment when many influences and actions are being implemented to destroy this society. Therefore, we have to organise ourselves to protect the society. Otherwise, we will not have a future generation. The centres for that are the temple and the religious school. If you want to raise a child who respects his parents, send your children to Sunday religious schools,” he added. Rajapaksa noted that a survey they conducted revealed that 85 per cent of the people in prisons have not received a religious education. He noted that they are working to strengthen the Sunday school system by identifying the challenges facing the country today. BY Janaka Hettiarachchi (Wadduwa) and Sumith Ranawaka (Pothupitiya)

title: Siyambalapitiya optimistic
author: Author not found
Content: State Minister of Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said, by 31 August 2022, Sri Lanka had to pay a debt of nearly Rs 360 billion, but it has now been reduced to less than Rs 190 billion and the remaining will be settled in the coming months. He said, priority has been given to carrying out essential tasks continuously while completing ongoing projects. Siyambalapitiya revealed this while speaking to the media about the country’s economic situation, as well as the steps the Government has taken to address the current economic crisis. He also considered this new year to be an auspicious one in which many can positively hope that the collapsed economy will be revived. Siyambalapitiya said that steps have been taken to provide relief and concessions to people to help them out of existing difficulties. Arrangements will be made to ascertain the protection of partially completed projects while recommending temporary solutions to the possible inconveniences expected to be caused to the people. Opportunities would dawn to raise the expenses to make new appointments thereafter. We are looking to go a auspicious journey demolishing every barrier we faced last year, the State Minister said. He said that the discussions with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to get its financial assistance to resolve the prevailing economic crisis of this country has started paying off.  After a brief disruption the agriculture sector of this country, especially paddy cultivation, is on correct path again. The arrival of tourists is on the rise when compared to the early last year. The value of Sri Lankan rupees has been strengthened to a significant level and has been kept stable without fluctuating, Siyambalapitiya noted. “The biggest challenge the country faced was the skyrocketing inflation. Now it has been brought down from 70 to 60 per cent. It was a great achievement the country has made in a short period of time. It highlights that politically and economically we are in a stable position when compared to the difficult stage we passed in the past,” Siyambalapitiya added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Land for landless – Devananda
author: Author not found
Content: Fisheries Minister Douglas Devananda said the Government’s goal is to provide a plot of land and make them landowners while also providing them livelihood access in the New Year. Devananda said Government has taken steps to provide  land to landless families in the country. Permanent land deeds were recently presented to 70 landless families in the Jayapuram North and South, as well as Vellavarayan Kattu village in the Kilinochchi District under this concept, he was speaking at a ceremony at the Kilinochchi District Secretariat. Devananda added that people’s problem were getting worse as political groups, representing the North and East failed to look into the needs of the public and cheated them to gain political mileage. “President Wickremesinghe has instructed to resolve issues and in accordance with his instructions and recommendations various welfare programmes targeting the people in the Northern and Eastern Provinces will be implemented soon in the New Year”, Fisheries Minister Devananda said. BY Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Fish production falls for ninth straight month
author: Author not found
Content: Marine fish production fell for the ninth consecutive month to October 2022, year on year (YoY), scarred by  a kerosene oil shortage, coupled with high fuel prices, Central Bank of Sri Lanka’s, CBSL’s 30 December data showed. Kerosene is needed to fuel fishing boats to sea. Consequently  marine fish production, YoY in October 2022 declined by 10.8 per cent (4.2 million kilos) to 35.2 million kgs and overall, in the first 10 months of the year, by 9.7 per cent (35.2 million kgs) to 325.8 million kgs. Latest CBSL data also showed that kerosene oil sales in the first 10 months of the year fell by 39.3 per cent (60,000 metric tons (mts)) YoY to 92,000 mts and crude oil imports in the review period declined by 58 per cent (633,000 mts)YoY to 458,000 mts. Meanwhile, Census and Statistics Department (CSD) data also released on 30 December showed that the retail price of a litre of kerosene in the Colombo market was up by 361.19 per cent (Rs 285.86) to Rs 365 and diesel, up 267.43 per cent (Rs 307.77) to Rs 422.86 a litre, YoY, last month. Consequently, CSD data also showed that the retail price of a kilo of dried sprats in the Colombo market YoY to last month (December 2022) increased by 77.69 per cent (Rs 645.85) to Rs 1,477.12, fresh ‘Thalapath’ fish by 38.03 per cent (Rs 708.33) to Rs 2,570.78 a kg, ‘Katta’ dry fish by 55.27 per cent (Rs 913.77) to Rs 2,567.09 a kg, Seer up by 40.07 per cent (Rs 889.98) to Rs 3,111.10 a kg and  Paraw, up by 38.49 per cent (Rs 708.32) to Rs 2,166.86 a kg. Fish is the most commonly sourced animal protein for Sri Lankan. Previously, the fish industry, scarred by the ‘X-Press Pearl’ environmental disaster that took place off the coast of Negombo in May 2021 was crippled, before making a recovery in October 2021, with marine fish production, YoY, growing at a steady pace for four continuous months till the fuel shortage hit the industry, since and in February 2022 to date, making the industry to contract, thereby making fish prices dear in the market. BY Paneetha Ameresekere

title: Minuwangoda Mega CFC Fishery outlet opened
author: Author not found
Content: Fisheries State Minister, Piyal Nishantha de Silva said  the aim of the Ceylon Fisheries Corporation (CFC) was not just profit- making but to provide hygiene fresh seafood to consumers at affordable prices. He was speaking following the opening of the Minuwangoda branch of CFC constructed under its ‘Mega Store’ business expansion network programme initiated to provide a satisfactory service to consumers across the country. Silva said steps will be taken to modernise existing fish stalls while creating a modern store chain system in the sale of seafood and added “The CFC must be transformed as a profit-making entity soon”. The CFC Minuwangoda branch was constructed under the Mega Store programme and is built opposite Minuwangoda Nalanda Vidyalaya along the Kurunegala Minuwangoda Road. Consumers can buy dry fish, Maldive Fish and dine at the Ceyfish restaurant”, he said. Fisheries Ministry Secretary Indu Ratnayake, Minuwangoda Pradeshiya Sabha Chairman Kumara Arangalla, Ceylon Fisheries Corporation Chairman Chathuranga Udawatte and Managing Director Thushara loku Kumara were also present. BY Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Colombo Inflation Decelerates
author: Author not found
Content: Colombo inflation decelerated for the third consecutive month, to December 2022 end, after 30 months to 57.2 per cent year on year (YoY). Last month’s (December 2022) deceleration was aided by food inflation decelerating to 64.4 per cent for the third consecutive month and non-food inflation also decelerating for the third consecutive month, to 53.4 per cent. Colombo inflation, YoY, as at last year end, increased by 57.2 per cent, Census and Statistics Department (CSD) data released on Friday (29 December 2022) showed. Consequently Colombo inflation has been in double digits for 13 consecutive months to last month end (December 2022). Prior to  last month, the last time Colombo inflation was  in double digits, for at least 12 consecutive months, was 14 years and two months ago, where Colombo inflation was in double digits for 32 consecutive months, from June 2006 to January 2009. The period June 2006 to January 2009 was the height of the final phase of the war. During that period, excessive money printing and the global financial crisis, led by high energy prices, drove up inflation. Prior to last month, the last time Colombo inflation decelerated for  at least three consecutive months, was 30 months ago, where from March to June 2022, spanning a total of four consecutive months, inflation decelerated, YoY.  Year 2020 was the era when Covid-19 became a global pandemic, restricting or completely stopping the movement of people, thereby crippling the global economy, hence causing flagging demand and thereby slowing down inflationary pressure. However, the current record high inflationary levels are due to multiple causes led by excessive money printing and record high rupee depreciation, in the context that Sri Lanka is an import-dependent economy, made worse by Sri Lanka stopping the repayment of its external debt in April 2022 due to a US dollar shortage, thereby closing the access to international markets for the country. Among some of the commodity price hikes responsible for the YoY rise in food inflation  last month, ie up  by  a minimum of 100 per cent and over only, was the retail price of dried chillies increasing by 176.97 per cent (Rs 1,153.22) to Rs 1,804.85 a kilo;   retail price of an egg up by 105.46 per cent (Rs 26.91) to Rs 52.43; red onions up by 109.98 per cent (Rs 364.97) to Rs 6,906.80 a kg; cowpea up 140.02 per cent (Rs 738.86) to Rs 1,240.26 a kg; the retail price of  a kg of papaw up 137.29 per cent (Rs 221.36) to Rs 382.61a kg; mangoes up 135.26 per cent (Rs 98.50) to Rs 171.32 a kg  and the retail price of a kg of green gram up 143.81 per cent (Rs 721.37) to Rs 1,222.97. Among the commodities that spurred non-food inflation YoY last month was the retail price of a litre of kerosene up 361.19 per cent (Rs 285.86) to Rs 365; diesel, up 267.43 per cent (Rs 307.77) to Rs 422.86 a litre; petrol, up 126.67 per cent (Rs 206.67) to Rs 370 a litre and LP gas, up 74.10 per cent (Rs 2,012.68) to 4,728.93 per 12.5 kg domestic cylinder of gas. BY Paneetha Ameresekere

title: Two arrested over robbery of gems worth Rs 20M
author: Author not found
Content: Two suspects were arrested over the robbery of a parcel containing 116 gemstones worth nearly Rs 20 million in Kalutara. The parcel was stolen from the travelling bag of a gem businessman residing in Wellawatta, while he was travelling in a bus from Colombo to Beruwala. According to the Police, the businessman had come to know that the parcel was missing after he got down from the bus and checked his bag. Therefore, he got into a three-wheeler and followed the bus. However, failing to catch the bus, he lodged a complaint with the Beruwala Police. The Kalutara Crime Investigations Division had conducted investigations and arrested two suspects in connection with the theft. According to the Police the suspect, who stole the parcel, had left it inside the bus and had alighted from the bus at Beruwala after noticing that the businessman was following the bus. Thereafter, the conductor of the bus had picked up the parcel, taken it home where he hid it. Police found the parcel of gemstones, following interrogations of the bus conductor. The arrestees, aged 48 and 36, have been identified as residents of Urubokka and Payagala. They are scheduled to be produced before the Kalutara Magistrate’s Court today (30). BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: New SLFP-led alliance to be launched in Jan – Dayasiri
author: Author not found
Content: A new political alliance, spearheaded by the Sri Lanka Freedom Party (SLFP), will be launched in the first week of January, SLFP General Secretary Dayasiri Jayasekara said. He said SLFP will contest the Local Government Elections through a progressive alliance that is to be formed soon. Jayasekara made this statements at the annual pirith ceremony, held by the SLFP at the Kelaniya Raja Maha Viharaya. He added a few groups that left the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) are currently discussing about an alliance with the SLFP. He further noted that although SLPP has been unfair with certain political parties, the SLFP will be fair on all parties. BY Bingun Menaka Gamage

title: ADB’s Rs 8B into farmers’ accounts in a fortnight
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Agriculture Mahinda Amaraweera yesterday (29) stated the Rs 8,000 million, given by the Asian Development Bank (ADB), will be credited to farmers’ accounts within the next two weeks. The ADB offered this amount to farmers on a request made by President Ranil Wickremesinghe. He stated the extent of paddy land earmarked for paddy cultivation is 800,000 hectares while the extent of land that has already been cultivated and is still being cultivated has exceeded 760,000 hectares. Accordingly, arrangements have been made to credit Rs.10,000 per farmer who cultivates one hectare of paddy and Rs 20,000 each for those who cultivate two hectares, he said.  The Department of Agrarian Development has made arrangements to notify, through SMS, that the money has been credited to the farmers’ accounts. (FT)

title: CEB PAID RS 11B IN SALARIES, ALLOWANCES
author: Author not found
Content: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) had to pay its staff nearly Rs 11 billion in salaries and allowances for the months of September, October and November 2022. Accordingly, CEB had paid sums of Rs 3,535.62 million, Rs 3,589.21 million and Rs 3,662.28 million for the months of September, October and November, respectively. Minister of Power and Energy Kanchana Wijesekara yesterday (29), publicised the CEB staff’s total salaries and allowances for months of September, October and November. He tweeted that the salaries and the allowances ranges from Rs 3.5 billion to Rs 3.7 Billion monthly. While announcing that no new recruitments will be made, he said more than 1,100 employees are set to retire in 2023. Meanwhile, the Minister also said with the current electricity tariff structure, CEB’s total revenue for October was Rs 33.6 billion and November Rs 35.6 billion. CEB’s requirement of Heavy Fuel Oil, Naptha and Diesel to operate power stations for the month of January is Rs 35 billion and requirement for coal payments for January is Rs 38.45 billion. In a meeting with CEB Trade Unions, Wijesekara discussed the proposed electricity tariff adjustments, restructuring of CEB, management of CEB expenses and other service issues. The meeting was held with the representatives of CEB Senior Engineers Union, Electrical Superintendents Union, technical services and other union members. (TR)

title: Docs in petition campaign against ‘unjust taxation’
author: Author not found
Content: Doctors in hospitals countrywide are in the process of signing a petition against the “unjust taxation” to be introduced through the Inland Revenue Act, which is to be enacted by 1 January 2023. Media Committee Member of the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA), Dr. Chamil Wijesinghe yesterday (29) said that they aimed to obtain the signatures of 20,000 doctors for the petition which would be submitted to President Ranil Wickremesinghe by the second week of January. “It is not that we don’t want to be taxed, but it is the unfairness of the Inland Revenue Act that has all professional categories concerned. Medical practitioners would have to pay two months’ salary as taxes if measures were not taken to introduce the amendments that the GMOA proposed. The GMOA would also stage the ‘Black protest week’ against the same from 23 to 27 January 2023 demanding a fair tax policy and a solution to the drug shortage in the country. He said that his outfit was prepared to stage protests and hoist black flags in all State hospitals demanding that the government make the necessary amendments to the Inland Revenue Act. Dr. Wijesinghe said, they hoped to form a Common Front, including Bankers, Engineers, Architects, Sri Lankan Administrative Service Officers and Educationists to battle the Government’s Inland Revenue Act. By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: India’s NIA arrests IS terrorist
author: Author not found
Content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Wednesday arrested a member of the terrorist organisation, Islamic State (IS), who was in touch with the mastermind of 2019 Easter Sunday bombings in Sri Lanka, for his alleged links with suspects in the 23 October blast in Tamil Nadu’s Coimbatore. The federal agency also arrested another man, identified as Sanofar Ali, for allegedly taking part in plans to carry out terror attacks in the country. NIA officers, familiar with the developments, said IS member Sheikh Hidayatullah was allegedly in touch with Maulvi Zahran bin Hashim, the mastermind of the deadly Easter Sunday bombings in Sri Lanka on 21 April 2019, that claimed over 250 lives. Both Hidayatullah and Sanofar Ali were arrested from Tamil Nadu, an NIA officer said. “Investigations have revealed that the accused persons had entered into a criminal conspiracy in the interior of forested regions of Asanoor and Kadambur areas of the Sathyamangalam forest, Erode District, in February 2022,” NIA said in a statement. “The meetings were led by previously arrested accused Umar Farooq and participated in by deceased accused Jameesha Mubeen (died in Coimbatore blast), along with Mohammed Azharuddin, Sheikh Hidayatullah and Sanofar Ali, where they conspired to prepare for and execute terror acts.” Jameesha Mubeen, who was questioned by NIA in 2019, for alleged terror links, was charred to death in suspicious circumstances after the LPG cylinder inside a Maruti 800, he was driving, exploded near Kottai Eswaran temple, in Coimbatore’s Ukkadam, on the morning of October 23. The incident took place around 200 metres from a Police patrol. The deceased was registered as the prime accused in the blast case. The State Police had invoked the stringent Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) in the case, which was later handed over to NIA. According to NIA officers cited above, Hidayatullah, who has been propagating IS ideology since 2017, was earlier arrested along with Azharuddin in June 2019. He was released on bail in 2020. Azharuddin, from Ukkadam and leader of Kerala-Tamil Nadu IS module, is currently in jail for the Sri Lanka bombings. All the above accused were inspired by Hashim, who masterminded and executed the Sri Lanka bombings — in which 252 people were killed — and planned to carry out similar attacks in two South Indian States at that time. Prior to the Sri Lanka bombings, Hidayatullah and Hashim were in touch through a Facebook page ‘KhilafahGFX’, according to NIA’s charge sheet filed against Hidayatullah in 2019.  (Hindustan Times)

title: OVER 30,000 STATE EMPLOYEES RETIRE TOMORROW
author: Author not found
Content: Over 30,000 State employees, who have reached the age of 60 years, will retire tomorrow (31). This is the highest number of State employees retiring at a given time. The Ministry of Public Administration recently issued Circular 19/2022 of 14 September 2022 reducing retirement age of State employees to 60 years, following the proposals in the Interim Budget 2022. President Ranil Wickremesinghe, in his interim Budget speech, said the retirement age of Government and Semi-Government employees will be reduced to 60 years. BY Amith Maduranga Gamage

title: US national arrested at BIA with live ammo
author: Author not found
Content: A US national, who had arrived at the Katunayake Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), to fly back to his home country, was arrested for having live ammunition and a magazine in his possession. Ten rounds of 9mm ammunition and a magazine were taken into custody by the Airport Police on 28 December. The foreigner had reportedly arrived in Sri Lanka on 7 December for a tour and was identified as Pritchett Jermaine Adrian, a 38-year-old US taxi driver. The live ammunition was detected as he walked through the screening machine at the departure terminal of the airport. After informing the airport Police about this, the officers arrested the suspect. The US national had come to Sri Lanka with his Japanese girlfriend to attend the wedding of her friend in Malabe, Colombo. He is a licensee with legal permission to use firearms in his country. He uses a Glock (Glock 43 X) type pistol made in Austria, and the extra ammunition and ammunition used for it has been put in his travel bag by mistake when he came to Sri Lanka. Police also checked the firearm licence given by the country as well as the wedding ceremony online. Negombo SP Eric Perera, who is leading the investigation, said that such a firearm would not be used in Sri Lanka. At the time of this arrest, he was accompanied by his Japanese girlfriend, who was released to leave for US at that time. He is scheduled to be produced in the Negombo Magistrate’s Court. Further investigations are being carried out by a group of Police officers including Chief Inspector Senadheera of Katunayake Airport Police under the instructions of Negombo Senior Superintendent of Police Saman Sigera and Negombo District Superintendent of Police Eric Perera. BY T.K.G. Kapila – Katunayake

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Police rescue kidnapped pregnant minor
author: Author not found
Content: Dambulla Police said that a pregnant minor, who was being kidnapped in a three-wheeler in the night of 28 December, had been rescued by them. Police stated that the underage girl had been receiving in-house treatment at the Anuradhapura General Hospital, under the supervision of Probation and Child Care Services. She had been kidnapped from the hospital. Police added that two Police officers on traffic duty at the Dambulla-Kekirawa main road, had become suspicious of a youth and a minor travelling in a three-wheeler and had inspected the vehicle. They had taken the youth and the minor to the Police Station for interrogation and they had then spilled the beans afterwards. The 15-year-old while schooling at Kahatagasdigiliya had been raped by a youth and following an order issued by the Court had been handed over to the Probation and Child Care Services Authority. Later, she had been receiving treatment at the Anuradhapura Hospital. Police added that while being treated at the hospital, the suspect youth, had subtly abducted her in a three-wheeler. BY K. K. Ariyadasa – Dambulla

title: Four arrested over abuse of minor
author: Author not found
Content: The Chief Incumbent of a temple, his brother and two women were arrested over a case where a 15-year-old girl had been subjected to grave sexual abuse by the monk and his brother. The two women, who are grandmother and aunt of the victim, were arrested for allegedly aiding and abetting monk and the other person to commit the crime. The arrests had been made on 28 December. Police said the probe conducted into the incident had revealed that the grandmother and the aunt of the victim had escorted her to the temple where she had been sexually molested by its Chief Incumbent. At a later occasion, the victim was again subjected to grave sexual abuse by the monk’s brother in grandmother’s house. The Police claimed, the two women allegedly supported the men to carryout to the abuse. After realising her plight the mother of the victim lodged a complaint with the Police and following inquiries the two men were arrested along with the victim’s grandmother and her aunt for aiding and abetting them. The suspects were due to be produced before Court while the victim was admitted to hospital for medical tests. (To report child abuses dial 1929; the hotline of the National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) or visit the nearest Police station) BY Nadun Gunathileke- Bibila

title: Man electrocuted
author: Author not found
Content: An individual was electrocuted when coming into contact with an unauthorised electric cable, at a paddy field in Rilakumbura, Eheliyagoda on 28 December, Police said. The deceased was identified as a 59-year-old resident of the Pahalagama, Police said. They said that the electric cable had been installed to protect the paddy and vegetable cultivations from animals. The body of the victim was placed at the Eheliyagoda Hospital for a post-mortem examination, while Eheliyagoda Police are conducting investigations into the incident. BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: EC finalising H’tota LG polls arrangements
author: Author not found
Content: The Election Commission of Sri Lanka (EC) is currently working on finalising arrangements for the upcoming Local Government elections in the Hambantota District. The voter lists, the appointment of Assistant Returning Officers and the inspection of offices, vehicles, and polling booths are among the arrangements that are being finalised. The Hambantota District has 12 LG bodies and 443 polling booths will be set up to serve a voter base of 506,368. BY Prasad Samarasinghe – Sooriyaweva

title: Minorities still ignored for top posts – Imran
author: Author not found
Content: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Trincomalee District MP M. Imran claimed yesterday (29) the minorities of the country are being marginalised, even under the administration of President Ranil Wickremesinghe, just like during the previous regimes. There is a vacancy for Deputy Planning Director at Trincomalee District Secretariat now. There are five officials for this post at the District Secretariat and three of them had applied for the post, according to Imran. However, the minorities had been neglected while appointing the suitable person for the post, he alleged. “The practice of marginalising minority officials, when appointing top posts, in the Trincomalee District Secretariat, started during the Rajapaksa regime.  Even though qualified officials from minorities had applied to fill a vacancy they were neglected. This situation continues still, even under the governance of President Wickremesinghe,” he said. Imran said that as a people’s representative he is only asking to give room to qualified officialsfrom minorities as well. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Korean Embassy, ‘Black Swan’ donate books
author: Author not found
Content: The Korean Embassy in Sri Lanka and ‘Black Swan’,’ a k-pop fan base in Sri Lanka, recently organised a book distribution programme for the primary section of Bloemendhal Sinhala Vidyalaya in Colombo 15. This donation programme, co-sponsored by the Korean Embassy, was held in celebration of the birthdays of BTS members Kim Seok-Jin and Kim Taehyung. Recently, K-pop has become a global phenomenon that has received a lot of affection and admiration from many countries like Sri Lanka. To celebrate K-pop idols on their birthdays’ fan groups worldwide undertake many charitable events to spread happiness and contribute to society in meaningful ways. This year in Sri Lanka, the loyal K-pop fans known as Black Swan, in collaboration with the Korean Embassy handed over many school items and stationery items to 122 students of the primary section. Second Secretary of the Korean Embassy, Lim Soyeon was present at the event to appreciate the efforts of Sri Lankan K-pop fan members to uplift the community. They also carried out the ‘END Violence’ campaign, the global SNS campaign to help protect children from all forms of violence.

title: Russian ‘Red Wing’ Airline with 412 passengers calls at Mattala
author: Author not found
Content: A Boeing 777 belonging to the 23-year-old ‘Red Wing’ Airline, of Russia, which took off from Moscow with 412 passengers on board, called at the Mattala International Airport at 9 a.m, yesterday.  With this commencement, the airline starts charter flight operations to Sri Lanka’s Mattala International Airport, twice a week. The maiden call of the airline was welcomed with water salutes by two fire fighter trucks at the runway at the airport.  The Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation, Nimal Sirpala de Silva arrived at the Mattala International Airport to welcome the maiden call of the flight, its passengers and crew. The Chairman of the Airport & Aviation Services Sri Lanka Ltd. General G. A. Chandrasiri and several higher ranking officials also attended the event. Expressing his views, the Minister said that air travel agents are requested to take advantage of the positioning of Mattala International Airport as an optimum travel destination to develop a sustainable programme  to attract more foreign travellers and tourists to the country.
