title: Ten LG areas in Galle District issued landslide warnings
author: Author not found
Content: Due to the prevailing inclement weather, ten Local Government (LG) areas in Galle District have been issued landslide warnings. National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) Galle District Officer, Geologist E.R. Bandula said the areas prone to earthslips and landslides are Galle Municipal Council limits, Akmeemana, Baddegama, Elpitiya, Imaduwa, Nagoda, Neluwa, Niyagama, Yakkalamulla, and Thawalama. He added that if any construction is to be carried out in any of the aforementioned areas the requisite recommendation and the certified approval from the NBRO has to be sought as per a circular issued to all LG Secretaries, LG Heads, District Secretaries, and Divisional Secretaries by the Secretary to the Ministry of Disaster Management. By Farhan Nizamdeen – Galle and S. Diyagahage – Ahangama

title: Navy Commander calls on Air Force Chief
author: Author not found
Content: The newly appointed Commander of the Navy, Vice Admiral Priyantha Perera, called on the Commander of Air Force, Air Marshal Sudarshana Pathirana on 28 December 2022. The Navy Commander was received by the Commanding Officer of SLAF Station Colombo, Air Commodore Suresh Fernando and a Guard of Honour was accorded by the No. 43 Colour Wing of the SLAF. Air Marshal Pathirana congratulated Vice Admiral Perera on his appointment as the 25th Navy Commander in Sri Lanka Navy. During the cordial discussion, the significance of undertaking Joint Maritime and Coastal Surveillance Operations, Air and Naval joint exercises to strengthen the maritime security of the island was highlighted. Subsequently, official mementos were exchanged by the two Commanders at the Commander’s Office after which the Navy Commander met the Chief of Staff and the SLAF Board of Management.

title: Dengue rears its ugly head in Akkaraipattu
author: Author not found
Content: Akkaraipattu Medical Officer of Health (MOH) Division, which was declared a Red Zone in the spreading of dengue in the Kalmunai Regional Divisional Health Services Division last month, after a brief improvement, has now been issued warnings once more, as dengue cases are on the rise. Akkaraipattu MOH, Dr. F.M.A. Cader said 150 dengue cases have been detected in the area since 1 December, and the dengue eradication programme has been stepped up. He said cases had been filed against 13 people, and that his PHIs, with the assistance of PHIs from neighbouring divisions, are working round the clock inspecting, advising, warning, and serving red notices to noncomplying persons. Mosquitoes are ravaging the area, according to Dr. Cader. Fumigation is presently underway and he urged the public to be patient. The Akkaraipattu MOH appealed to the public to extend their fullest cooperation in controlling dengue by keeping their surroundings clean and tidy. By M.A.P. Deen – Ampara

title: Eastern Provincial Council, ITI ink MoU
author: Author not found
Content: The Eastern Provincial Council signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Industrial Technology Institute (ITI) to construct an agricultural technology research laboratory which is ISO compliant. The ceremony was held at the Governor’s Office in Trincomalee on 27 December and was chaired by Governor Anuradha Yahampath. The research laboratory is to be built under the sustainable agriculture programme being implemented by Governor Yahampath. Eastern Province Chief Secretary R.M.P.S. Ratnayake and Director General of Industrial Technology Institute J.K. Radhika Samarasekara signed the MoU. It will be able to issue international standard certificates in Sri Lanka, conducting laboratory tests on natural fertilisers, seeds, soil samples, agricultural crops, and intermediates, according to Governor Yahampath. “There are two agricultural research laboratories in Mahailuppalama in the Anuradhapura District and Gannoruwa in the Kandy District. But there is not a single ISO-compliant agricultural research laboratory in Sri Lanka. It is the first time that such a laboratory is being built in partnership with the Industrial Technology Institute,” Yahampath said. The Governor expressed confidence that Sri Lankan agricultural products that are ISO-compliant can reach the international market easily and will get the highest value among the potential customers. “With the construction of the proposed agricultural laboratory, farmers in the North Central and Northern provinces can test their samples. At a time when the country is facing a severe shortage of foreign reserves, farmers can contribute to bring more dollars to the country by exporting their ISO compliant agricultural products. Rather than increasing the loan burden of Sri Lanka, it would be ideal to focus attention on new methodologies. We don’t have enough agricultural technology. For our products to reach the international market, standard certification is compulsory. This laboratory will ensure that local products reach the international market,” Yahampath stated. Secretary of Provincial Director of Agriculture, Eastern Province, I.K.G. Muthubanda, Secretary of Governor L.P. Madanayake, Trincomalee District Secretary P.H.N. Jayawickreme and representatives of Trincomalee District Agriculture societies were present at the event. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Man electrocuted
author: Author not found
Content: An individual was electrocuted when coming into contact with an unauthorised electric cable, at a paddy field in Rilakumbura, Eheliyagoda on 28 December, Police said. The deceased was identified as a 59-year-old resident of the Pahalagama, Police said. They said that the electric cable had been installed to protect the paddy and vegetable cultivations from animals. The body of the victim was placed at the Eheliyagoda Hospital for a post-mortem examination, while Eheliyagoda Police are conducting investigations into the incident. BY Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: EC finalising H’tota LG polls arrangements
author: Author not found
Content: The Election Commission of Sri Lanka (EC) is currently working on finalising arrangements for the upcoming Local Government elections in the Hambantota District. The voter lists, the appointment of Assistant Returning Officers and the inspection of offices, vehicles, and polling booths are among the arrangements that are being finalised. The Hambantota District has 12 LG bodies and 443 polling booths will be set up to serve a voter base of 506,368. BY Prasad Samarasinghe – Sooriyaweva

title: Minorities still ignored for top posts – Imran
author: Author not found
Content: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Trincomalee District MP M. Imran claimed yesterday (29) the minorities of the country are being marginalised, even under the administration of President Ranil Wickremesinghe, just like during the previous regimes. There is a vacancy for Deputy Planning Director at Trincomalee District Secretariat now. There are five officials for this post at the District Secretariat and three of them had applied for the post, according to Imran. However, the minorities had been neglected while appointing the suitable person for the post, he alleged. “The practice of marginalising minority officials, when appointing top posts, in the Trincomalee District Secretariat, started during the Rajapaksa regime.  Even though qualified officials from minorities had applied to fill a vacancy they were neglected. This situation continues still, even under the governance of President Wickremesinghe,” he said. Imran said that as a people’s representative he is only asking to give room to qualified officialsfrom minorities as well. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Korean Embassy, ‘Black Swan’ donate books
author: Author not found
Content: The Korean Embassy in Sri Lanka and ‘Black Swan’,’ a k-pop fan base in Sri Lanka, recently organised a book distribution programme for the primary section of Bloemendhal Sinhala Vidyalaya in Colombo 15. This donation programme, co-sponsored by the Korean Embassy, was held in celebration of the birthdays of BTS members Kim Seok-Jin and Kim Taehyung. Recently, K-pop has become a global phenomenon that has received a lot of affection and admiration from many countries like Sri Lanka. To celebrate K-pop idols on their birthdays’ fan groups worldwide undertake many charitable events to spread happiness and contribute to society in meaningful ways. This year in Sri Lanka, the loyal K-pop fans known as Black Swan, in collaboration with the Korean Embassy handed over many school items and stationery items to 122 students of the primary section. Second Secretary of the Korean Embassy, Lim Soyeon was present at the event to appreciate the efforts of Sri Lankan K-pop fan members to uplift the community. They also carried out the ‘END Violence’ campaign, the global SNS campaign to help protect children from all forms of violence.

title: Russian ‘Red Wing’ Airline with 412 passengers calls at Mattala
author: Author not found
Content: A Boeing 777 belonging to the 23-year-old ‘Red Wing’ Airline, of Russia, which took off from Moscow with 412 passengers on board, called at the Mattala International Airport at 9 a.m, yesterday.  With this commencement, the airline starts charter flight operations to Sri Lanka’s Mattala International Airport, twice a week. The maiden call of the airline was welcomed with water salutes by two fire fighter trucks at the runway at the airport.  The Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation, Nimal Sirpala de Silva arrived at the Mattala International Airport to welcome the maiden call of the flight, its passengers and crew. The Chairman of the Airport & Aviation Services Sri Lanka Ltd. General G. A. Chandrasiri and several higher ranking officials also attended the event. Expressing his views, the Minister said that air travel agents are requested to take advantage of the positioning of Mattala International Airport as an optimum travel destination to develop a sustainable programme  to attract more foreign travellers and tourists to the country.

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: NAITA to enrol 3000 trainees
author: Author not found
Content: NAITA has decided to enroll 3,000 trainees for the NVQ-3 short term courses commencing January next year. Issuing a press release, NAITA states that the 3,000 trainees will be absorbed to its cadre encompassing the 25 Districts, while gearing the youths for employment opportunities both locally and overseas. NAITA says that 10 courses covering a wide spectrum of fields in the job market will be conducted. It added that at the end of the course, on the job training will also be offered to the trainees after which an evaluation test will be held and the NVQ-3 certificates presentated.

title: Five nabbed attempting to sell turtle flesh
author: Author not found
Content: Kayts Police arrested five people for attempting to sell 25 kg of turtle flesh in Karainagar, Jaffna. The suspects were planning to sell the meat at high prices to hotels. They were apprehended during a search operation conducted by a group of officers, following information received by the Kayts Police. The suspects had killed the turtles and packed 25 kg of its flesh into bags for sale. Kayts Police added that the arrested suspects are Karainagar residents who work in the fishing industry. BY Shashi Kumar – Mullaitivu

title: 704,931 passports issued in first nine months of 2022
author: Author not found
Content: The Department of Immigration and Emigration has revealed that within the first nine months of this year it has issued 704,931 passports. According to sources, in comparison to the past year, the issuance of passports had increased markedly during this year. They said, in 2021, 382,560 passports had been issued. Out of the passports issued last year, 398 were diplomatic passports. BY O. Kamalanatha – Baddegama

title: CEB online payment gateway hacked
author: Author not found
Content: The main suspect involved in the financial fraud of about Rs 100 million by hacking the online payment gateway used to pay electricity bills to the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), was remanded until 5 January 2023 by Colombo Additional Magistrate Rajindra Jayasuriya. The suspect was arrested by the Social Media Crime Division of the CID following a complaint made by former CEB General Manager stating that a person who hacked the CEB website has deceived hundreds of customers. The suspect had introduced himself as a businessman and software engineer and told customers that he could pay electricity bills for anyone using his credit card as he was entitled to a 10 – 20 per cent discount. According to the CID Social Media Crime Division, the suspect has deceived about 400 persons in the past three months. He had met many of the victims in casinos. Although, a receipt was generated following the payment, the CEB had not received any payment. The suspect, who is a 25-year-old, is a resident of Tissamaharama and temporarily lived in Kadawatha. He had received a formal education up to the G.C.E. Advanced Level, the CID said. BY Hansi Nanayakkara, Bimal Jayasinghe – Colombo and Keerthi Mendis

title: SLBFE empowered to investigate
author: Author not found
Content: The Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau (SLBFE) has been granted permission to inspect the computer system of the Department for Registration of Persons to investigate persons who travel abroad by providing false information. The SLBFE was not previously able to investigate fake identity cards and passports promptly and had to obtain information from the Department for Registration of Persons in writing. A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) was signed between the SLBFE and the Department for Registration of Persons for the former to access and inspect the computer system of the latter to investigate those who travel abroad by submitting bogus documents.  The agreement was signed by SLBFE Chairman Mahendra Kumarasinghe, Director Jeff Gunawardana, and Commissioner of the Department for Registration of Persons Viani Gunathilaka. According to the SLBFE, there have been several instances where persons travelled overseas by providing false information and they face several issues abroad. By Amith Maduranga Gamage

title: Bandula promises to modernise SL Railways
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Transport Bandula Gunawardena said the Sri Lanka Railways has yet to earn a sufficient income to cover employee salaries and overtime allowances. The department is only able to cover the cost of fuel though it has earned more than Rs 1 billion since August 2022. He claimed that it is a 150 per cent increase from the beginning of the year. “Therefore, in 2023, we hope to reduce cost and increase income by modernising the railway transport system, repairing the signalling system, and using new technology to provide an efficient service. The railway line from Anuradhapura to Omanthai, which has not been renovated for many decades, will be renovated by the Indian company IRCON under the Indian Credit Line on 5 January 2023,”he said. Speaking to the media yesterday (28), he said the project worth approximately Rs 33 billion will result in a major modernisation of the country’s railway transport sector. The money will be disbursed through  the Indian Credit Line “Despite the many difficulties that the country has faced this year, the Railways have been able to carry out a significant public mission thanks to the joint commitment of the Railway Department’s officers, staff, and trade unions,” he claimed. BY Thameenah Razeek

title: Print more money to give interest-free loans for solar panels – Gammanpila
author: Author not found
Content: It would be beneficial to empower the middle class to purchase solar panels, even if the Government has to print more money, Pivithuru Hela Urumaya (PHU) Leader Udaya Gammanpila said. He said the Government could print money and give interest-free loans to purchase and set solar panels as in the end it will be the economy that will benefit. He also said if money is printed and distributed to the middle class to purchase solar panels for offices, factories, public schools, and hospitals, it will be beneficial. “Instead of providing innovative solutions, we reject the Government’s attempt to enrich diesel power generation while shifting the burden on the people,” Gammanpila said. When asked if it Minister of Power and Energy’s statement regarding electricity tariffs was true and that it would put an end to the electricity crisis, Gammanpila answered in the negative. “The majority of electricity was used by factories, hotels, offices, and middle-class homes. If those who use excess electricity were given interest-free loans to purchase solar power systems with a battery to produce the electricity they require, they will stop getting electricity from the national grid. The crisis will then be solved,” he said. BY Thameenah Razeek

title: ‘Dubai Sudda’ enlarged on bail
author: Author not found
Content: The Special Investigation Division of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) yesterday (28) arrested Nissanka Priyadarshana alias ‘Dubai Sudda’ for attempting to recruit people for foreign jobs on social media without a licence in violation of the SLBFE Act. The suspect was later produced before the Kaduwela Magistrate and enlarged on bail. The SLBFE stated that if an organisation or person recruits employees for foreign jobs, they must have a valid licence issued by the Bureau and if they are to advertise about recruitment, they must obtain separate permission to do so. BY Amith Maduranga Gamage

title: SLFP invites Party deserters back into the fold
author: Author not found
Content: Senior Vice President of the SLFP Prof. Rohana Lakshman Piyadasa said all those who had deserted the Party in the recent past have the opportunity to rejoin. Addressing the media in Kandy yesterday (28), he said that that those who had violated the party constitution and acted in contrary to its disciplinary code could still amend their ways and rejoin the party if they were willing to toe the party line. Prof. Piyadasa said the onus was on the Government to hold Elections as and when they are due, rather than taking measures to suppress the voice of the electorate for fear of losing the polls. He also said the SLFP will contest future Elections via a broad political alliance consisting of patriotic and progressive political forces in Sri Lanka. BY K.L. Suraweera – Kandy

title: Take Sinopharm booster offered by MOHs
author: Author not found
Content: Director General of Health Services (DGHS), Dr. Asela Gunawardena urged the  public who had not taken the Pfizer booster doses to at least take the Sinopharm vaccine which was being offered at all Medical Officers of Health (MOH). On Tuesday (27), a woman and her six-year-old daughter, who returned from China via Sri Lanka tested positive for Covid-19 at the Madurai Airport in Tamil Nadu, Indian news reports said.  Fielding questions during a media briefing at the Health Ministry, Dr. Gunawardena expressed concern regarding the increase in the number of B7 cases of Covid-19 being detected in neighbour India. B7 is a Covid variant.  “But considering the economic situation, we cannot impose strict restrictions,” he said, adding that surveillance was the answer to the present situation. Restrictions were less in countries like Singapore, Malaysia, and Thailand too.  He said the Expert Committee had given approval for the Sinopharm vaccine to be given as the second booster dose after six million doses of the Pfizer vaccine expired at the end of October 2022.  Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella said he had done his best to offer those Pfizer vaccines to other countries when Sri Lankans failed to turn up for the Covid booster doses. By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: School classification to be simplified – Premajayantha
author: Author not found
Content: Education Minister Susil Premajayantha said in the future, school classification will be simplified into three categories: primary, junior secondary, and senior secondary. Speaking at a graduation ceremony, he highlighted that the number of existing education zones will be increased by 20 to 120, and that steps will be taken to expand in-service training and capacity development programmes for teachers. Premajayantha said, STEM Education, which has been successfully implemented in many developed countries, is expected to be popularised in Sri Lanka, and that Meepe Education Management Institute will offer postgraduate degrees for teachers in the future. The minister emphasised that education reforms alone aren’t enough to meet today’s economic and social challenges, and that the entire education system must undergo transformational change, with an active contribution expected from all stakeholders, including teachers, principals, and education administrative officers. He also said to develop skilled human resources, quality education opportunities should be provided to all children, and that all responsible parties, including policymakers, should be committed to this cause. By Thameenah Razeek

title: Ambewela Farm gets 30 acres of grazing land
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe has instructed the Nuwara Eliya District Secretary and Commissioner to immediately place 30 acres of abandoned land adjacent to the Ambewela Farm under the purview of the farm and provide necessary facilities to develop it as grazing land to meet the food requirement of the dairy cows. President Wickremesinghe issued these instructions during an observation tour of United Dairies Lanka (Pvt) Ltd, which belongs to the Ambewela Farm Group, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said. The President has commended the systematic growth achieved by the Ambewela Farm in the dairy production industry, adding that it has set an example for other dairy farms as well. The President also instructed to open this farm for research activities for university students to gain experience in dairy farming. General Manager of the Ambewela Farm Group, Sarath Bandara said the Ambewela Farm is the main centre in Sri Lanka as well as in South Asia which can boast of the highest technical application in dairy production and farming technology. The PMD also said, at present, there are about 1,000 dairy cows at the Ambewela Farm, adding that all activities such as maintaining the dairy cows, providing necessary fodder, weighing, diagnosing diseases and separating them from others are done through an automated system. The cows are milked thrice a day and 40,000 litres of liquid milk is supplied to the market daily. Around 4,500 cows are presently being fed within the entire Ambewela Farm network. While this institution was under the Government before the establishment of the Ambewela Group in 2001, the daily milk production stood at a mere 1,500 litres. The Ambewela Farm system has been working for the last 15 years to create the best dairy cows for Sri Lanka. None of these dairy cows are imported and only a very few male animals are imported once every few years. Further, around one thousand indirect jobs have been created in the process of providing fodder for the animals on this farm. A mechanism is already in place to source the whole maize plant to the Ambewela Farm from farmers after harvesting. The Ambewela Farm has facilities to gather around 25,000 metric tonnes of maize plants annually and store them. President Ranil Wickremesinghe also inspected the 30 acres of abandoned land in the vicinity of the Ambewela Farm which has been identified as a suitable location to grow grass, the PMD added.

title: Keheliya says he acted in good faith
author: Author not found
Content: Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, refuting allegations with regard to his recent trip to India to make arrangements for the purchase of 28 medicines from an Indian company which was not registered with the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA), said they were malicious attempts which distorted facts. The trip was made utilising his personal funds with the best interests of Sri Lankans in mind, Rambukwella said, lambasting those who claimed that his hotel stay was paid for by the Indian pharmaceutical manufacturer.     Speaking to the media at the Health Ministry yesterday (28), Rambukwella said he had acted with good intentions. “Pharmaceuticals cannot be bought like essential food commodities from the market. They have a shelf life. They cannot be stored indefinitely unlike certain parties with vested interests would want people to believe.” “Some persons want the health service to collapse and see people die without medicines,” he added. Rambukwella said he had been concerned with regard to the time it took after the order was placed which had prompted the decision to sanction Cabinet approval to purchase medicinal drugs utilising the remaining funds received through the Indian credit line. According to the agreement, these purchases can only be made from pharmaceutical producers in India. A Cabinet Memorandum was submitted as the medicinal drugs had to be purchased on an unsolicited basis. “However, with all the rumours and claims with regard to the manufacturing practices in India, the Health Ministry deployed one of its Additional Secretaries followed by myself as the Health Minister to check on manufacturing practices,” he said. Fielding questions, the Minister said the Health Ministry owed Rs 15 billion to its suppliers, Rs 16 billion to banks, and another Rs 4 billion to local manufacturers. State hospitals owe another Rs 10 billion to their supply chain. Referring to media reports and to a media briefing conducted by the Education Secretary of the Frontline Socialist Party (FSP) Pubudu Jayagoda with regard to local manufacturing of certain medicines, the Minister said although he was ready to give priority to local manufacturers, the medicines that were manufactured were inadequate to cater to the local requirement. Although over 180 tender applications had been submitted, only three pharmaceutical suppliers had been able to cater to the need owing to the present economic drawbacks of the country, he added. A Cabinet Paper was submitted on 25 October regarding pharmaceutical imports from Savorite Pharmaceuticals Private Limited, an Indian manufacturer. However, the Finance Ministry issued an observation paper on 8 November signed by President Ranil Wickremesinghe which stated that approval from two committees is compulsory to initiate the process, since it fell outside procurement. The FSP Education Secretary said another Cabinet Paper had been submitted on 5 December by Rambukwella ignoring the given instruction, choosing Kausikh Therapeutics Pvt. Ltd. as the latest company. However, Minister Rambukwella said the particular company exported a large number of medicinal drugs to several countries including Australia. By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: IGP cautions media against publishing unverified info
author: Author not found
Content: IGP C.D. Wickramaratne visited the CID yesterday (28) to assess the progress of investigations into the murder of non-executive Director Janashakthi Life Insurance Co. Ltd Dinesh Schaffter. According to Police Media Spokesman SSP Nihal Thalduwa, Wickramaratne met senior police officers involved in the investigation and issued instructions. Further, Sri Lanka Police advised media institutions to refrain from publicising unverified information related to the recent murder of Schaffter. Issuing a notice in this regard, Police noted that various versions and details of the death are currently circulating across several media platforms, and urged all media institutions to refrain from reporting details obtained from unverified or non-authoritative sources. Police said investigations into the murder are currently being conducted by the Homicide and Organised Crimes Division of the CID and said the publication of such reports will obstruct the course of justice, and interfere with ongoing investigations. Police added that it can be disadvantageous to innocent parties, while aiding those actually responsible for the incident. BY Bimal Jayasinghe – Colombo and Aloka Kasturiarachchi

title: Ratnapura Police in cahoots with drug peddlers – MC member
author: Author not found
Content: Ratnapura MC UNP member, Sandun Sameera said the Ratnapura District has already made headlines as being one of the leading Districts falling prey to drugs such as ‘ICE’. He said despite repeated pleas made to the Ratnapura Police to formulate measures to curb the spread of dangerous drugs in society, such requests had been ignored. Sameera added that it was unfortunate that Police do not work to safeguard the masses but enrich the lives of drug peddlers as they were in cahoot with them. He was speaking at the monthly sessions of the MC on 23 December. BY K. A. S. Piyathileke – Kuruvita

title: 3,294 dengue patients in Jaffna
author: Author not found
Content: Jaffna District Regional Director of Health Services, Dr. A. Ketheeswaran says 3,294 dengue patients had been detected in the District from January to December this year. He said, of this number, nine patients had succumbed to the symptoms of the viral disease. He said the inclement weather conditions in the North had contributed largely to the spike in the number of dengue patients in the Jaffna District. According to Dr. Ketheeswaran, though they had managed to curtail the spike in the number of dengue patients during the past two years, this year there had been a sudden and alarming increase in the number of patients infected with the viral disease. By Sashi Kumar – Mullaitivu

title: Father nabbed for sexually abusing young daughter
author: Author not found
Content: Galnewa Police has arrested a suspect who is an Army deserter during the night of 26 December charged with the sexual abuse of his 12-year-old daughter over a two-year period. Police said, initial inquiries revealed that the suspect had forced his daughter to consume birth control pills during this period while continuing to sexually abuse her. According to the Galnewa Police they had apprehended the suspect on a complaint lodged by the victim. Police added that according to the complaint she had been sexually abused without her mother’s knowledge . Police said, the suspect realising that his daughter had gone to the Police to lodge a complaint against him had attempted to flee in a bus plying from Galnewa to Kekirawa. However, on inspection of the bus on a tip off Police arrested the suspect. The child was admitted to the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital for tests. BY Nandana Kelegama – Polpithigama

title: Sajith throws challenge to Govt to hand over country
author: Author not found
Content: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa challenged the Government to hand over the country to him and the SJB as they would be able to rebuild the country, unlike the current administration. Addressing the media, yesterday (28) following the 52nd ‘Sakwala’ education programme, Premadasa said he would never say ‘no’ to challenges and was committed to do his part to build a prosperous country. He said, Sakwala was a programme that was out of the traditional framework. Work was carried out by the Opposition in the health and education sector, where no other Opposition has done this type of work in the past. The ruling party is not doing any work but was only bankrupting the country, he added. The Opposition Leader said some students even have patents for inventions, but there is no educational system in the country to utilise their capacity in the country. By Nabiya Vaffoor

title: Money printing rises to record Rs 3.53T
author: Author not found
Content: Government of Sri Lanka’s (GoSL’s) face value money printing (FVMP) debt increased by Rs 253,558.89 million (7.74 per cent) to a record high Rs 3,531,006.09 million (Rs 3.5310 trillion) on Tuesday (27 December) due to a persistent lack of revenue. The previous record was Rs 3.3678 trillion (Rs 3.37 trillion) which was established on 15 December. However, Tuesday’s MP increase was non-demand pull inflationary, as it was used to settle swaps totaling Rs 257,634.89 million (USD 709.43 million) between Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) and GoSL that took place on Tuesday. Conversions are based on the administered value of the official, but benchmark ‘spot’ on Thursday (22 December) which was Rs 363.16 to the US dollar. GoSL’s at least theoretical MP borrowing costs (BCs) decreased by 0.88 per cent(Rs 1,019.08 million) toRs 114,570.53 million on Tuesday, due to buying pressure of Treasury (T) Bills and T-Bonds in secondary market trading because of high yields offered by the same, at the expense of lending to the private sector, the engine of growth. Market shortfall increased for the third second consecutive market day to Tuesday, this time by 1.10 per cent (Rs 4,076 million) to Rs 373,078 million, thereby causing sustained rate pressure. Market was short for a record 318 market days to Tuesday. GoSL’s highest to the 323rd highest FVMP debt has been recorded in the 323 consecutive market days to Tuesday. GoSL’s FVMP debt has been over Rs 3 trillion for a record consecutive 118 market days to Tuesday due to a persistent lack of revenue. Swaps between GoSL and CBSL are foreign reserves-neutral. CBSL which administers daily ‘OMO’ lacks transparency. GoSL’s FVMP debt is equivalent to the totality of CBSL’s T-Bill and T-Bond holdings. MP is the exclusive right of CBSL. GoSL’s MPBCs are prorated to the outcome in secondary market trading of T-Bills and T-Bonds on the reference day. ‘Spot’ trades are settled after two market days from the date of transaction. CBSL, the steward of GoSL debt and its foreign reserves deals in ‘spot.’ The ‘spot’ is administered to minimise GoSL’s foreign debt in rupee terms and to lower the cost of energy imports which are met from the country’s foreign reserves and not from the market, to prevent further depreciative pressure on the rupee, as Sri Lanka is an import-dependent economy. By Paneetha Ameresekere

title: Capital Trust Properties facilitates USD 200,000 donation
author: Author not found
Content: Capital Trust Properties facilitates USD 200,000 worth of medical equipment like medical beds, defibrillators, medical tools and consumables donated by A& D Foundation and Medical Bridges of Texas to the non-paying wards of the National hospital. A&D Foundation is a charity that was set up by David Lindsey, after he lost his siblings Amelie and Daniel in Sri Lanka in the 2019 Easter Attacks. The A&D Foundation worked in partnership with Medical Bridges, an American non-profit organisation that sourced the equipment from across the USA and packaged it into a 40-foot container for transit. We have to work together to improve the overall standards of cleanliness and professionalism of our healthcare system.” Speaking on behalf of the A&D Foundation, David Lindsey said, “We are proud to continue our work in what has been a trying time for Sri Lanka. We will do our utmost to help strengthen Sri Lankan medical care in memory of Amelie and Daniel.”

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Two missing fishers rescued by Navy
author: Author not found
Content: Two fishermen who had gone missing for four days after they had ventured out to deep sea off Silawathura coast coming under the purview of the Musali Divisional Secretariat in Mannar were found by Navy officers yesterday. The two fishermen aged 19 and 23 are residents of Kayakkuli area in Silawathura and they had set out for their livelihood on 23 December. author: Author not found

title: 3,294 dengue patients in Jaffna
author: Author not found
Content: Jaffna District Regional Director of Health Services, Dr. A. Ketheeswaran says 3,294 dengue patients had been detected in the District from January to December this year. He said, of this number, nine patients had succumbed to the symptoms of the viral disease. He said the inclement weather conditions in the North had contributed largely to the spike in the number of dengue patients in the Jaffna District. According to Dr. Ketheeswaran, though they had managed to curtail the spike in the number of dengue patients during the past two years, this year there had been a sudden and alarming increase in the number of patients infected with the viral disease. By Sashi Kumar – Mullaitivu

title: Father nabbed for sexually abusing young daughter
author: Author not found
Content: Galnewa Police has arrested a suspect who is an Army deserter during the night of 26 December charged with the sexual abuse of his 12-year-old daughter over a two-year period. Police said, initial inquiries revealed that the suspect had forced his daughter to consume birth control pills during this period while continuing to sexually abuse her. According to the Galnewa Police they had apprehended the suspect on a complaint lodged by the victim. Police said, the suspect realising that his daughter had gone to the Police to lodge a complaint against him had attempted to flee in a bus plying from Galnewa to Kekirawa. title: Money printing rises to record Rs 3.53T
author: Author not found
Content: Government of Sri Lanka’s (GoSL’s) face value money printing (FVMP) debt increased by Rs 253,558.89 million (7.74 per cent) to a record high Rs 3,531,006.09 million (Rs 3.5310 trillion) on Tuesday (27 December) due to a persistent lack of revenue. The previous record was Rs 3.3678 trillion (Rs 3.37 trillion) which was established on 15 December. However, Tuesday’s MP increase was non-demand pull inflationary, as it was used to settle swaps totaling Rs 257,634.89 million (USD 709.43 million) between Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) and GoSL that took place on Tuesday. Conversions are based on the administered value of the official, but benchmark ‘spot’ on Thursday (22 December) which was Rs 363.16 to the US dollar. GoSL’s at least theoretical MP borrowing costs (BCs) decreased by 0.88 per cent(Rs 1,019.08 million) toRs 114,570.53 million on Tuesday, due to buying pressure of Treasury (T) Bills and T-Bonds in secondary market trading because of high yields offered by the same, at the expense of lending to the private sector, the engine of growth. Market shortfall increased for the third second consecutive market day to Tuesday, this time by 1.10 per cent (Rs 4,076 million) to Rs 373,078 million, thereby causing sustained rate pressure. Market was short for a record 318 market days to Tuesday. GoSL’s highest to the 323rd highest FVMP debt has been recorded in the 323 consecutive market days to Tuesday. GoSL’s FVMP debt has been over Rs 3 trillion for a record consecutive 118 market days to Tuesday due to a persistent lack of revenue. Swaps between GoSL and CBSL are foreign reserves-neutral. CBSL which administers daily ‘OMO’ lacks transparency. GoSL’s FVMP debt is equivalent to the totality of CBSL’s T-Bill and T-Bond holdings. MP is the exclusive right of CBSL. GoSL’s MPBCs are prorated to the outcome in secondary market trading of T-Bills and T-Bonds on the reference day. ‘Spot’ trades are settled after two market days from the date of transaction. CBSL, the steward of GoSL debt and its foreign reserves deals in ‘spot.’ The ‘spot’ is administered to minimise GoSL’s foreign debt in rupee terms and to lower the cost of energy imports which are met from the country’s foreign reserves and not from the market, to prevent further depreciative pressure on the rupee, as Sri Lanka is an import-dependent economy. By Paneetha Ameresekere

title: CEB makes Rs 532M generation profit
author: Author not found
Content: Ceylon Electricity Board made a generation profit of Rs 532 million on Tuesday (27 December), CEB data showed. CEB statistics also showed that Sri Lanka consumed a total of 34.34 gigawatt hours (GWh) of electricity on Tuesday.  CEB’s average tariff rate of Rs 16.37 per kilowatt hour (kWh), which the above calculations are based on, are as per Central Bank of Sri Lanka’s (CBSL’s) 2021 Annual Report, which is the latest of such data available in the public domain.  An 8.72 per cent transmission and distribution loss as per last year’s cost estimates as computed by the CEB is also taken into consideration in the above computation, coupled with a 75 per cent tariff hike which was effective from 9 August. Meanwhile, the breakdown of the 34.34 GWh of electricity generated on Tuesday comprised 11.47 GWh of CEB coal, 14.87 GWh of CEB hydroelectricity, 3.6 GWh of CEB fuel/thermal oil, 2.1 GWh from RE other than CEB hydroelectricity and 2.3 GWh from independent power producers’ (IPP’)/ private sector fuel oil, respectively. According to the CBSL, the cheapest electricity  generation cost to the CEB last year was CEB hydroelectricity at Rs 1.67 a unit of electricity (one kWh of electricity), followed by CEB coal (Rs 10.68), ‘other RE’ (Rs 16.22), IPP fuel oil (Rs 30.35) and CEB fuel oil (Rs 32.03), respectively.  The main driver of CEB hydroelectricity is the Mahaweli which generated 10.07 GWh of electricity and which contributed to 29.32 per cent of total electricity generation on Tuesday. Mahaweli is led by Victoria, Randenigala, Rantambe and Kotmale built during the J.R. Jayewardene era after obtaining both grant and concessional aid from the West. In the 361 calendar days that have transpired up to Tuesday, RE provided 50 per cent or over of Sri Lanka’s electricity needs in 177 (49.03 per cent) of those days, while on the balance days electricity provision was led by the dirty and imported fossil fuels comprising coal and fuel oil, respectively. On Tuesday, over 50 per cent of Sri Lanka’s electricity needs were met by fossil fuels. By Paneetha Ameresekere

title: Cash-strapped economy does not support an election – FM official
author: Author not found
Content: The country is facing the worst economic crisis in its history, and currently the State’s monthly revenue was sufficient only for State sector salaries, pensions and Samurdhi allowances, a senior official of the Ministry of Finance said and added this was not the time to hold an election. The official, pointing out that systematic measures have been already taken to solve the current financial crisis, said the results would be reaped by March next year. He said it was not possible to allocate funds for an election in such a backdrop as the programme launched to revive the economy will be interrupted and the economy would take a turn for the worse.  “At present, Rs 93 billion was required for State sector salaries, Rs 26. 5 billion was needed to pay State pensions and Rs 6 billion was needed for Samurdhi allowances.  Apart from this, the Government has to borrow money to pay Rs 3.5 billion as social welfare benefits, Rs 3,000 million for medicine and health services, Rs 2 billion for military rations, Rs 2 billion for fertiliser, Rs 7 billion for fuel, electricity, water and insurance and Rs 3 billion as recurrent expenditure and to settle loans. As the Banks have reduced overdrafts granted to the Government, the only other option was to get money from the Central Bank,” he said. Money needed for an Election should be obtained from the Central Bank and hence escalation of the inflation rate when money is printed cannot be prevented and will affect the people by increasing the existing burden, he said.  “However, it will take at least a year for the economy to stabilise. At present, the economic situation has been relieved to some extent. Due to the concessions given to agriculture and paddy cultivation by the State, a surplus in the paddy harvest has been obtained”, the official added. He said, however, if funds were spent on an Election, another economic collapse was inevitable. “If there is an economic recession in the country again, there is no way the country could revive”, he said. “There is a possibility of borrowing money from Banks once the IMF programme begins to operate by March next year. Additionally, it will take a few more months for the Government to amass benefits through the tax policies,” he added. (NJ)

title: Lack of food root cause – Weeratunga
author: Author not found
Content: Environmentalist and Officer of the Udawalawe Elephant Conservation Project, Sameera Weeratunga says one of the main reasons for the worsening human-elephant conflict in the Udawalawe and Lunugamvehera National Parks is the reduction of forest quality over the past 20 years. He said forest quality had started to decline markedly in the Dahaiyagala and Batahirakanda forest reserves during the past decade and a half. According to Weeratunga, forest reserve quality is measured by the amount of food available for elephants. The amount of food has reduced due to livestock grazing in the area. By Nalinda Waleboda – Balangoda

title: Youth arrested for raping minor
author: Author not found
Content: A youth who is a resident of 8th Mile Post in Kotiyagala area has been arrested by the Ethimale Police on charges of raping a minor who is a resident of Hawenarawa in Kotiyagala. According to Police, investigations showed that the victim had also been raped by an Army deserter in October. The minor has been admitted to the Moneragala District Hospital for a medical examination. By Nadun Gunathileke – Bibile

title: Proposed electricity tariff hike based on faulty data – Jayanath
author: Author not found
Content: Professionals’ Union General Secretary of Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) Jayanath Herath alleged the Government has based its reasons for the impending electricity tariff hike on faulty data. He warned if another electricity tariff hike is effected based on false data, it will also signal the death knell of the country’s industrial sector including the crucial apparel industry. He said data put forth yesterday (27) by Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera and CEB officials related to the cost of electricity production are poles apart. Herath alleged that both Minister Wijesekera and CEB officials are continuing to dupe consumers and he urged the public not to be hoodwinked by the theories put forth by the Minister and CEB officials. He urged the Government to defer its decision to hike the electricity tariff with effect from next month based on erroneous data and warned that if such a hike is effected it will lead to the entire power sector collapsing sooner than later. By Bingun Menaka Gamage

title: President changes 8 Ministry Secys
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe changed secretaries of several Ministries with effect from yesterday (27). Accordingly, the President changed secretaries of eight Ministries and the most notable change is M.M.P.K. Mayadunne who previously served at the Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government being transferred to the Ministry of Transport and Highways. H.K.D.W.M.N.B. Hapuhinna who had previously been attached to the Ministry of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment has been appointed to replace Mayadunne at his former Ministry. Meanwhile, K. Mahesan who had previously functioned as the Jaffna District Secretary has been appointed as the new Secretary to the Ministry of Sports and Youth Affairs. M. Yamuna Perera who had previously been serving as the Additional Secretary of the Ministry of Labour and Foreign Employment has been transferred to the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs. M.M. Naimudeen who had been attached to the Ministry of Public Administration and Home Affairs as its Additional Secretary previously has now been appointed as the Secretary to the Ministry of Investments Promotion. Further, P.P. Gunathileke who had previously been functioning as the Commissioner General of the Department of Registration of Persons has now been transferred to the Ministry of Public Security as its new Secretary. A.M.P.M.B. Atapattu who had served previously as the Senior Presidential Additional Secretary has been appointed as the new Secretary to the Ministry of Food Security, Trade and Commerce. R M.W.S. Samaradiwakara who had functioned previously as the Additional Secretary to the Agriculture Ministry has been transferred to the Ministry of Lands and Tourism as its new Secretary. Meanwhile, Secretaries to the Ministries of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, Irrigation and Education Wasantha Perera, U.D.C. Jayalal and M.N. Ranasinghe have been given one-year service extensions. These appointments are effective from 1 January next year, the Presidential Secretariat said. By Amith Maduranga Gamage

title: UNP to call for applications from 1 Jan
author: Author not found
Content: The UNP will call for applications for electoral organisers from 1 January 2023, in preparation for upcoming Local Government Elections, UNP General Secretary Palitha Rangebandara said yesterday (27). Speaking at a media briefing at Sirikotha, Rangebandara said applications will be called on open basis as per instructions of President Ranil Wickremesinghe. “These organisers will be appointed through an interview. Priority will be given to educationists, intellectuals, and disciplined persons who are capable of serving everyone in their areas with commitment and compassion for people, regardless of race, caste, and religious differences,” he said. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Orientation for new SL Mission Heads
author: Author not found
Content: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs conducted an orientation programme from 16 – 23 December, for 14 newly designated Heads of Sri Lanka Missions abroad and two Heads of Post who were recently appointed by President Ranil Wickremesinghe. Those appointed are due to assume duties shortly. The Foreign Ministry welcomes the appointment of a large number of career diplomats as Heads of Missions. Twelve of the new Heads of Missions designate and one Head of Post are members of theSri Lanka Foreign Service.  The orientation programme was inaugurated by Minister of Foreign Affairs Ali Sabry who highlighted the present priorities for Sri Lanka Missions and foreign policy challenges. Foreign Secretary Aruni Wijewardane emphasised on the leadership role of Heads of Mission in achieving the goals and objectives of the country. The orientation programme included discussions on economic, political, security, cultural and consular matters and field visits to the Northern Province as well as other government entities. The Ambassadors designate presented their strategies for their term of office at a panel discussion attended by Foreign Minister Ali Sabry, State Minister of Foreign Affairs Tharaka Balasuriya and Foreign Secretary Aruni Wijewardane.  The Heads of Mission designate paid a courtesy call on Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and will pay a courtesy call on President Wickremesinghe in due course.  The newly appointed Heads of Mission designate from the Foreign Service include, Permanent Representative designate to the UN in Geneva Himalee Arunathilaka, Ambassador designate to Bahrain Reethi Wijeratne, High Commissioner designate to  Australia Chitranganee Wagiswara, Ambassador designate to Vietnam Dr. Saj Mendis, Ambassador designate to France Manisha Gunasekera, Ambassador designate to Kuwait B. Kandeepan, Ambassador designate to Ethiopia & African Union Theshantha Kumarasiri, Ambassador designate to Germany Varuni Muthukumarana, Ambassador designate to Lebanon Kapila Jayaweera, Ambassador designate to Jordan Priyangika Wijegunasekara, Ambassador designate to the Philippines  Dr. Chanaka Talpahewa, Ambassador designate to Israel Nimal Bandara and Consul General designate to Milan Dilani Weerakoon. In addition, Ambassador designate to Indonesia Admiral Jayanath Colombage, Ambassador designate to the UAE Udaya Indrarathna, and Consul General in Melbourne Sandith Samarasinghe have also been appointed.

title: CHOOSE EITHER HIGHER TARIFFS OR LONGER POWERCUTS!
author: Author not found
Content: The public needs to choose between increased electricity tariffs or staying in the dark for longer hours daily, Minister of Power and Energy Kanchana Wijesekera said. He said if electricity tariffs are not raised in accordance with the Ceylon Electricity Board’s (CEB) requirements, extended power cuts are inevitable. Speaking to the media yesterday (27) at the Ministry of Power and Energy, he also said due to Sri Lanka’s coal crisis and its impact on the Lakvijaya Power Plant in Norochcholai, the electricity tariffs will have to be increased to keep daily power cuts to a minimum. CEB General Manager Rohan Seneviratne, who participated in the media briefing, said a unit of electricity is priced at Rs 29.14 while the production cost is Rs 48.42 per unit. Wijesekera refuted recent claims that electricity tariffs are being raised to recover CEB losses incurred thus far, explaining that the increase is being proposed to generate the required amount of electricity. He added that if tariffs were raised to recover CEB’s losses, they would have to be raised by a much higher percentage. He also said electricity tariffs will undoubtedly be revised in January 2023, with a detailed report due to be submitted at the first Cabinet meeting on 2 January 2023. Several ministers suggested that instead of another tariff hike, an alternative programme should be put in place to minimise the Ceylon Electricity Board’s (CEB) losses at a Cabinet meeting earlier this month. However, Wijesekera said at the time the present issue could not be resolved and the duration of daily power cuts would have to be increased to at least six hours if electricity tariffs were not raised. Meanwhile, he said plans are underway to provide all places of worship with a free 5 KW solar power unit within the next three months. The project is to be facilitated under an Indian credit line, he said. “A programme will be implemented to provide solar panels to all low-income religious places through the Indian credit line within three months to provide at least a 5 KW solar system free of charge. A majority of religious places use less than 650 units of electricity. After installing the solar system, their electricity bills will be nil,” he said. By Thameenah Razeek

title: CEB STAFF WON’T DISCONNECT POWER TO HOUSES – JAYALAL
author: Author not found
Content: No Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) employee will take part in disconnecting the electricity supply to houses belonging to those who cannot bear the electricity tariff hike that is proposed to be imposed from January 2023, Convener of the CEB’s United Trade Union Alliance Ranjan Jayalal said yesterday (27). Speaking to Ceylon Today, Jayalal said it is not fair to increase the electricity tariff by a huge margin as it will severely impact persons already struggling to make ends meet. “This tariff hike is proposed to be imposed from 3 January 2023. If a decision is taken to disconnect electricity supply for houses, no CEB employee will take part in that,” he said. “Although Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said relief will be provided for some groups, it is impractical. Not only that, the coal crisis is not resolved too,” he added. By Anuradha Herath

title: Priyamali released after meeting bail conditions
author: Author not found
Content: Owner of Thico Group Pvt. Ltd., Thilini Priyamali, was released from prison after meeting bail conditions, the Prisons Department said. Prisons Spokesman Chandana Ekanayake said steps have been taken to release her from prison since the District Court granted bail in the case against her for possessing a mobile phone. Priyamali, who was remanded in custody and later granted bail in connection with large-scale financial fraud, appeared before the Fort Magistrate yesterday (27) to sign bail conditions for eight cases against her. Her family had recently posted bail in the form of eight sureties in Rs 50,000 and 20 sureties in Rs 10 million each. By Thameenah Razeek

The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Low-income farmer families to get Rs 15,000 subsidy
author: Author not found
Content: The United States Agency for International Development (USAID) has decided to provide Rs 15,000 per low-income rice cultivating family in seven districts for their livelihood development. According to Agriculture Minister Mahinda Amaraweera, steps will be taken to provide this allowance to farming families with a monthly income of less than Rs 41,500 in the Jaffna, Mullaitivu, Mannar, Trincomalee, Vavuniya, Moneragala and Batticaloa districts. The Commissioner General of the Department of Agrarian Development said this sum will be given in two instalments in January 2023. Further, the Asian Development Bank (ADB) has agreed to pay a sum of Rs 8 billion to 1.2 million farming families. An amount ranging from Rs 10,000 to Rs 20,000 will be provided to farmers. Under the first phase, arrangements have been made to credit Rs 4 billion to the respective farmers’ accounts before 31 December. Further, Rs 4 billion will be credited to the accounts of farmers in January 2023. Accordingly, farmers who cultivate up to one hectare will be given a sum of Rs 10,000, and farmers who cultivate up to two hectares will be given a sum of Rs 20,000.

title: Proposed electricity tariff hike based on faulty data – Jayanath
author: Author not found
Content: Professionals’ Union General Secretary of Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) Jayanath Herath alleged the Government has based its reasons for the impending electricity tariff hike on faulty data. He warned if another electricity tariff hike is effected based on false data, it will also signal the death knell of the country’s industrial sector including the crucial apparel industry. He said data put forth yesterday (27) by Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera and CEB officials related to the cost of electricity production are poles apart. Herath alleged that both Minister Wijesekera and CEB officials are continuing to dupe consumers and he urged the public not to be hoodwinked by the theories put forth by the Minister and CEB officials. He urged the Government to defer its decision to hike the electricity tariff with effect from next month based on erroneous data and warned that if such a hike is effected it will lead to the entire power sector collapsing sooner than later. By Bingun Menaka Gamage

title: President changes 8 Ministry Secys
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe changed secretaries of several Ministries with effect from yesterday (27). Accordingly, the President changed secretaries of eight Ministries and the most notable change is M.M.P.K. Mayadunne who previously served at the Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils and Local Government being transferred to the Ministry of Transport and Highways. H.K.D.W.M.N.B. Hapuhinna who had previously been attached to the Ministry of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment has been appointed to replace Mayadunne at his former Ministry. Meanwhile, K. Mahesan who had previously functioned as the Jaffna District Secretary has been appointed as the new Secretary to the Ministry of Sports and Youth Affairs. M. Yamuna Perera who had previously been serving as the Additional Secretary of the Ministry of Labour and Foreign Employment has been transferred to the Ministry of Women and Child Affairs. M.M. Naimudeen who had been attached to the Ministry of Public Administration and Home Affairs as its Additional Secretary previously has now been appointed as the Secretary to the Ministry of Investments Promotion. Further, P.P. Gunathileke who had previously been functioning as the Commissioner General of the Department of Registration of Persons has now been transferred to the Ministry of Public Security as its new Secretary. A.M.P.M.B. Atapattu who had served previously as the Senior Presidential Additional Secretary has been appointed as the new Secretary to the Ministry of Food Security, Trade and Commerce. R M.W.S. Samaradiwakara who had functioned previously as the Additional Secretary to the Agriculture Ministry has been transferred to the Ministry of Lands and Tourism as its new Secretary. Meanwhile, Secretaries to the Ministries of Justice, Prison Affairs and Constitutional Reforms, Irrigation and Education Wasantha Perera, U.D.C. Jayalal and M.N. Ranasinghe have been given one-year service extensions. These appointments are effective from 1 January next year, the Presidential Secretariat said. By Amith Maduranga Gamage

title: UNP to call for applications from 1 Jan
author: Author not found
Content: The UNP will call for applications for electoral organisers from 1 January 2023, in preparation for upcoming Local Government Elections, UNP General Secretary Palitha Rangebandara said yesterday (27). Speaking at a media briefing at Sirikotha, Rangebandara said applications will be called on open basis as per instructions of President Ranil Wickremesinghe. “These organisers will be appointed through an interview. Priority will be given to educationists, intellectuals, and disciplined persons who are capable of serving everyone in their areas with commitment and compassion for people, regardless of race, caste, and religious differences,” he said. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Orientation for new SL Mission Heads
author: Author not found
Content: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs conducted an orientation programme from 16 – 23 December, for 14 newly designated Heads of Sri Lanka Missions abroad and two Heads of Post who were recently appointed by President Ranil Wickremesinghe. Those appointed are due to assume duties shortly. The Foreign Ministry welcomes the appointment of a large number of career diplomats as Heads of Missions. Twelve of the new Heads of Missions designate and one Head of Post are members of theSri Lanka Foreign Service.  The orientation programme was inaugurated by Minister of Foreign Affairs Ali Sabry who highlighted the present priorities for Sri Lanka Missions and foreign policy challenges. Foreign Secretary Aruni Wijewardane emphasised on the leadership role of Heads of Mission in achieving the goals and objectives of the country. The orientation programme included discussions on economic, political, security, cultural and consular matters and field visits to the Northern Province as well as other government entities. The Ambassadors designate presented their strategies for their term of office at a panel discussion attended by Foreign Minister Ali Sabry, State Minister of Foreign Affairs Tharaka Balasuriya and Foreign Secretary Aruni Wijewardane.  The Heads of Mission designate paid a courtesy call on Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena and will pay a courtesy call on President Wickremesinghe in due course.  The newly appointed Heads of Mission designate from the Foreign Service include, Permanent Representative designate to the UN in Geneva Himalee Arunathilaka, Ambassador designate to Bahrain Reethi Wijeratne, High Commissioner designate to  Australia Chitranganee Wagiswara, Ambassador designate to Vietnam Dr. Saj Mendis, Ambassador designate to France Manisha Gunasekera, Ambassador designate to Kuwait B. Kandeepan, Ambassador designate to Ethiopia & African Union Theshantha Kumarasiri, Ambassador designate to Germany Varuni Muthukumarana, Ambassador designate to Lebanon Kapila Jayaweera, Ambassador designate to Jordan Priyangika Wijegunasekara, Ambassador designate to the Philippines  Dr. Chanaka Talpahewa, Ambassador designate to Israel Nimal Bandara and Consul General designate to Milan Dilani Weerakoon. In addition, Ambassador designate to Indonesia Admiral Jayanath Colombage, Ambassador designate to the UAE Udaya Indrarathna, and Consul General in Melbourne Sandith Samarasinghe have also been appointed.

title: CHOOSE EITHER HIGHER TARIFFS OR LONGER POWERCUTS!
author: Author not found
Content: The public needs to choose between increased electricity tariffs or staying in the dark for longer hours daily, Minister of Power and Energy Kanchana Wijesekera said. He said if electricity tariffs are not raised in accordance with the Ceylon Electricity Board’s (CEB) requirements, extended power cuts are inevitable. Speaking to the media yesterday (27) at the Ministry of Power and Energy, he also said due to Sri Lanka’s coal crisis and its impact on the Lakvijaya Power Plant in Norochcholai, the electricity tariffs will have to be increased to keep daily power cuts to a minimum. CEB General Manager Rohan Seneviratne, who participated in the media briefing, said a unit of electricity is priced at Rs 29.14 while the production cost is Rs 48.42 per unit. Wijesekera refuted recent claims that electricity tariffs are being raised to recover CEB losses incurred thus far, explaining that the increase is being proposed to generate the required amount of electricity. He added that if tariffs were raised to recover CEB’s losses, they would have to be raised by a much higher percentage. He also said electricity tariffs will undoubtedly be revised in January 2023, with a detailed report due to be submitted at the first Cabinet meeting on 2 January 2023. Several ministers suggested that instead of another tariff hike, an alternative programme should be put in place to minimise the Ceylon Electricity Board’s (CEB) losses at a Cabinet meeting earlier this month. However, Wijesekera said at the time the present issue could not be resolved and the duration of daily power cuts would have to be increased to at least six hours if electricity tariffs were not raised. Meanwhile, he said plans are underway to provide all places of worship with a free 5 KW solar power unit within the next three months. The project is to be facilitated under an Indian credit line, he said. “A programme will be implemented to provide solar panels to all low-income religious places through the Indian credit line within three months to provide at least a 5 KW solar system free of charge. A majority of religious places use less than 650 units of electricity. After installing the solar system, their electricity bills will be nil,” he said. By Thameenah Razeek

title: ETF contributions must be made online – Siyambalapitiya
author: Author not found
Content: State Minister of Finance Ranjith Siyambalapitiya said employers must make Employees’ Trust Fund (ETF) contributions online going forward. State Minister Siyambalapitiya said, this system will come into effect beginning 1 February 2023 while expressing confidence that this platform will streamline the contribution process for employers from various industries. Employers who have over 15 employees must undertake their dealings with the ETF Board via the online platform including ETF payments and the submission of monthly reports. While companies can make payments with ease, employees can confirm whether employers are making ETF payments in a timely manner, Minister Siyambalapitiya added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Tourism promotion key economic priority
author: Author not found
Content: Foreign Minister Ali Sabry emphasised that tourism promotion is one of the key economic priorities of Sri Lanka which is especially significant in the present economic context as a direct source of foreign exchange and the Sri Lanka Missions/Posts abroad have a prominent role to play in positioning Sri Lanka as an ideal destination for tourists and countering negative publicity. Sabry, in a meeting held at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs recently, discussed present challenges, evolving strategy for Sri Lanka Tourism and the role of the Sri Lanka Missions/Posts in promoting tourism. The meeting was attended by senior officials of the two Ministries, and key stakeholders including the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau, Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority, Department of Immigration and Emigration, The Hotel Association of Sri Lanka and the Sri Lanka Association of Inbound Tour Operators, and virtually joined by the Heads of Sri Lanka Missions/Posts abroad. This was a joint initiative by the Foreign Ministry and the tourism industry in order to seek the best efforts of Sri Lanka Missions abroad to enhance tourism. The initial official level meeting with the stakeholders on the same, chaired by Foreign Secretary Aruni Wijewardane, was held on 18 November.  During the meeting, the Minister and officials comprehensively discussed the course of action and strategies that could be implemented collectively by the Sri Lanka Missions/Posts and industry stakeholders to revive the industry. During the extensive and productive exchange of ideas, Heads of Mission/Post elaborated on the action already taken by the Missions in tourism promotion, potential in respective markets and shared insights on the best practices by the respective host/accredited countries in tourism promotion.

title: FAO to distribute TSP fertiliser to all paddy farmers
author: Author not found
Content: The Food and Agriculture Organisation of the United Nations (FAO), with funding from the United States Agency for International Development (USAID), will distribute 36,000 metric tonnes of Triple Super Phosphate (TSP) fertiliser to all paddy farmers in Sri Lanka through the Ministry of Agriculture. The amount of TSP provided per farmer will be determined based on the area they cultivated in the 2022/2023 Maha season. The distribution list along with the land extent cultivated during this Maha season used to determine the amount of TSP fertiliser allocated per farmer has been published and displayed at all Agrarian Service Centres of the Department of Agrarian Development. FAO invites all eligible paddy farmers to visit their respective Agrarian Service Centre and ensure their details have been included. The distribution lists will be displayed until 5 January 2023, and the date of fertiliser distribution will be shared through the Agrarian Service Centres.

title: PDB office opens in Kaithadi PRI
author: Author not found
Content: The Palmyrah Development Board (PDB) auspiciously opened its head office at the Kaithadi Palmyrah Research Institute (PRI), on 13 October 2022, after 44 years. Cabinet Minister for Plantation Industries Dr. Ramesh Pathirana, Cabinet Minister for Fisheries Douglas Devananda, Minister of State for Plantation Industries Lohan Ratwatte and a number of special invitees participated in this event
