title: Schol awards applications close on 23 December
author: Author not found
Content: The accepting of applications for the scholarship awards programme, by the President’s Fund, for students with economic difficulties who have successfully completed the GCE O/L examination in 2021 and will be sitting for the GCE A/L examination in 2024 will end on 23 December. The applications which were obtained from the school principals should be duly completed and submitted to the respective school Principals on or before 23 December 2022. The Grama Seva Niladhari should recommend the income status of the applicant’s family. The application forms will be handed over to the President’s office through the Zonal education offices. However, due to the lack of understanding of the application submission process, a large number of applications were directly sent to the President’s Fund. Therefore, all the scholarship candidates are informed to hand over the applications to the respective principals instead of sending the applications directly to the President’s Fund in order to facilitate the scholarship awarding process without delay. To be eligible for the scholarship, the monthly income of the applicant’s family should not exceed Rs 75,000 and the applicant should be a student of a government school or in a private school that does not charge fees. The applicant should be a student who has completed the GCE O/L examination for the first time in 2021 and should be fully qualified to follow the GEC A/L examination 2024. The number of scholarships per educational zone is 30, and the selected scholarship winners will receive a bursary of Rs 5,000.00 each for a maximum period of 24 months.

title: Arrested with Mawa-coated betel
author: Author not found
Content: Jaffna Police arrested a person in possession of 3kg of Mawa-coated betel which had been prepared to be sold to students in Jaffna on 19 December. The Mawa stock had been seized from a house situated behind a well-known school in Jaffna and according to the Police the suspect had previously been charged with selling illegal drugs. Police stated that the suspect had planned to sell the betel at Rs100 to the students. BY Rasadi Gamage – Vavuniya

title: Prosecute human rights violators
author: Author not found
Content: President Ranil Wickremesinghe has directed Public Security Minister Tiran Alles to take legal action against any individual who violates the human rights of Sri Lankan citizens, regardless of their social status. This was announced by Cabinet Spokesman Bandula Gunawardana at the weekly Cabinet media briefing held yesterday (20). He said the new threat posed by illicit drugs, as well as the violence resulting from it, has created a decadent society. The President has instructed the Cabinet, particularly the Public Security Minister, to take all necessary steps to ensure a safe society for all citizens. Referring to 9 May as one of the days when Sri Lanka’s democracy was shattered due to public unrest, he said the President has said there should be no space for violence as in the past, the Minister added. When queried if this year’s shootings and killings were discussed at the final Cabinet meeting for 2022 held on 19 December, he said this topic is brought up at every Cabinet meeting. He also said everyone in the country should follow the law and not violate the rights to which a Sri Lankan is entitled under the Constitution of the country. By Thameenah Razeek

title: SPC Media Unit relocated
author: Author not found
Content: The Media Unit attached to the Southern Provincial Council has been removed from the Labuduwa Dakshinapaya Ministerial Complex and relocated to the Southern Province Governor’s Office, causing great inconvenience to journalists. The Southern Province Media Collective, issuing a press release, has stated that the sudden relocation of the media unit to the Southern Province Governor’s Office would seriously hamper the efforts made by regional journalists to promptly disseminate news and information to the public. Informed sources said the Labuduwa Dakshinapaya Ministerial Complex which had previously housed the media unit had been leased to a school building construction firm. BY Kamal Wijehewa- Galle

title: Further development on Indo-Lanka cooperation discussed
author: Author not found
Content: A meeting between the Indian Ocean Region Joint Secretary Puneeth Agrawal and Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation Nimal Siripala de Silva was held yesterday (20) at the Minister’s Office. Measures that can be taken to further develop the cooperation in the maritime sector of the Indian Ocean region were discussed. The Minister pointed out that India and Sri Lanka have already reached an agreement on the preliminary work to start a passenger ferry service. He requested Agrawal to start the passenger services soon and to provide the support of the Government of India for same. The Minister said that by expanding these passenger ferry services, the common people of both countries will be able to travel between the two countries at an affordable cost. He also pointed out that through the transportation of goods, there will be opportunities to expand trade activities between India and Sri Lanka. De Silva requested to increase the concessional loan amount given for the development of Kankesanthurai Port and pointed out that the reason for this was the fluctuation in the price of the goods in the construction sector. The Indian Ocean Region Secretary said that it is appropriate to start passenger ferry services between Danushkodi and Rameswaram. The Minister emphasised that he agrees with the proposal and that the Sri Lanka Railway service can also be connected with the passenger ferry services. The Minister requested that Indian air services be operated up to Mattala Airport as well. Agrawal said that the expansion of the naval and air services between the two countries is very important and the Indian Government will provide full support for that. Indian High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Gopal Bagle and a group of representatives participated in the discussion.

title: Bandula pledges to notify Food Policy Committee
author: Author not found
Content: In a backdrop of skyrocketing egg prices, Cabinet Spokesman Bandula Gunawardana said, “something went wrong in regulating egg prices.” Speaking at the Cabinet media briefing yesterday (20), Gunawardana pledged to notify the Food Policy Committee, which meets every two weeks, about this matter. When queried if the Cabinet discussed rising egg prices and possible solutions to control prices as the holiday season approaches, he said no such discussion took place. He said the Appellate Court has issued a ruling on egg prices, and that everyone should abide by the ruling. By Thameenah Razeek

title: Bangladesh HC marks 51st Victory Day
author: Author not found
Content: Bangladesh High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Tariq Mohamed Ariful Islam and his wife Najma hosted a reception, to mark the 51st Victory Day of Bangladesh, on 16 December 2022, at the premises of the mission in Colombo 7. The members of the community and a few selected invitees, from the local community, were entertained with several cultural events, followed by dinner. Father of the Nation Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahuman was also remembered at the event. By Ashraff A. Samad

title: Indonesian Embassy donates dry rations to needy
author: Author not found
Content: Indonesian Ambassador to Sri Lanka Dewi Gustina Tobing handed over packages, consisting of various types of dry rations to some Sri Lankan families, in need in this difficult time of the present economic crisis, on 19 December at the Indonesian Embassy in Colombo. This is part of a series of distribution of charity packages since 17 August 2022, after theflag-hoisting ceremony, commemorating the 77th Indonesian Independence Day, which continued in October, November and December 2022, for communities of Buddhist, Hindu, Christian, and Islam in some areas in Colombo and its suburbs, Hambantota, Hatton and Maskeliya, and witnessed by respective religious leaders.  The charity packages, in total 529, of dry rations, worth Rs 2.9 million, were obtained from the Indonesian community in Sri Lanka, the Maldives, and Western Australia. The series of Charity Programmes was organised by The Embassy of the Republic of Indonesia in Colombo in collaboration with Sri Lanka – Indonesian Friendship Association (SLIFA). It has symbolised the solidarity and friendship between both countries and also commemorated two milestone events which are the 70th anniversary of diplomatic relations between Indonesia and Sri Lanka and the 30th Anniversary of SLIFA.

title: ANURADHAPURA DISTRICT TOPS BOOZERS’ LIST
author: Author not found
Content: The Anuradhapura District has topped the list for consumption, Chairman of National Authority on Tobacco and Alcohol (NATA) Dr. Samadhi Rajapaksa said. He said liquor consumption is on the rise in the Nuwara-Eliya District, too. Nuwara Eliya District is in second place for liquor consumption, according to Dr. Rajapaksa. He added the Matara District is in third place.Dr. Rajapaksa said that according to the liquor consumption statistics, the liquor consumption ratio in the Anuradhapura District was 34 per cent, in the Nuwara Eliya District it was 33 per cent and in the Matara District 32 per cent. Consumption of narcotics was also on the rise in the hill country, Dr. Rajapaksa noted. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Opportunity to uplift agriculture risks closure, warns FAO
author: Author not found
Content: The window of opportunity to support Sri Lankan farmers and their communities is narrowly time-bound in the wake of the current socioeconomic crisis the island is facing, UN adjunct Food and Agriculture Organisation (FAO), in a statement released on Monday (19), warned. Sri Lanka is witnessing an unprecedented economic crisis and the situation is exacerbated by political and social turmoil, it said. Consequently, the supply of food in local markets is shrinking and food inflation is soaring, reaching 90 per cent in July 2022. Moreover, four in every ten households experienced a reduction in their incomes and one in every two households are currently relying on negative coping mechanisms to cope with the lack of food or money to buy it, said FAO. This also has to be looked at in the context that nearly 40 per cent of the population depends on agriculture as a primary source of income, it said. But the ongoing multidimensional crisis is posing an enormous threat to their livelihoods and disrupting the national food system, FAO warned. “Agricultural production is on a downward trend since mid-2021 due to the unavailability of fertilisers and other essential production inputs; livestock keepers are unable to access feed and basic veterinary supplies and fishers are unable to access fuel for motorised boats,” said FAO. Therefore, immediate action to provide farmers with quality seeds, fertilisers and pesticides will enable them to protect their livelihoods and feed their communities, it said. “It is also critical to provide the most vulnerable farmers, livestock keepers and fishers with cash assistance to enable them to restore their productive assets and fast-track their recovery,” it added. By Paneetha Ameresekere

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Rs 2B handed over to President for Govt’s Consolidated Fund
author: Author not found
Content: The Sri Lanka Port Authority, Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited and the Civil Aviation Authority jointly presented a cheque for Rs 2 billion to the Government’s Consolidated Fund which was officially handed over to President Ranil Wickremesinghe at the Presidential Secretariat on Monday (19). Accordingly, the Sri Lanka Port Authority has contributed Rs 1 billion, Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited Rs 500 million and Civil Aviation Authority Rs 500 million to the joint fund. Minister of Shipping and Aviation Services Nimal Siripala de Silva, Secretary to the Ministry of Finance Mahinda Siriwardena, Secretary to the Ministry of Shipping and Aviation Services K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, Chairman of Sri Lanka Authority Keith D. Bernard, Chairman of Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited Major General G.A. Chandrasiri (Rtd), Civil Aviation Authority Director General P.A. Jayakantha and several others participated in this event.

title: ‘Be it Galwan or Tawang’: Rajnath Singh praises Forces over China clashes
author: Author not found
Content: The bravery and valour displayed by the Indian Armed Forces, during the Galwan valley clash and a recent face-off in the Tawang sector of Arunachal Pradesh, are commendable and any amount of praise for them is not enough, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said on Saturday. In an address at the industry chamber FICCI, Singh also took an indirect dig at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for ‘doubting’ the Government’s handling of the border row with China. “Any amount of praise is not enough for the Armed Forces for the way they displayed bravery and valour, be it in Galwan or Tawang,” Singh said. “We have never questioned the intention of any leader in the Opposition, we have only debated on the basis of policies. Politics should be based on truth. Politics cannot be done on the basis of falsehood for a long time. The process of taking the society towards the right path is called ‘rajniti’ (politics). I do not understand the reason behind doubting anyone’s intention always,” the minister said. Singh said India’s stature has increased significantly on the world stage, under Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s leadership. Now, India is working on setting the agenda on the world stage, he said. (NDTV)

title: UNHCR appeals all to rescue those in distress, thanks SL
author: Author not found
Content: The 104 rescued Rohingyas are currently in Kakensanthurai (KKS), in the Northern Province and would be produced before the KKS Magistrate today (20), new Navy Spokesman Captain Gayan Wickremesuriya said. He told Ceylon Today that there were 23 children, four young girls and 29 women and the rest were men between the ages of 18 and 23. There was also an elderly person over the age of 70 who was treated at the KKS base hospital after becoming ill while travelling for more than a week. He also said, they are from Myanmar and it still needs to be verified to which community they belong. Their language is not understood and assistance was sought to clarify matters. According to the Navy Spokesman, they are all in good health and are currently being guarded by the Police at the Navy camp. They are being fed by the Navy. He said, Navy’s three patrol boats, one gun boat and two Dovra went on rescue operation and brought them ashore at KKS. The stranded Rohingyas were located in the Andaman Sea but close to the Sri Lankan territorial waters. According to reports, the distressed vessel entered Sri Lanka’s territorial waters on late Saturday night after experiencing a technical problem while transporting these individuals from Myanmar to Indonesia. According the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and Rohingya activists it is reported that another two boats with about 200 Rohingyas are now adrift in the Strait of Malacca. They reportedly began their journey from the coast of Bangladesh late last month and some of them reportedly died amid shortage of food and water for more than a week. The UNHCR last week repeated its earlier appeal to rescue the Rohingyas, who otherwise, risk death. “We are grateful to the Sri Lankan Navy and all who have acted to save lives,’’ said Indrika Ratwatte, UNHCR’s Director for Asia and the Pacific. “This is an example in humanity that all States in the region must follow to promptly and swiftly act to prevent the tragic loss of life at sea,” he added. The UNHCR is providing support to the Sri Lankan authorities for the immediate needs of those who were rescued. Also, the UNHCR yesterday (19) said it repeats its appeal to all responsible States to rescue those in distress and adrift on the boats, allowing them to safely disembark in line with legal obligations and humanitarian traditions. It remains concerned on reports of another boat in distress in the Bay of Bengal, near the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Some 161 refugees have been reported dead or missing at sea in 2022. Quick action is needed to save lives and avoid further deaths, it said. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: 37 Port TUs oppose selling Eastern terminal
author: Author not found
Content: Thirty-seven port trade unions expressed their opposition to the President’s proposal to sell the eastern terminal of the Colombo Port. Trade unions representing the United National Party and those representing Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) have also joined such action. Although previously, only 21 port trade unions opposed such move, thirty seven other trade unions have joined them. The trade unions had recently taken steps to hand over a special memorandum to the Presidential Secretariat expressing their opposition. Through the memorandum, the port trade unions have moved to withdraw the proposal to sell the eastern terminal and to inform about the financial allocations, including foreign exchange given to the State treasury, by the Sri Lanka Ports Authority (SLPA). BY Krishan Pathirath Jayasuriya

title: Govt accused of failing to recruit new nurses
author: Author not found
Content: Nurses accused the Government and provincial councils of failing to make necessary recruitments to the State nursing service, to replace those in the public service, who are over the age of 60, when they are sent on retirement with effect from 31 December 2022. General Secretary of the All Ceylon Nurses Union, S.B. Mediwatta yesterday (19) said that a large number of regional and rural hospitals, especially in Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa, Monaragala, Galnewa and Vavuniya, will be severely affected by the proposed retirement plan by the end of December this year.  In some of those hospitals there were three to four nurses retiring when they have only about seven to ten nurses to serve in them. He said at least 400 nurses would be retiring by end of this year. The situation would worsen by the end of five years as over 8,000 nurses would complete the age of 60. Those who joined the service in 1988, 1989 and 1990 would belong to this group. Mediwatte said that although advertisements had been placed and about 3,500 applicants had been accepted the Health Ministry was yet to interview them as new nursing trainees. At least 2,000 trained nurses have left service after completing seven eight years due to delays in promotions which have led to delays in grade promotions which would afford them salary increments, allowances etc and the  economic issues. The ACNU General Secretary urged the government and provincial councils to make necessary arrangements to recruit nurses to ensure that the remaining nurses would not have to bear the weight of ensuring that hospital services run smoothly. By Dilanthi Jayamanne

title: Horowpathana PS tech officer remanded
author: Author not found
Content: Colombo Additional Magistrate P. J. Prabakaran yesterday (19) remanded till 30 December the Technical Officer of the Horowpathana Pradeshiya Sabha (PS), who was charged with soliciting a bribe. The suspect, identified as Hashan Palliyaguruge, a resident of Kapugollawa Road, Horowpatana, had sought a bribe of Rs 20,000 to issue an environment license for the operation of a paddy store, at a land situated in Horowpathana. The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) informed Magistrate Prabakaran, that they had apprehended the suspect, when he had sought the said bribe from plaintiff Ibran Mohammmad Nalin, on 6 December. They added that upon his arrest, the suspect had been produced before the Kebethigollawa Chief Magistrate’s Court and had been remanded till yesterday. The suspect was then produced before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court, upon which he was ordered to be iremande, till the aforesaid date. The Bribery Commission has charged the suspect, with soliciting the said bribe from the plaintiff, to facilitate the compilation of an environment license, having submitted it to the Technical Committee of the Horowpathana PS, for the operation of a paddy store at a land situated at Sahanadara Mawatha, Horowpathana, under the name of the sibling of the plaintiff’s wife. By Hansi Nanayakkara

title: Inland Revenue Bill signed into law
author: Author not found
Content: Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardena yesterday (19) signed into law the Inland Revenue (Amendment) Bill which was passed in Parliament recently. Following the debate on the Second Reading of the Bill on 9 December, a division was called by the Opposition. Accordingly, 83 votes were cast in favour of the Bill to 41 against. A division was called for the Third Reading of the Inland Revenue (Amendment) Bill by the Opposition to which 79 votes were cast in favor to 36 against. Accordingly, this Bill comes into force as Inland Revenue (Amendment) Act No. 45 of 2022 from yesterday (19). (AK)

title: China to donate Rs 5B worth school uniform material
author: Author not found
Content: China will donate 90 million RMB (Rs 5 billion) worth of school uniform material to Sri Lankan students to meet 70 per cent of the entire country’s requirement in 2023. The Chinese Embassy in Colombo tweeted yesterday (19) that the first batch of finished material of three million metres of finished material, in 38,000 boxes via 20 containers, has already left China for Sri Lanka, according to the Chinese Embassy in Colombo. The first batch of school uniform donation contains 2,374,427.5m of white shirt/ frock materials, 350,031.5m of white trouser materials, 150,003.5m of blue trouser materials and 138,134m of orange robe materials bringing the total donation into 3,012,596.5m of uniform material. All together 3,012,596.5m of material, about 10 times the distance from Colombo to Jaffna, it added.

title: Cabinet to discuss Buddhist and Pali Uni matter with Prelates
author: Author not found
Content: The Cabinet yesterday (19) decided to hold discussions with Mahanayaka Theras, with regard to the current situation of the Buddhist and Pali University in Homagama and to come to an agreement on academic and administrative affairs of the university. The university will be closed until the discussions are concluded. The university was closed until further notice from yesterday (19), after alleged ragging incidents at the university came to light. Meanwhile, Chief Prelate of Mihintale Raja Maha Viharaya Most Venerable Walavahangunawewe Dhammarathana Thera stressed that some monks in the State Universities are like the ‘Taliban’. Ven. Thera noted that laws should be introduced to limit the number of years students can engage in academic activities at universities as well. “The conduct of some of these monks is a disgrace to the entire Sangha community,” Ven. Thera said.

title: New Navy chief meets President
author: Author not found
Content: Newly appointed Navy Commander Vice Admiral Priyantha Perera met President Ranil Wickremesinghe at the President’s Office yesterday (19). Vice Admiral Priyantha Perera resumed duties as the 25th Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy. After assuming duties, the new Navy Commander traditionally met the President and presented him with a memento. Meanwhile, the new Navy Commander also met the President’s Senior Adviser on National Security and Chief of Presidential Staff Sagala Ratnayaka and engaged in a friendly conversation.

title: Newly appointed GM of CEB assumes duties
author: Author not found
Content: Rohan Seneviratne assumed duties as the new General Manager of the CEB recently. He joined CEB in 1986 as an electrical engineer and served in many Divisions  of the CEB in different capacities and became the General Manager on 19th December 2022. Before  undertaking the duties of the General Manager of the CEB, he headed the Distribution Division 4 of the CEB.  He is one of the pioneers in introducing  roof top solar schemes in the country and contributed immensely to the promotion of roof top solar in the country.   He undertook the leadership in introducing  Smart Metering Systems, Advanced Distribution Management Systems, Enterprise Resource Planning Systems, Key Performance Indicators, LNG to the power sector, Roadmap for Digital Transformation CEB, Roadmap for  Renewable Power Development   in the CEB.    Seneviratne is  a Chartered Electrical Engineer with over 35 years of experience in the field of engineering and technology. He is a Fellow member of Institution of Engineering and Technology, UK and Institution of Engineers, Sri Lanka and a Member of Engineers Australia.  He is an alumnus of University of Moratuwa and obtained his Electrical Engineering Degree in the year 1986. He also earned his Master of Business Administration degree and the Post Graduate Diploma in Computer Technology from University of Colombo and the Post Graduate Diploma in Electric Power Distribution Systems from Norwegian University of Science and Technology in Trondheim, Norway.  He is an old boy of St. Joseph Vaz College Wennappuwa. During his carrier he served 5 yrs as the Additional Secretary (Technical) of the Ministry of Defence and Urban Development from 2011 to 2015. As the Additional Secretary (Technical) of the Ministry, he actively involved in urban regeneration works in metro Colombo region. He also functioned as the first Project Director of Metro Colombo Urban Development Project of US$ 223 million which was financed by the World Bank for four  years period from the inception. In addition, he served  as a Director of the Urban Development Authority, Sri Lanka Land Reclamation and Development Corporation, Lanka Electricity Company (Pvt) Limited, and Waters Edge.   He is an active member of the Institution of Engineering and Technology and served as the Chairman of the IET Sri Lanka Network and as a member of the South Asia Communities Committee of the IET. During his university days he excelled in sports and earned university colours in Tennis, Table Tennis, Badminton, Basketball and Hockey. He earned the best all round sportsman of the year award and also became the sports captain and president sports council of the University of Moratuwa.

title: Action to be taken against Principal
author: Author not found
Content: Disciplinary actions will be taken against the principal of Godauda Maha Vidyalaya, in Dickwella, who had forced several students to clean spilled food by using their tongue recently, Southern Province Education Secretary Ranjith Yapa said. Yapa expressed his deep concern over the incident and said after the highly embarrassing and humiliating incident, the Southern Province Education Secretary issued an immediate transfer to the principal to the Matara Zonal Education Office. According to Yapa, the incident had taken place about three weeks ago. The principal had forced 10 students of Grade 10 to remove food residues that had been found on a desk, as a punishment. A video which captured the controversial act was subsequently telecast over leading local TV stations as well as on various social media platforms, he added. Speaking further, he noted that the actions of the principal cannot be condoned in any way and that stern punishment would be meted out to her in order to set a precedent to others who may be prompted to follow in her footsteps. BY Udaya Ranaweera – Matara

title: Veddas’ access to forest blocked
author: Author not found
Content: A group of Rathugala Veddas have spoken against the blocking of their access to the forest due the mining taking place, allegedly with the support of wildlife officers. They noted that the Department of Wildlife has informed them that 10 identification cards have been distributed to 10 indigenous people and each of them are entitled to take 10 others along with them when entering the Nilgala forest. Further, they observed that whilst they have traditionally entered the Nilgala forest to fish in the Senanayake Samudraya, their leader was arrested recently for having entered it. They added that they have been deprived of access to their basic needs, including fish and other medicinal herbs, noting that wildlife officers have been involved in mining and permitting several other illegal activities within the forest. BY Bingun Menaka Gamage

title: Exam Dept team probes Ehetuwewa school exam issue
author: Author not found
Content: Commissioner General of Examinations L.M.D. Dharmasena said a team of officials have been deployed to investigate the issues faced by students of a school in Ehetuwewa during the Grade 5 scholarship examination held on 18 December. He said the question papers have been taken back from the students 30 minutes after distribution adding that the teacher responsible for the incident has collected the papers before the stipulated time in contravention to the rules on the collection of papers and without following instructions of seniors. The said team recorded statements from the students who faced issues during the examination. Dharmasena said, the report on the initial investigations into the incident will be submitted to the investigation unit of the Department of Examinations. Dharmasena noted thereby that a final decision will be taken after considering the reports on the relevant incident and following discussions with the Secretary of the Ministry of Education. By Bingun Menaka Gamage

title: Woman reprimanded for calling Police to frighten child
author: Author not found
Content: A woman was sternly reprimanded by the Police when she called the Police Emergency Number 119, to complain that her child was not going to bed on time, requesting that they frighten the child. In the complaint, the mother said both she and her family members were being harassed by the child who is in Grade 3. Following the call to 119, two Police officers, from Dambulla Police, visited the house. The woman then said she lodged the complaint due to her inability to ‘make’ her child to go to bed around 6:30 p.m. She added that as her child refused to go to bed and as he continued to ‘mock’ other members of her family, she decided to summon the Police to frighten the child. The two Police officers sternly reprimanded the mother against her conduct and advised her not to waste time of the Police over such matters. BY K.K. Ariyadasa – Dambulla

title: UNHCR appeals all to rescue those in distress, thanks SL
author: Author not found
Content: The 104 rescued Rohingyas are currently in Kakensanthurai (KKS), in the Northern Province and would be produced before the KKS Magistrate today (20), new Navy Spokesman Captain Gayan Wickremesuriya said. He told Ceylon Today that there were 23 children, four young girls and 29 women and the rest were men between the ages of 18 and 23. There was also an elderly person over the age of 70 who was treated at the KKS base hospital after becoming ill while travelling for more than a week. He also said, they are from Myanmar and it still needs to be verified to which community they belong. Their language is not understood and assistance was sought to clarify matters. According to the Navy Spokesman, they are all in good health and are currently being guarded by the Police at the Navy camp. They are being fed by the Navy. He said, Navy’s three patrol boats, one gun boat and two Dovra went on rescue operation and brought them ashore at KKS. The stranded Rohingyas were located in the Andaman Sea but close to the Sri Lankan territorial waters. According to reports, the distressed vessel entered Sri Lanka’s territorial waters on late Saturday night after experiencing a technical problem while transporting these individuals from Myanmar to Indonesia. According the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) and Rohingya activists it is reported that another two boats with about 200 Rohingyas are now adrift in the Strait of Malacca. They reportedly began their journey from the coast of Bangladesh late last month and some of them reportedly died amid shortage of food and water for more than a week. The UNHCR last week repeated its earlier appeal to rescue the Rohingyas, who otherwise, risk death. “We are grateful to the Sri Lankan Navy and all who have acted to save lives,’’ said Indrika Ratwatte, UNHCR’s Director for Asia and the Pacific. “This is an example in humanity that all States in the region must follow to promptly and swiftly act to prevent the tragic loss of life at sea,” he added. The UNHCR is providing support to the Sri Lankan authorities for the immediate needs of those who were rescued. Also, the UNHCR yesterday (19) said it repeats its appeal to all responsible States to rescue those in distress and adrift on the boats, allowing them to safely disembark in line with legal obligations and humanitarian traditions. It remains concerned on reports of another boat in distress in the Bay of Bengal, near the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Some 161 refugees have been reported dead or missing at sea in 2022. Quick action is needed to save lives and avoid further deaths, it said. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan

title: Vietnam suicide victim cremated in Chavakachcheri
author: Author not found
Content: Sundaralingam Kiritharan of Chavakachcheri, who took his life in Vietnam, after boarding an illegal boat to Canada, was cremated yesterday in the presence of his family and relatives. To get to Canada, he and 302 other Sri Lankans attempted a perilous maritime journey in a fishing boat. However, when the boat started to sink close to Indonesia, the coast guards of Singapore were alerted by a Japanese ship. The boat was slowly drifted to a location in Vietnam in the part of rescue mission. The Foreign Ministry confirmed on 24 November that one of the 303 refugees, who sought refuge in Vietnam, had committed suicide. He was rushed to the hospital where he died.  The rescued persons, all from the Northern Province, refused to come back to Sri Lanka. They were detained in the camp there. Two Sri Lankans tried to kill themselves in protest against the Vietnamese authorities’ efforts to send them to Sri Lanka through the International Organisation of Migration (IOM). Immediately after that both of them were admitted to the hospital, one of them died after being in critical condition. The IOM yesterday said around 153 of those now in Indonesia would be returning to Sri Lanka in the coming days. The body of the deceased was sent to Sri Lanka on Saturday (17) after his wife and children wanted to see his body. The wife was pleading to help repatriate his body to show her children as she won’t be able to otherwise comfort them. The last rites of Sundaralingam were performed at his residence and he was later cremated according to Hindu rites. By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan and T. Pratheepan

title: Programme to Make IT Sector Major Forex Earner Launched
author: Author not found
Content: State Minister of Technology Kanaka Herath said, a comprehensive programme has been launched to make the IT sector a major foreign exchange earning industry in Sri Lanka, adding that it has been possible to earn 1,500 million US dollars in foreign exchange through the IT industry in 2021. He mentioned this while participating in an observation visit recently to assess the quality of studies in the LIGHTING DIGITAL information technology training bootcamp, which began at the Avissawella Batangala Youth Training Centre. About 180 young people from the Kegalle District participated in this residential training camp organised by The Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka. During this occasion, Herath had a casual meeting with the students of the training camp. He then addressed the media stating that there are approximately 20,000 IT job openings in the public and private sectors and it is the Ministry of Technology’s responsibility to mobilise the young people required for this industry. Hence, to meet the needs of the industry, information technology will be introduced as an A-level subject in the arts stream. “For this, with the assistance of UNICEF, 700 teachers are given training in information technology, NVQ syllabuses are revised as required by the job market throughout tertiary education, the development of an overall digital education policy has begun. Approximately 50,000 people work directly in the field of information technology, they have also made significant contributions to the country’s ability to earn foreign currency. 34,000 youths will be directed to the field in 2023 through the implementation of LIGHTING DIGITAL IT training bootcamps at the district level,” he said. Sudath Manjula, Kegalle District Member of Parliament, Damidu Shamindra, the Chairman of the Dehiovita Pradeshiya Sabha, Kasun Tharaka, Senior Manager,  Capacity Building at the Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka (ICTA) were present for this observation visit along with other officials from ICTA.

title: SLAF wins National Productivity Gold Award 2020
author: Author not found
Content: Sri Lanka Air Force secured the Gold Award for the Public Sector, Inter Departments Category, at the ‘National Productivity Awards 2020’ ceremony held at the Temple Trees on 15 December 2022. They thus became the first-ever organisation in the country to secure the ‘Gold Award’ for the third consecutive year. The National Productivity Secretariat (NPS), attached to the Ministry of Labour and Foreign Employment, organised the ‘National Productivity Awards 2020’. This competition recognises the organisations which have been successful in incorporating productivity concepts and best practices in respective organisations. The purpose of the entire endeavour, as emphasised by the NPS, is to create more effective and citizen-focused government services and to raise the overall productivity of the entire nation. The ‘Gold Award’, in this contest, is awarded to organisations that have consistently maintained outstanding methodologies while also previously earning the ‘Productivity Award’ in a certain category. Whereas winning the ‘Gold Award’ for two consecutive years in 2015 and 2018, the Sri Lanka Air Force applied for the ‘Gold Award’ for a third time this season in 2020. The National Productivity Secretariat evaluated the application prepared by SLAF addressing all the criteria required for the competition. The team of audit experts from National Productivity Secretariat carried out verification visits at SLAF Establishments covering the areas of Operational, Engineering, Training, Research & Development and Welfare. The SLAF participated in this competition as one entity by achieving a higher level of improvement in applying productivity concepts in all the above areas and secured the ‘Gold Award’ for the third time. Director Air Operations, Air Vice Marshal Bandu Edirisinghe accepted the award on behalf of the Commander of the Sri Lanka Air Force, Air Marshal Sudarshana Pathirana from the Chief Guest of the Ceremony, Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena. Command Quality Assurance Officer Air Commodore Muditha Mahawattage and a team of Officers also attended the awards ceremony. Command Quality Assurance Inspectorate is the main division that imposes maintenance policies, auditing and reviewing the standards of all the Air Force establishments. The prestigious Gold Award was handed over to the Commander of the Air Force, Air Marshal Sudarshana Pathirana at his office by the Command Quality Assurance Officer, Air Commodore Muditha Mahawattage.

title: India, China’s concerns about use of nuclear weapons have impacted Russia
author: Author not found
Content: Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) Chief William Burns said Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chinese President Xi Jinping’s concerns about the use of nuclear weapons, have had an impact on Russia. “I think it has also been very useful that Xi Jinping and Prime Minister Modi in India have also raised their concerns about the use of nuclear weapons as well. I think that’s also having an impact on Russia,” Burns said during an interview with the PBS. Burns, during the interview, said he doesn’t see any clear evidence today of Russia’s plans to use tactical nuclear weapons. According to Burns, Russian President Vladimir Putin’s saber-rattling is only meant to intimidate. Earlier, Putin acknowledged that the conflict in Ukraine is going to take a while. He also warned of the increasing threat of nuclear war Putin, while speaking at a meeting of Russia’s Human Rights Council at the Kremlin, said that Moscow will fight by “all available means at their disposal.” He called it a special military operation. “With regard to the protracted nature of the special military operation and its results, of course, it’s going to take a while, perhaps,” he said, according to a report in CNN. According to the same report, Putin, without categorically ruling out the first use of nuclear weapons, said he viewed the Russia nuclear arsenal as a deterrent rather than a provocation. Putin said that Russia has a strategy, and they strike in response. He said the country considers the use of nuclear weapons for defence, they call it a retaliatory strike. “That is, when we are struck, we strike in response,” he said. According to CNN, The Russian leader said that the United States’ nuclear weapons were located in large numbers on European soil, while Russia had not transferred its nuclear weapons to other territories and is not planning to do so, but “will protect its allies with all the means at its disposal, if necessary.” Putin said, Russians are aware of what nuclear weapons are. They have more advanced and modern weapons than those of any other nuclear country. “But we are not going to brandish these weapons like a razor, running around the world,” he said. (ANI)

title: Ports Ministry says Harin’s statement ‘NOT TRUE’
author: By Sulochana Ramiah Mohan
Content: The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation has categorically stated that there is no truth to the claims made by Minister of Tourism Harin Fernando, during the Mumbai tourism roadshow, that an Indian investor might take control of the three main airports in Sri Lanka, including the BIA. The Tourism Minister, speaking at the Outbound Travel Mart (OTM), India’s leading and only travel show focused on outbound travel, said, “I will break the news that Indian companies are taking our three airports which is going to be a phenomenal decision to really help us. The fuel tanks are taken by the Indian companies, the solar power projects are also taken by the Indians.” Further, the Minister of Tourism also told a Hindu Businessline journalist and the Hindustan Times, Pune News and many other Indian media outlets that were present at the roadshow that discussions are underway between the two sides, potentially involving management contracts. The newspaper quoted Minister Fernando as stating that the Adani Group is in negotiations with Sri Lankan authorities to manage three airports in the island nation, including the BIA. He mentioned plans to collaborate with the Adani Group for airport management, as reported by Businessline on the sidelines of the OTM show in Mumbai. Sources informed Ceylon Today that Minister Fernando has been requested to provide clarification on the matter, as the Sri Lankan Government has no plans to allocate shares to any foreign investors for the BIA or the Ratmalana International Airport. The only finalised agreement concerns the sale of the Mattala Airport to a Russo-Indian joint venture. According to the Aviation Ministry, the statement made by Minister Fernando during the Mumbai roadshow regarding the transfer of the three airports to an Indian investor was misleading information. The Government has clarified that there are no such plans in place for such a transfer. Additionally, the State-Owned Enterprise Restructuring Unit has stated that they have no knowledge of the developments regarding the airport proposals. Ceylon Today has previously reported that the Mattala Airport will be managed by Russia’s Airports of Regions Management Company (AR), in collaboration with an Indian firm, as a joint venture. Sources indicate that the Indian company involved in this venture is likely to be the Adani Group. Secretary of Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation K.D.S. Ruwanchandra, however, told Ceylon Today that discussions have led to an agreement to transfer the operations of MRIA to a private joint venture and it is being finalised, but the Secretary did not disclose the names of the investors.

title: Minister instructs to check bags of schoolchildren
author: Author not found
Content: Amidst fears of schoolchildren becoming victims of illegal drugs, the Ministry of Education has instructed the principals to obtain the support of teachers, prefects, and representatives of the school development societies, to check the bags of students if there is any necessity. This was decided at a special discussion, held yesterday (19), at the Ministry of Education. The meeting, on what measures that should to be taken to maintain conducive learning environment in schools, was chaired by Minister of Education Susil Premajayantha. This meeting was attended by officials from the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Health, as well as several stakeholders. Furthermore, there was a lengthy discussion about future steps that can be taken to make the school premises a pleasant place for children.

title: Legal action taken against 14
author: Author not found
Content: The Panadura PHI’s Office announced that following raids conducted by them they had instituted legal action against 14 shops and boutiques within the purview of the Panadura MC and PS for having put on sale food items which were unfit for consumption. They said they had also sternly warned 10 traders against their future conduct in this connection, while unhygienic food items on display at four shops had been destroyed. The Panadura PHI’s Office stated that they had conducted the raids on a few selected trade stalls and shops ahead of the impending Christmas season. BY Sumith Ranawaka-Pothupitiya

title: Beggars menace in Galle
author: Author not found
Content: Mayor of Galle Priyantha Sahabandu said a survey conducted by the Galle Municipal Council revealed that 34 beggars were spread across the Galle District. He said the issue of beggars had already become a burden to society and that the Municipal Council is working hard to resolve it to the best of their ability. According to the Mayor, beggars have already taken over places like the Galle Bus Depot, Samanala Grounds, and the Public Fair. BY Kamal Wijehewa – Galle

title: Garbage dumping a threat to waterfall
author: Author not found
Content: Imbulpe PS member Indika Jayamanne said, due to the dumping of garbage released from the Sabaragamuwa University near the Surathali waterfall, at Pambahinna on the Colombo-Badulla main road, the scenic beauty of the area and the waterfall could be affected. He said a large pile of garbage, which had been brought in a few large Lorries had been dumped at the site in the night of 16 December. After a few residents had lodged complaints in this regard with the Samanalaweva Police, its OIC Chief Inspector Chinthaka Weerasinghe had deployed a team to probe the incident and they had arrested two suspects on 18 December. When contacted the Vice Chancellor of the University Prof. Udaya Ratnayake stated that they had handed over the garbage disposal contract to a private firm. He added that the private firm in question had failed to dispose of the garbage properly and warned they will be instituting legal action against them. BY S. Weerawansa – Kalthota

title: No Ayur Dept reps in Nutrition Committees
author: Author not found
Content: There are no representatives from the Ayurveda Department in Nutrition Committees that has been formed at regional level, though its reps are involved at District Committees level, Indigenous Medicine and PHI Officer Dr. Lakshantha Gunasinghe said. He said the officials from the Ayurveda Department take part in the said Committees based on the skills of the doctors. He added that during policy determination, the Ayurveda Department is represented at the Food Security Committee but that is not the case when it comes to the Nutrition Committee. BY D. Wanniarachchi – Kandy

title: Hanaa Singer meets President
author: Author not found
Content: Hanaa Singer, the Resident Coordinator of the United Nations Organisation in Sri Lanka, who is leaving upon completion of her service, met President Ranil Wickremesinghe at the Presidential Secretariat yesterday morning (19). The President engaged in cordial conversation with Singer and thanked her for the services she had rendered to this country and wished her the best of luck in her future endeavours. Singer has served as the Resident Coordinator of the United Nations in Sri Lanka since 7 September 2018.

title: POINt Pedro UC Chairman Quits
author: Author not found
Content: TNA Point Pedro Urban Council Chairman Y. Iruthayaraja resigned from his position yesterday (19), amidst rumours that the Opposition and some ruling party members has united to defeat the amended budget for the year 2023. The Point Pedro Urban Council was to convene yesterday at 9.30 a.m. to debate the pros and cons of amended budget for 2023. However, Iruthayaraja left the Urban Council premises after handing over his resignation letter to the Secretary of the Urban Council. The Secretary informed the Unban Council about the resignation and said activities of the UC will be suspended until a new Chairman is appointed after publishing the gazette notification. When the Budget for 2023 was presented on 5 December it was defeated as one member of TNA, 6 Tamil Thesiya Makkal Munnani and one member of Eelam People’s Democratic Party (EPDP) members cast their votes against the Budget. Altogether seven members had cast their votes in favour of the budget. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Title not found
author: Author not found
Content: Date:  State Minister of Education S. Aravind Kumar said the Government has no intention of conducting any election in the near future. He was speaking at a media briefing in Hatton yesterday (19). The State Minister was in Hatton to meet school principals to resolve pressing issues faced by the students and teachers. Kumar noted that it would not be prudent to stage any election at a time when the country is yet struggling to recover from its economic meltdown. He said from information available to him the Government has no intention of conducting any election at this time. He also mentioned that his Ministry was taking all possible steps to rid the country’s schools from the scourge illegal drugs and he sought the media’s support towards that endeavour. BY Neeta Pathma Kumari – Norwood Popular

title: Rs 657M as compensation for farmers
author: Author not found
Content: The Agriculture and Agrarian Insurance Board(AAIB)  has made arrangements to distribute Rs 657 million, from the money allocated by the government, to compensate farmers who suffered crop damage in the 2021-22 Maha season. Taking into account the damage caused to crops due to drought, floods and wild elephants, especially in the Maha season of 2021-22, steps have been taken to award such compensation. Accordingly, arrangements have been made to provide compensation to 31,613 farmers for 42,934 acres. Minister of Agriculture Mahinda Amaraweera further said that it has been decided to raise the insurance amount per acre for paddy, maize, potato, chilli, onion and soya bean to Rs 100,000.  The Government will contribute Rs 40,000, and farmers can contribute the remaining Rs 60,000 by paying Rs 6,400 per season. Amaraweera also said that since the damage caused by wild animals and the Fall Army worm (sena caterpillar) has aggravated, farmers will be able to get some relief in case of crop damage. Anuradhapura District has the highest level of compensation with Rs 81 million being set aside while Rs 69 million has been allocated for Manampitiya in Polonnaruwa and Rs 68 million for Moneragala. Meanwhile, Minister Amaraweera recently handed over crop damage compensation to ten farmers at the Buttala Agricultural Service Centre, symbolising compensation for farmers harmed by the Sena caterpillar.

title: Job cheat arrested
author: Author not found
Content: An individual who swindled large sums of money from a number of young persons, promising to secure jobs for them in State institutions, was arrested in Badulla. According to the Badulla Police, the suspect had asked the victims to send a particular sum of money to him via money orders if they wanted to get jobs in State institutions. Complaints had been filed against the suspect in Badulla, Mahiyangana and Hali-ela Police. The Crime Prevention Division at Badulla Police had launched inquiries to arrest the suspect, following those complaints. Preliminary Police inquiries revealed that the suspect is a 46-year-old resident of Badulla. The suspect robbed the register book kept at Badulla Public Library to record the details of persons. He then called the victims and obtained their trust, promising to get them jobs in the government sector. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: Severe bad weather alert for N&E
author: Author not found
Content: Assistant Director of Media and Public Relations of Disaster Management Centre (DMC) Janaka Handunpathiraja said yesterday (19) that as the low pressure zone developing in the Bay of Bengal intensifies, the country, particularly the Northern and Eastern Provinces, will experience thundershowers or heavy showers with lightning and strong gusty winds over the next few days beginning yesterday. He said the DMC has warned people in the Northern Provinces to be vigilant and cautious in order to prevent damage to property and lives. According to Handunpathiraja, the DMC has warned people to take extra care of their livestock during the said period. The deep sea and shallow sea fishermen and other seafarers have been asked to refrain from navigating in the seas, especially in the Eastern seas until the next notice, Handunpathiraja added. By Naalir Jamaldeen

title: 300,000 left for foreign employment this year – Manusha
author: Author not found
Content: Minister of Labour and Foreign Employment Manusha Nanayakkara said, over 300,000 Sri Lankans have left the country this year for foreign employment. Nanayakkara said yesterday (18) at an event commemorating International Migrants Day that this was the highest number of Sri Lankans leaving for foreign jobs in the country’s post-independence history. “The remittances they send will help Sri Lanka overcome the current economic crisis. Remittances sent by Sri Lankan foreign workers increased to 384.4 million US dollars in November 2022. The number has been steadily rising in recent months, and total remittances in the first 11 months of the year have exceeded 3.3 billion dollars,” he said. He also said steps have been taken to implement a vehicle import licence for expatriate workers as well as a humanitarian pension system. The Minister also said a special gate called ‘Hope Gate’ was opened at the airport to welcome migrant workers. He also said that beginning March next year; domestic workers will no longer be sent abroad and will be replaced by advanced housekeepers of international standard. BY Nabiya Vaffoor

title: ‘Ocean Odyssey’ reaches Colombo Port
author: Author not found
Content: The ship ‘Ocean Odyssey’ carrying 108 of America’s richest tourists arrived at the Colombo Port  yesterday (18) afternoon. The ship belongs to an American company and is 105 metres long and 18.5 metres wide. She arrived at the Colombo Port from the Cochin Port in India and is scheduled to set sail to the Trincomalee Port on 19 December. The shipping agent company ‘Dave Marine’ states that tourists on this ship will disembark at the Colombo Port and travel around Colombo, Kurunegala Habarana, Sigiriya and Trincomalee by luxury bus for about two- and- a- half days and board the ship again from the Trincomalee Port on 21 December. Then ‘Ocean Odyssey’ is scheduled to sail from Trincomalee to Thailand on 21 December at 7:00 PM. Marking the arrival of the ship for the first time at the Colombo Port, the ceremonial exchange of light took place between the Minister of Ports, Shipping and Aviation Nimal Siripala de Silva and the ship’s captain. A group of officials from the Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Aviation Services, Port Authority and Shipping Agent Company participated in this event.

title: 42 CCTV FOOTAGE EXAMINED
author: Author not found
Content: At least 42 CCTV footages have been examined in connection with the investigation into the controversial murder of Non-Executive Director Janashakthi Life Insurance Co. Ltd Dinesh Schaffter, who was found unconscious at the Borella Cemetery, and was later pronounced dead, a senior Police Officer said. CCTV footage was examined on the road that connects Flower Road, Cinnamon Gardens, where Schaffter lived to Borella Cemetery. On 15 December, around 5.00 am, an executive officer and an employee of Borella Cemetery saw Schaffter in the car, with his hands and neck tied with wires, untied the wires and admitted him to the Colombo National Hospital, where he died five hours later while receiving treatment in the intensive care unit. According to Police, the executive officer went to the cemetery after receiving a call from the victim’s wife. The officer said statements had been obtained from the victim’s wife, as well as a well-known cricket commentator, Brian Thomas, and nearly twenty-five people, including Borella cemetery employees. Furthermore, an investigation into the mobile phone of Schaffter, who was killed, has begun, and the analysis reports of several other mobile phones are also being investigated, according to the official. According to the Police, Schaffter left home around 1:30 p.m. on 15 December and told his wife he was going to a meeting for half an hour. Schaffter also informed executive officer Chris Perera that he would be meeting Brian Thomas, Police said. The victim had put the tower location on the executive officer’s mobile phone in the model farm area, according to police investigations. According to the investigation, Schaffter, who was killed, had made plans to travel to England with his wife at around 8.15 p.m. on the day of the murder. Investigation also revealed that his wife has been calling him from time to time as they planned to travel to  BIA around 4 p.m. Meanwhile, in connection with the murder, Youtuber Chamuditha Samarawickrama was summoned to the Homicide and Organized Crime Investigation Division of CID, where his statement was obtained for nearly two and a half hours, according to Police sources. According to Police sources, Samarawickrama has been questioned about the interview he conducted last Friday on a YouTube channel with Keerthi Ratnayake, a former Air Force officer. Investigations are being conducted on the orders of SSP Hemal Prashantha, Director of the CID, Homicide and Organized Crime Investigation Division to apprehend the suspects in the mysterious murder of Schaffter. BY Bimal Jayasinghe – Colombo

title: Two Iranians with fake passports deported
author: Author not found
Content: Two Iranians who entered Sri Lanka using forged passports and attempted to flee to Stockholm, Sweden were apprehended in the early hours of 17 December at the BIA arrival’s terminal. Immigration officials have taken steps to deport them back on the same plane they arrived on. Among them is a 41-year-old Iranian national who works as a musician. The other Iranian, 50, is a professional photographer. The two had arrived at the BIA from Kuwait at 3.30 a.m. on Al Jazeera flight J-9551 on 17 December.  When they presented their Norwegian passports to obtain visa approval to enter Sri Lanka, immigration officials identified them as fake and referred them to the Katunayake Airport Border Enforcement Unit officers. These passports have been found to be fake. The two Iranians intended to spend two days in Sri Lanka before fleeing to Stockholm, Sweden. They had forged the United Arab Emirates immigration stamps in the Norwegian passports to accomplish this. They had paid a Turkish broker 20,000 euros to arrange these two fake Norwegian airline tickets. That sum is equal to Rs 7,780,000 in local currency. Further, they have declared to Immigration officials that all of their money was stolen by the broker. During preliminary investigations, Katunayake Airport immigration officials found that they had attempted to flee the country due to political unrest in Iran. After arresting them, while inspecting their belongings, immigration officers found their original Iranian passports hidden in their luggage. The two Iranian were then deported to Kuwait on 17 December at 5.28 a.m. on the same Al Jazeera flight J-9552. Investigations and deportation were carried out by MMSN Gunasekara and MA Hettiarachchi under the instructions and supervision of RRGB Ranasinghe, Chief Immigration Officer. BY T. K. G. Kapila – Katunayake

title: Politicians must retire at 60 – Maha Sangha
author: Author not found
Content: The Maha Sangha is of the view that local politicians should voluntarily retire at the age of 60 and give opportunities to young people who can work. If doctors, engineers, and other professionals in the State service retire at the age of sixty, the same law must apply to all politicians, according to Venerable Kappitiyagoda Sirivimala Thera, Anunayake of the Rajopavanaramadhipati Ramanna Nikaya of Gatambe. He was speaking at the  Gatambe Vihara when Prof. G.L. Peiris paid a visit yesterday (18). “The Prime Minister has issued a circular in this regard stating that at the age of sixty, all State employees should retire. This means that after the age of sixty, people experience physical, mental, and health problems, as well as other weaknesses, so the retirement age has been set at sixty years, as recommended by doctors. How can politicians work after sixty years?” he queried. Speaking further, he said the same law should apply to politicians as well. Otherwise it was a grave  injustice for retire only state employees to retire at sixty. “How can politicians work if state employees cannot? This is an amusing fact. We, the Maha Sangha, believe that politicians in this country should voluntarily retire at the age of 60 and make opportunities available to young people who can work. Otherwise, there is no reason to stay in Parliament until you walk with a walking stick. Many people define public service as serving themselves. Because of the privileges, many do not even consider retiring from Parliament,” he said. Speaking further, the Thera highlighted that this system should be changed and that youth groups should be given opportunities, adding that Parliament was the most powerful place in the country to take decisions and make laws.”How can people who can’t think and whose health has deteriorated work to build a country?” he queried. “If there are academics or other people over the age of sixty, they can get their services by forming a voluntary parliamentary advisory council. The masses are unable to bear the burden of life. Despite claims that there is no money to do anything in the country, the number of ministers continues to grow. They are attempting to spend and sell the country’s resources to accomplish this,” he said. The Thera also requested that all such things should stop, that political opinions be set aside and that everyone should come together and work to lift the country out of the abyss it has fallen into, even if only for a short time. BY K. L. Suraweera – Kandy
